loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Zainab M.. She is married and has four children ages 4, 8, 10 and 15. In 2000, Zainab established her foods business where she sells palm oil and rice. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her family and make a profit. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to  purchase more stock (20 cases of palm oil @ Le90,000 and 15 of rice bags @ Le105,000) She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Zainab plans to educate her children to college level and help her husband to build a house for the family. She would also like to become a supplier to other retailers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson M. O. is sixty years old and married.  His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores and they have eight children between the ages of thirty three years old and seventeen years old. 

Wilson sells newspapers to passerby near a stage at Kawangware in Nairobi.  He has been in this business for fourteen years now.  He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints.  He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.  He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy newspapers to grow his business by serving more people.  He hopes that in future, he will diversify his business by opening a general store.  He also sees himself buying a plot of land in which he will build a better home for his family.  He describes himself as patient and aggressive.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers for sale.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda S. is from the village of Naggasican Santiago City. She is 30 years old. Criselda is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Criselda owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling street food and frozen food. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Criselda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Criselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Criselda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia D. 25 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, vive con su familia conformada por: su esposo y un hijo D. un año D. edad, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, este oficio lo inicio con ayuda D. su esposo, no tiene un horario especifico para atender los oficios que implica y actualmente necesita D. un préstamo para comprar cerdos, ya que entre más pueda tener es mejor para el momento D. comercializar, a parte que este negocio es la fuente D. ingreso para el hogar, por lo tanto debe permanecer varios cerdos en la granja.
Espera realizar una buena compra que le permita en un futuro tener ingresos, aunque siempre tiene un riesgo es que se le enfermen y puedan morir. Pero Claudia es muy optimista y considera que todo le saldrá bien creciendo con el negocio y aumentar su clientela con esto pues que sea más estable su condición económica.
texts.en:
Claudia is 25 years old and she lives in Santa Elena in the department of Usulutan. She lives with her family, which is maD. up of her husband and her 1-year old son. She has a pig farm and she started this business together with her husband. She doesn't have a specific schedule to attend to the business. She requires a loan to purchase pigs. The more livestock she is able to have the better it will be when it's time to sell. This business is the source of income for the household and so she needs to always have many pigs in the farm. 

She hopes to acquire a good buy which will help her obtain better earnings in the future, although there is always a risk that the livestock might fall ill or die. Claudia is very optimistic and she believes that everything will be well with the expansion of her business. She will increase her clientele with this support and she will gain greater financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo López A. tiene 45 años de edad concubinos con la Señora. Segundina Miranda Montecinos mas de 10 años tienen 4 hijos menores viven en casa prestada solo pagan de luz y agua en sindicato Rosario a 52 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

El señor Gerardo es agricultor produce papa, papaliza, haba y cría ganado vacuno necesitan capital para comprar abono orgánico ya que en esta época el abono esta barato y ellos no tienen todavía ingresos económicos de la producción agrícola, el señor Gerardo es una persona humilde trabajadora y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. Se tomo la iniciativa de acudir  a la zona a otorgar crédito, el Sr Gerardo está muy contento de saber que puede conseguir  un crédito, para poder comprar el abono orgánico oportunamente y alistar para la siembra de este año,  así tendrá ahorro para el estudio de sus hijos y para construir su casa ese es su mayor sueño tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo López A. is 45 years old and has lived with Ms. Segundina Miranda Montecinos for over 10 years. They have 4 young children who are living in a house that has been loaned to them in which they only pay for electricity and water. They live in the trade union of Rosario 52 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

Gerardo is a farmer who grows potatoes, papalizas (South American potato), beans, and raises cattle. They need capital to buy organic fertilizer since  fertilizer is cheap at this time yet they still do not have income from their agricultural production. Gerardo is a humble, responsible and hard working man. For him it is very difficult to go to the banks in the city because they have many requirements. He takes the initiative to go to the area where they extend credit. Gerardo is very happy to know that he can get a loan to buy organic fertilizer at the appropriate time for planting this year. He will be saving for their childrens' studies and to build a house. It is his greatest dream to have his own home.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Sicap Mbao Group

texts.fr:
Apec Al Ouma Sicap M. groupe 2 est un sous groupe mixte composé de 20 personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier de la localité de Sicap M.. Ils exercent un commerce de produits très diversifiés. Ils capitalisent  une expérience de plusieurs années dans leurs activités respectives. La cellule de Sicap M. est affiliée a l’association Al Ouma.L e sous groupe est représenté par madame Aminata N. qui exerce l'activité de mareyeuse depuis plus d'une dizaine d'années. Elle a choisi son activité dans l'objectif de gagner sa vie a travers les bénéfices réalisés. Le groupe est sociétaire du guichet de Dalifort depuis février 2011.Il sollicite un crédit de 2 000 000 fca qui est destiné à renforcer le fond de roulement des différents bénéficiaires en vue de mieux développer leur activité de commerce.Le montant emprunté sera destiné a l'achat de poissons, de produits locaux, de tissus et d'autres produits divers destinés a la vente pour les besoins du commerce des différents bénéficiaires des membres du sous-groupe. L’accroissement de leurs bénéfices pourra les aider a mieux gérer leurs besoins personnels et de mieux participer a l’entretien de leurs familles. 
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients
texts.en:
Apec Al Ouma Sicap M. Group 2 is a diverse sub-group made up of 20 people, all living in the same neighborhood of the Sicap M. district.  Their business deals with a wide range of products.  They have the advantage of multiple years of experience working in their respective businesses.  The Sicap M. group is an affiliate of the Al Ouma association.  They are represented by Ms. Aminata N. who has been a fishseller for the past 12 years. She chose this business in order to make a living through her profits. This group is a member of the Dalifort branch of UIMCEC since February 2011. They are asking for a loan of 2,000,000 FCFA which will be used as working capital by the group members so that they can expand their businesses. The members will use their parts of the loan to buy products such as fish, local products, fabric and others in order to be resold by the different members of the group. Increasing their profits can help them to better handle their personal needs and better contribute to their families’ well-being.

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 

Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has broadened its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in 2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: to buy fish, spare parts, local products and cleaning products

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo tiene 59 años, está casado con la Sra. Mirian con quien tienen dos hijos: un varón ya mayor quien también tiene su propia familia y una hija que está estudiando en el colegio, en la secundaria.
Pablo se dedica a la chapería, empezó a trabajar en esta profesión desde muy pequeño como ayudante de un tio y luego de aprender el oficio se independizó y empezó a comprar de a poco sus herramientas, ya luego sus maquinarias para el doblado de las chapas.
Su señora le ayuda a levantar los pedidos y ofrecer sus productos en algunos casos cuando no tiene trabajo, porque en la mayoria de las veces ya trabaja con Arquitectos e Ingenieros de Obras.
Ellos actualmente están alquilando una casa en la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde viven y trabajan, pero gracias a las ganancias que tienen están construyendo una casa en otra ciudad a 45 Km de Caacupe.
El solicita el préstamo para poder comprar chapas galvanizadas y estaños.
texts.en:
Pablo is 59 years old and has two children with his wife, Mirian. His son is grown and has his own family now and his daughter is currently in secondary school.

Pablo is a metalworker; he began in this profession when he was very young, as an assistant to his uncle. He later trained in metalworking and started his own business, buying the tools he needed over time to work with metal sheeting. His wife helps him pick up orders and sell his products when she doesn't have work. Usually, Pablo works with architects or civil engineers.

Currently, Pablo and his family are renting a house in San Lorenzo city, where they live and work, but thanks to their business income they are building a house in another city 45 km from Caacupe. Pablo is requesting a loan to buy galvanized tin sheets.

loans.use: To purchase galvanized tin sheets.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Jessica has a little food stand, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Jessica hopes to own a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Juana Azurduy Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUANA AZURDUY” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la señora Olivia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de pasankalla, venta de dulces, venta de calzados de paceña, tejido de ropa de bebé.

La señora Olivia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que  forma parte de una Banca Comunal. En la actualidad tiene un negocio de  venta de comida desde hace seis años atrás.

El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para comprar arroz por mayor, para la preparación de la comida; la que comprará en la feria de la ex tranca; posteriormente que estén elaborados sus productos los vende en la feria de la zona Juana Azurduy. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a sus dos hijos, ya que ella es soltera.
texts.en:
The “JUANA AZURDUY” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Olivia.  The members of the communal bank are in varying businesses.  Among them are: clothing sales, food sales, pasankalla (grain snacks) sales, candy sales, Paceña shoes and infant wear making.

Olivia, president of the communal bank, indicates that this is the first time she’s been part of a communal bank.  She currently has a food sale business that she’s had for the last 6 years.

The loan she is requesting on this occasion is to buy rice at wholesale to prepare her food.  She will buy it at the Ex Tranca market and once her products are made she will sell them at the market in the Juana Azurduy neighborhood.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her two children however possible since she’s single.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Violeta works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from operating a piggery. Violeta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace makes a living by selling palm and palm kernel oil, soap, salt and other food items at a stall in the town of Elmina. She has received a senior high school level of education, is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Grace has been in her current line of work for the last eight years and is committed to help her husband provide for the daily needs of their family. She has applied for a loan to buy soaps, detergent and various food items to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the profits from her business to help provide her children with a university education.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 27 years old and married to Eliud.  The couple supports a family of four and her children are aged twelve, nine, six, and four years old.  She rears poultry on their farm and has been on the farm for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She has been given a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET which is her second loan, after she repaid the first loan successfully.  She wishes to use the money to purchase more chickens and  feed.  The profits will be used to expand her poultry farm and improve the welfare of her family.

She hopes to grow to greater heights in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Helcunida

texts.en: Helcunida, a 50-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 30 years, Helcunida has operated a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. Now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her business, she would like to save money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her shells crafting.

loans.name: Mery De Jesus

texts.es:
Mery D. Jesús desD. hace un año compra una tienda donD. trabaja con su hijo mayor, ella con su negocio quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida y sus ingresos económicos.

Su esposo ya no trabaja debido a sus problemas D. salud, por esto Mery es quien hoy sostiene su hogar con la tienda.

Ella quiere mejorar el surtido ya que su negocios ha sido muy acogido en el barrio, además así pueD. tener mejores ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en la salud D. él.
texts.en:
Mery D. Jesús bought a store a year ago, where she works with her oldest son.  Through her business she wants to improve her income and quality of life.

Her husband has health problems and is no longer able to work, so it’s she who supports the household through her store.

She wants to improve her selection, now that business has been welcomed in the neighborhood.  This will also allow her to have a better income and be able to help her husband with his health issues.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and married with three children who go to school. To earn a living, she sells clothes. She has been in this business for six years.  She was previously selling fruits to earn a living. She hopes to own a permanent business premises in the future. Mary has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes, bed covers, trousers and blouses to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes, bed covers, trousers and blouses

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is married with 3 children. Eleuteria is 63 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Eleuteria owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 8000 PHP to purchase products for her retail store.

Eleuteria has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Eleuteria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her retail store.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Desde las 3:00 de la mañana empieza la jornada laboral de Alfredo, un hombre luchador que trabaja incansablemente por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Este emprendedor inició con una bolsa de frutas vendiendo por las calles de su barrio, después tuvo la oportunidad de un punto de venta en el que trabaja diariamente. 

Alfredo necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor número de frutas y verduras y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Alfredo’s work day starts at 3am.  He’s a hardworking man that works tirelessly to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  This entrepreneur started out with a bag of fruit selling throughout his neighborhood’s streets.  Later on he got the opportunity to set up a sales point where he works daily.  He needs a loan to buy larger amounts of fruit and vegetables thus to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Batsanaa

texts.en: Batsanaa is 22 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  His wife works at the Snow White ice-cream factory and his daughter stays at home.  Batsanaa started to drive a taxi in 2009 which belonged to his father.  In 2010 he married and bought a new car for his taxi service.  He has developed a good business and good work experience.  He is a diligent and open-minded man who says, "I want to have a good car so that I can make more money and develop my life."  He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi service.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and is married with two grown children. She believes that determination and patience are the keys to success. She engages in a personal-care business selling detergent, soap, and shampoo in her community.

Edna is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more detergent, soap, and shampoo to generate additional income. She dreams of having her own stall someday for displaying her products.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap, and shampoo for resale

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.en:
Adrienne is married with two children aged 15 and 17. She sells fruits and vegetables at a market. She has been in this business for the last ten years. The business has enabled her to care for her children. 
Adrienne needs a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables in order to earn more profits. With her profits she will pay her children’s school fees and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mario Santiago

texts.es: Mario Santiago tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa, padre de un hijo. Se dedica a la crianza y destace de cerdo, desde hace más de 10 años. El es un hombre trabajador pues ha demostrado que le interesa el sacara a su familia adelante.   Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá invertir en la compra de cerdos las ganas de mejorar cada día han hecho que Mario se preocupe mas por aprender de su negocio.  Su sueño es expandir su negocio.
texts.en: Mario Santiago is 31 years old.  He lives with his wife and has one child.  His business is raising and slaughtering pigs and he has been in this business for more than ten years.  He is a hard-working man who has shown that he is interested in getting his family ahead in life.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to invest in buying some pigs.  His desire to keep improving has meant that Mario has taken more and more care to learn about his business.  His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Neyd

texts.es: Neyd, es una joven madre soltera de 19 años pues tiene una hija de 1 año de nacida. Vive con su hermano en la comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani, en la casa de su ex pareja quién le manda una mensualidad por manutención. Gracias a la preocupación y apoyo de  Ángel, su ex pareja, hacia su pequeña hija; Neyd ha podido abrir una tienda de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en la casa. Ahí se encarga de atender a sus clientes, que mayormente son sus vecinos. De la misma manera inauguró un restaurante, donde ofrece almuerzos y cenas. “No me puedo quejar, el padre de mi hija siempre nos ayuda, a pesar de que ya estemos separados”, menciona Neyd, “la tienda es rentable, cada 15 días voy a la ciudad de Pichanaki a comprar más insumos, al día mas o menos estoy ganando 40 soles”, agrega. Unos meses más adelante, ella espera implementar su restaurante, con el servicio de comida, ofreciendo desayuno, almuerzo, cenas y quizás atender con platos extras. Con el apoyo de su prima, quién cocina, anhelan captar clientes de la zona y hasta extranjeros, “todo depende de lo duro que trabajemos”, menciona, con una sonrisa esperanzadora y a la vez tierna. Con su ayuda, Neyd podrá obtener su primer crédito con MFP, por esa razón se muestra alentada, por que sabe que con el capital ella podrá iniciar su camino hacia la autosuperación. El dinero que piensa obtener lo destinará en la ampliación de su restaurante con la compra de mesas, sillas y estantes, así como adquirir una refrigeradora para mantener su alimento en buen estado.
texts.en: Neyd is a young, 19-year-old single mother who has a one-year-old daughter. She lives with her brother in the indigenous community of Pumpuriani. She lives in the house of her ex-partner, who sends her a monthly support payment. Thanks to the concern and support of Ángel, her ex-partner, for her little daughter, Neyd has been able to open a store selling groceries and other basic products in her home. There she deals with her customers, who for the most part are her neighbors. In the same way, she began a restaurant, where she offers lunches and dinners. "I cannot complain. The father of my daughter always helps us, in spite of the fact that we are separated," Neyd mentions. "The store is profitable. Every two weeks I go to the city of Pichanaki to buy more supplies. I am earning more or less 40 PEN (about $15) a day," she adds. In a few months, she hopes to enlarge and furnish her restaurant, with food service, offering breakfast, lunch, dinner, and perhaps serve a few extra dishes. With the support of her cousin, who cooks, they want to attract customers from their district and even outsiders. "Everything depends on how hard we work," she comments, with a smile that is hopeful and at the same time tender. With your help Neyd will be able to obtain her first loan through MFP, and for this reason she looks courageous, because she knows that with the capital she will be able to begin her journey to self improvement. The money that she hopes to obtain is destined for the enlargement of her restaurant with the purchase of tables, chairs, and shelves, as well as acquiring a refrigerator to keep her food in good condition.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and make the first payment for the purchase of a refrigerator.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 30 years old, single, and operates a farming business in his village. He lives simply with his parents. Everyday, he goes in the field, where he spends most of his time of the day. He was already trained in this type of work, so even though he works in the field for the whole day, it is nothing to him. The important matter is, he is providing for the needs of his parents.

As of now, he is asking for a loan amount of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, which will be used towards the growth of his corn field. He hopes that by this season, he can get better crop production to save for his parents' needs, especially since they are getting older. He is also preparing for his own future. Arman wants that his future family will be secure, so he is doing the best that he can.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in his corn field

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married and has two children.
 
Jessica has a sewing business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase textiles and accessories for dressmaking. 

Jessica has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and accessories for dressmaking.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Harriet has a food stall and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.

Harriet's goals and aspirations are to build her own house and to educate her children at the university level. She rents a house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees, rent, and food.

Harriet has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a farmer who lives in Roma Norte together with his wife and one child. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell. His wife also sells vegetables to the people in their place of residence for an additional income. The couple usually earns about P10,000 each month. The profits earned are just enough for the family's consumption. 
As of now he would like to improve his crop production so that he can make improvements to their living conditions. He has insufficient funds that is why he is asking for a loan of P10,000 in order to buy seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

Wilfredo hopes that through his patience, hardwork and God's guidance, he can lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: Elva es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Balcon Florido”  grupo que está conformado por 09 socios dedicados distintas actividades comerciales, también a la agricultura y ganadería. Elva tiene 36 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Hace más de 10 años Elva se dedica a la ganadería, actividad que siguió con el ejemplo de sus padres, ya que también se dedicaban a dicha actividad, con su esfuerzo y dedicación Elva ha mejorado su calidad de vida, pues ha podido instalar una tienda en su domicilio, y también comprar mas vacas. El deseo de Elva es de comprarse más vacas y así seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y sabemos que los préstamos de Edaprospo la ayudaran. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda. La Alcancía Comunal “Balcon Florido” es un grupo responsable, ellos agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Elva  is a member of the communal bank "Balcon Florido", a group made up of 9 members with different businesses including agriculture and ranching.  Elva is 36 years old.  She is separated and has 2 children, 1 of whom she still supports.  She has worked in ranching for over 10 years, an activity that she learned from her parents who also were in the same line of work.  With hard work and dedication, Elva has improved her quality of life and was able to set up a store in her home, as well as purchase more cows.  Elva wants to purchase more cows and continue improving her quality of life, and we know that loans from Edaprospo will help her.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase more grocery items such as rice, sugar, fideo pasta, and milk to better stock her store.  The communal bank "Balcon Florido" is a responsible group and they are thankful for this loan.

loans.use: to purchae rice, sugar, fideo pasta, and milk.

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Aline I fait partie du groupe Abizera  elle habite à Gitega. Elle  est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à François, commençant de souliers. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, l’un a 2 ans et l’autre 4ans.

Elle est  commerçante des souliers depuis 12ans.

Elle est à son sixième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et améliorer la situation de sa famille en achetant ce dont elle a besoin (habits, alimentation, payer la scolarité des enfants,…). 

Dans les prochaines  années,  elle pourra diversifier les produits de vente(les habits,…)
texts.en:
Aline lives in Gitega and belongs to the "Abizera" group. She is 39 years old and married to François, a shoe-seller. They have two children together, one of whom is 2 and the other is 4.

She has been selling shoes for 12 years.

She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and improve her family's situation by buying what she needs (clothing, food, paying for her children's education...).

In the coming years, she will be able to diversify the goods she sells (clothing,...).

loans.use: To increase her capital and improve her family's situation by buying what she needs (clothing, food, paying for her children's education, etc.)

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.fr: RIEN N'EST TARD est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Alice est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Alice âgée de 25 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Alice est mariée à certain Thibaut. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Alice et son mari. Pour cette raison, Alice vend des fruits de saison dans sa région depuis quinze ans environ. Alice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Alice sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saison.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.en:
Ms Tchotcho Thérèse Guedehoussou, the wife of L. H., was born on October 14, 1963 in Aného. Trained as a dressmaker, she is a hard-working woman who has been struggling on a daily basis to meet the needs of her four children, since her husband left home to live in Benin. Having found that dressmaking was not a paying proposition, she decided to open a little café, which she continues to operate enthusiastically. She also continues to sell clothing, which brings in additional income. Ms Guedehoussou now has many customers, and would like to increase her ability to meet the demand for her services.

She therefore requests a loan of $1,200 to enlarge her restaurant and to be able to purchase clothing for resale. Such initiative deserves to be encouraged, since if successful it will enable her to improve the life of her children and her family, of whom she is now the sole support.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Mme GUEDEHOUSSOU Tchotcho Thérèse épouse L. H. est née le 14 octobre 1963 à Aného. Couturière de formation, elle est une femme très courageuse qui se bat au quotidien pour assurer le minimum de bien-être pour ses 04 enfants, car son mari ayant abandonné le foyer pour aller s’établir au BENIN. Ayant constaté que son métier ne lui rapportait pas, elle a opté pour la création d’un mini restaurant qu’elle tient à ce jour avec beaucoup d’enthousiasme. Parallèlement, elle vend des tenues vestimentaires, ce qui lui procure un revenu supplémentaire. Aujourd’hui, la clientèle de Mme GUEDEHOUSSOU est très importante et elle voudrait élargir ses prestations en vue d’être à la hauteur de la demande. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1200 pour agrandir son restaurant et aussi disposer du fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des tenues vestimentaires. Une telle initiative mérite d’être encouragée car sa réalisation permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et de sa famille abandonnée à elle seule.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Hairdressing in Ghana is mostly considered as a vocation for illiterates and drop-outs. Edith has been able to prove many critics wrong. This is because she has just completed the tertiary level. This has made her a role model for a lot of girls in her community. To continue to be that role model, she will have to expand her business so as to put to use the knowledge she acquired from school and help the up-and-coming ones. She requires a loan of $750 to help her achieve her dream. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with its TEACH Lending program

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah wants to build a residential house

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca J. is 38 years old and single mother of two. The oldest is 17 and is doing junior high school in a private school in town; the youngest is 4 and is her everyday companion.

Blanca, like many other women, traveled to the capital several years back in the pursuit of better working opportunities. After several years and after saving some money she came back to her hometown, San Ignacio, to open up her own business downtown. Now, she is th owner of the shoe store.

Thanks to the credits she could attain, she was able to extend her business both in physical space and merchandise in stock. She sells all kinds of footwear for children, ladies and gentlemen.

She is doing fairly well since she has almost no competition. She travels once a month to the capital to bring the merchandise she sells. Today she is wishing to keep extending her business; she also wants to sell garments for ladies and gentlemen.

For that purpose, she is requesting a credit of $300 which she will use in purchasing her first garments to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La Sra. Blanca J. de 38 años de edad es madre soltera, de 2 hijos, la mayor tiene 17 años y está cursando la secundaria en un colegio privado de la ciudad; el menor tiene 4 años y es su compañero de todos los días. Blanca, al igual que muchas mujeres viajo hace varios años atrás a la capital a buscar mejores oportunidades laborales, luego de varios años y después de juntar un poco de dinero, volvió a su ciudad, San Ignacio, a abrir su propio negocio en el centro mismo de la ciudad, ella es dueña de una zapatería. Gracias a los créditos que obtenía ella pudo ir ampliando su negocio, tanto como en espacio físico así como en stock de mercaderías, ella vendo todo tipo de calzados para niños, damas y caballeros. Le va muy bien, pues no tiene casi competencia; ella viaja una vez al mes hasta la capital para traer sus mercaderías para vender. Hoy día está deseosa de seguir ampliando su negocio, por lo que desea vender también prendas para damas y caballeros, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 300 que los utilizará para comprar sus primeras prendas para la venta.

loans.use: Purchasing garments such as remeras , shirts, skirts and trousers

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirna Ruiz de Alarcon is 42 years old, married to Mario Alarcon (47 years old), and has four children. Of her children, the oldest is a 21 year-old who is pursuing a career in Business Administration at a private university. They both have an 18 year-old who plays soccer at a club in Asuncion, and a 14 and 13 year-old who are both in middle school.

Mirna and her husband have operated a mini-grocery store from their residence since 1994. Previously, their business was located in Market 4, Asuncion´s biggest, most popular public market. However, they decided to move the store to their home, a corner property situated at the intersection of two main streets.

Mirna and her hushand wish to invest the potential loan in the purchase of bulk merchandise such as a variety of pasta, sugar, rice, flour, and other food staples. They would also like to purchase a larger refrigerator so that they can increase the stock of cold beverages they offer to their customers.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Brigida María Acosta

texts.en:
Brigida, 32 years old, has been separated from her husband for two years. Now, she is living with her two children, a boy and a girl, that attend to the local public school. To earn a living, Brigida dedicates herself to the production and sale of decorative and aromatic candles.

She explains that this kind of business is very profitable. Generally, she invests about 5,000 Dominican pesos (USD 150) to purchase raw materials in order to make the candles; and she earns USD 400.00 more or less. With income from business, she pays the rent on the house, provides food for her children and buys fuel for the small oven with which she prepares the candles.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as paraffin wax, aromas and colourings so that she can produce a big quantity of candles to sell for Christmas. That will be an opportunity for Brigida to notably make more profit and continue doing the business which is helping her work for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Brigida will use the loan to purchase paraffin, wax and other raw materials for the fabrication of her decorative and aromatic candles.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: I am Amna B.. I am a mother of six: four boys and two girls. Currently, only the elder two attend school while the others are too small. My husband works for skimpy pay and I own a few cows and sell their milk. Last year, I took a loan for my business, which resulted in increased profits, and I was able to save $250. Now I wish to further expand my business and require a loan of $350 for this purpose.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil Takhmazov is a 28-year-old young businessman who lives with his wife and two children in an IDP camp in Bilasuvar region. Ramil's major source of income is from the sale of milk and yogurt from his one cow. But one cow does not provide enough milk to meet his family's expenses. Ramil is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase two more milk cows so he can improve his business and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Matrida M. is 29 years old. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 3 and 11. In 2002, Matrida established a crops business. Matrida has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase crops in bulk.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Veronica's Raha Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 27 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 9 and 6 years old, and 7 months. Veronica owns a small grocery store and sells cloth. She started in 2007 . Every day, she works from 6.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell food and decorations.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. is a trader who is married and has three children. He sells building materials and provisions. Business is booming and he wants to increase sales.

He is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for resale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a fifty-year-old entrepreneur and a proud mother of three sons that are in university.  Her husband passed away six months ago, and since then she has been obliged to support her sons' education on her own.  Justina explains that it is difficult for her sons to get a good job, and they cannot pay for their university studies.

Justina operates a small cafeteria which she started three years ago.  She’s requesting a loan to purchase materials in order to keep preparing her delicious hamburgers, cheeseburgers and natural juices for her growing clientele.
Justina would like to have money enough so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to keep preparing food for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Vidalina, Julia and Glendise belong to the Tulips Communal Bank.

Vidalina is a single mother. She is 34 years old and has 2 children. Vidalina sells clothes on credit. She carries out her sales with friends and family. Vidalina plans to partner with her sister to make articles of clothing. Sometimes Vidalina works in the country at harvest time.

On the other hand, Julia is a single mother and she is 52 years old. Julia sells chicha de jora (a traditional beverage made from corn) and chicha de 7 semillas (a traditional beverage made from diverse grains). She sells her product in the doorway of her home. In addition Julia sells delicacies.

Meanwhile Glendise is married. She is 37 years old and has 3 children. Glendise travels to the different open-air markets of the region 2 times a week where she buys grains and cheeses that she sells door to door.

Vidalina, Julia and Glendise need a loan of 1000 soles each, money that will be invested in the purchase of fabrics, rubber bands, delicacies, cheese, grains and 2 showcases for their products.

The dreams of Vidalina, Julia and Glendise are to build their own houses, to have a stable store and to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Vidalina, Julia y Glendise pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tulipanes.

Vidalina es madre soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina vende ropa a crédito, sus ventas los realiza a amigos y familiares, Vidalina tiene proyectado asociarse con su hermana para confeccionar prendas de vestir. Algunas veces Vidalina trabaja en el campo en época de cosecha.

Por otro lado Julia es madre soltera y tiene 52 años, Julia vende chicha de jora (bebida típica elaborada de maíz) y chicha de 7 semillas (bebida típica elaborada de diversos cereales), sus ventas los realiza en la puerta de su vivienda, además Julia vende golosinas.

Mientras que Glendise es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Glendise viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces por semana de donde compra cereales, quesos que vende de casa en casa.

Vidalina, Julia y Glendise necesitan un préstamo de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, ligas, golosinas, queso, cereales y 2 exhibidores para sus productos.

Los sueños de Vidalina, Julia y Glendise son construir su casa, tener una tienda estable y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, rubber bands, sweets, cheese and grains as well as 2 showcases for their products.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha, is a member of the Community Bank Molino of the Molino town, from the Juli district and province of Chucuito Juli, department of Puno. She harvests trout and sells groceries; her store is located in Sihuayro. She is 39 years old, studied elementary school, is mother of 4 kids and her husband lives in Tacna (another town) working for a company a year ago. She requested a loan because of lack of her own capital to improve the production of trout and her business, she received since 2006 S/. 300.00 new Soles, and she bought 7 sacks of food for trout. With this loan of S/. 800.00 new Soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 100 kilograms of rice, 2 bags of pasta, 100 kilograms of flour, a box of oil, among other things, so she will be able to increase her products and is very satisfied with the loan because it helps her improve her economic resources.
Her future vision is to be a entrepreneur and to export trout to other national and international markets.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha, es socia del Banco Comunal Molino del Centro Poblado Molino, del distrito de Juli y provincia de Chucuito Juli del departamento de Puno. Se dedica a la crianza de trucha y venta de abarrotes ubicado en la localidad de Sihuayro. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto de primaria, es madre de 4 hijos y su esposo vive en Tacna trabajando en una empresa hace un año. Accedió al crédito por falta del capital para mejorar su producción de trucha y su negocio, recibiendo desde 2006 la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compro 7 sacos de alimentos de trucha. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, compró 1 quintal de arroz, 2 bolsas de fideos, un quintal de Harina, una caja de aceite y entre otros, con ello logró incrementar su mercadería y está muy satisfecha con el préstamo porque ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Su visión futura esta enmarcado en ser empresaria y exportador de trucha a los mercados nacionales e internacionales.

loans.use: To buy diverse grocery products at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de productos diversos.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Miss Sokha B., 46, is single and lives in a small village off of National Road Two, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, with her elderly mother and her sister's family. 

Miss Sokha has been in the business of selling small trees and flowers since 1979. She sows tree and flow seeds in her farm around her house for selling in the village. 

Sokha and her family members live in an old house and they have saved some money from their business to repair the house. Now the family lacks the money to finish some parts of the house. Therefore, Sokha is requesting a loan of $800 to buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Khadija's Hatukati Tamaa. Group

texts.en:
Khadija is married with 3 children aged 14, 7, and 3 years old. She has been a juice and bites seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Khadija is now requesting a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring, juice sales, clothes, and firewood sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 36 years old, married and has 4 children.  She sells food products such as dried fish, palm oil, drinks and other provisions.

She needs a loan of $450 to buy more dried fish to sell, as the demand for this product is very high.  It is used in the preparation of Nigerian soups such as Egusi and banga.

Patience thanks all those who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for sale

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey dans le département du zou, dame S.  Jeanne est née en 1964 .Divorcée avec 04 enfants à charge elle a été à l'école jusqu'en classe de Cinquième au cours secondaire. Le manque de soutien financier l'a obligé à abandonner les classes. Ensuite, elle reçut une formation en dactylographe qu'elle n'eut pas la chance d'exercer. Ainsi, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de nourriture, puis après, dans la vente de farine de manioc (gari), beignets d'arachide, liqueurs. Ces dernières années, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente charbon, fagots de bois et dans la distribution de pagne et autres articles à crédit pour les salariés de la fonction publique. C'est pour accroître le capital de son activité qu'elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt de 140000f pour pour s'approvisionner en maïs, tubercules d'igname et pagnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne S. was born in 1964, she is a native of Abomey in the department of Zou. She is divorced and financially responsible for 4 children. She attended school until 7th grade, middle school. The lack of financial resources forced her to abandon her schooling. Later, she received a training as a typist, but, unfortunately, was never able to practice. Thus she began selling food, then later, sold manioc flour (gari), peanut fritters,and liquor. In the last few years, she has specialized in the sale on credit of charcoal, bundles of firewood and the distribution of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric) and other goods to civil service employees. To increase her business capital she is requesting this second loan of 140,000F to stock up on corn, coco yams and pagnes.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bags of corn, one bag of coco yams and 12 pieces of pagnes

loans.name: Ilmer

texts.es: Ilmer tiene 57 años de edad, y ha sido madre de 6 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y de familia, es madre soltera y en la actualidad vive con uno de sus hijos quien la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, por las mañanas y las tardes dentro de su vivienda, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que mucha gente degusta de su buena sazón, le es rentable, ya que la zona donde tiene su negocio es muy transitada y concurrida. Lo que le es un poco difícil es no contar con los ambientes necesarios para atender a sus clientes. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a ampliar su negocio, ambientarlo como es debido, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ilmer is 57 years old and mother of 6 children. They are all independent and have families now. She is single and currently lives with one of her children, who supports her in everything she does. Ilmer works selling food in the mornings and afternoons from her home, which she has been doing for 3 years now. She likes that while she works many people can taste her delicious flavors. It is a profitable business as the area where her business is located is well traveled and attracts large crowds. It is a little difficult for her to not have a good place for her to serve her customers. This is her second loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA). With this loan she will expand her business and will make the environment more comfortable for her customers so they will feel welcome.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and make restaurant more comfortable for customers

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 42 años, es soltera y viven en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas para poder solventar sus gastos, incursionó en este negocio desde hace 15 años, los cuales han sido muy productivos, ya aprendió a conocer los secretos del negocio, y hoy en día obtiene buenos ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es adquirir la mercadería, ya que tiene que viajar para comprarla, pero a pesar de esos pequeños inconvenientes Irma sabe que su trabajo es dignificante y lo realiza con la mayor alegría, esperando progresar y salir adelante en busca de sus sueños. Ella se encuentra en su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Y con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old, single, and lives in a house that her parents left to her. She sells sweets to cover her expenses, and has been involved in this business for the last 15 years, which have been very productive. She has learned the secrets of the business, and today she makes a good living. The most difficult part of her work is acquiring merchandise, as she has to travel to buy it. However, despite these small inconveniences, Irma knows that her work is dignifying and she does it with much joy, hoping to move toward achieving her dreams. She is looking for her ninth loan from Microfianzas Prisma, and with the loan, she hopes to buy a larger quantity of sweets in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase volume of merchandise in the shop

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija N. is a hard-working business lady. She is 48 years old, married with 4 grown-up children. Hadija has 2 years' experience in selling fabrics such as silk, cotton and linen.

She is using the loan proceeds to replenish her stock of fabrics especially silk and cotton. Her dream is to become a fabric wholesaler in Kampala city. The income from the business enables Hadija to give her husband a hand in providing for the family.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics especially silk and cotton

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Dora es conviviente, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Dora viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y pollos para crianza, y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Dora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos bebes.
Los sueños de Dora con implementar cabinas de Internet en su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Obreras Village Bank. She is 46 and has a common-law husband and 4 children. She travels around to different markets in the region selling groceries, and chickens for people to raise. She also buys cereals and cheeses, which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Dora needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in baby chickens. Her dreams include opening an Internet cafe in her house, and having her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Sulma es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Sulma vende quesos que adquiere en la comunidad de Sachabamba que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados.
Sulma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Sulma sueña con comprar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sulma is a member of the Llapanchik (which means "Everyone" in the Quechua language) Village Bank. She is 26 and has a common-law husband and one son. She gets cheeses from Sachabamba, which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho, and sells them wholesale in the markets. Sulma needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in cheeses. She dreams of buying her house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia manages a rolling store business. She sells vegetables that she used to sell in her village. Aside from vegetables, she also sells secondhand clothes in their village. Her weekly net income of PHP 750.00 was utilized for the school allowance of her children. She is now requesting a loan amount of PHP 7,000.00 that will be a big help in increasing her business capital and for business expansion. She wants to develop her business for it to progress and to meet the quality of life she desires for her family. “Believing that dreaming the impossible things in life is possible with God by having a deep faith in Him”, said Ofelia.

Ofelia is already 45 years old. Her husband Amado is a farmer in their rural village. They were blessed with seven children: Norberto - 27 years old, college level; Amado Jr. – 25 years old, college graduate; their twins Jeoffrey & Jeffrey - 23 years old, high school level; Anthony - 20 years old, high school level; Amelia - 17 years old, a high school student and Ana Mae - 9 years old, elementary student.

loans.use: To develop and expand a clothing and vegetable business

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.ru: Тошпулот клиент в Микроинвест с 2004 года.Он проживает в кишлаке Тубчок, района Уткансой, который расположен в самом отдалённом уголке Таджикистана,вблизи гор.В этом районе в основном все мужчины в отъезде в Российскую Федерацию.Но т.к Тошпулот имеет хороший доход с земельного участка и с бизнеса животноводства , он считает, что хлеб можно наживать на Родине.У него большой земельный участок , с которого он получает урожай арахиса.Затем продаёт его своим клиентам по оптовым ценам.Каждый свой кредит он использует для увеличения поголовья скота.Тошпулот один из успешных клиентов в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Toshpulot is a client of MicroInvest since 2004. He lives in a kishlak (village) of Tubchok in the Utkansoy region which is located in the most remote corner of Tajikistan near the mountains. In this region most of the men have left to the Russian Federation. But because Toshpulot has a good income from his plot of land and his animal husbandry business he thinks that he can earn his bread here in his motherland. He has a big plot of land from where he grows peanuts and collects the harvest. Then he sells it to his customers at wholesale prices. He uses every one of his loans to increase the heads of his cattle. Toshpulot is one of the successful clients of MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 49-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with his wife. Fadi has been working as a blacksmith for 29 years. He requested a loan of $3,000 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and iron for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work. Fadi is special in his work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Fadi decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: Fadi will use the loan to purchase tools and iron for his work

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn L. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Robelyn is married and has four school-aged children. Robelyn owns and operates a general store, primarily selling food products in the local community. 

Robelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es: Miluska es una joven soltera de 19 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, a los cuales quiere ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ya que siente que es hora de poner su granito de arena para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Vendiendo zapatos ha sabido progresar en su vida, los novedosos modelos que ofrece la han convertido en la vendedora más solicitada del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), sus clientes siempre se van muy contentos y satisfechos, además que reciben una buena atención por parte de Miluska. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y lo que no le agrada es permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, sin poder darse tiempo para algunas cosas personales. Para el futuro, le gustaría tener una tienda donde pueda vender mayor cantidad de zapatos y así, poco a poco ir ayudando a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, para que ellos ya no tengan que trabajar tanto. Miluska desea pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, siendo éste su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella no tiene dudas en poder lograrlo, sabe que tiene el apoyo de su banco comunal y es por eso que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeros. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos, para incrementar la cantidad que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Miluska is a single 19-year-old young woman. She lives in the home of her parents, who she hopes to help with household expenses, as she now feels it is time for her to contribute to improving her family's quality of life. Selling shoes has led her to progress in life. The new models she offers have made her the most popular vendor in the market of San José (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her customers always leave very happy and satisfied, for they receive great treatment from Miluska. She has been in this line of work for three years, and what she does not like about it is staying in her stall all day, unable to take time for personal matters. In the future, she would like to have a store where she can sell a greater quantity of shoes, and thus help her parents little by little with their household costs so they won't have to work so much anymore. Miluska hopes to make her repayments punctually. This being her third loan with MFP, she doesn't doubt her ability to do so. She knows that she has the support of her communal bank, and she cares about the well-being of her partners. With the 1,800 soles she is requesting, she will buy more shoes to increase the quantity she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bobochon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Бобочон кредитор организации с 2003 года . Он занимается продажей чая (заварки).Привозит товар с оптового рынка Худжанда и продаёт на рынке Костакоза в розницу.У него увеличился оборотный капитал в несколько раз , с прибыли бизнеса он смог отремонтировать свой дом. На следующий кредит он хочет закупить 10 коробок чёрного чая.
texts.en:
Bobochon has been a borrower with our organization since 2003. He sells tea. He brings his merchandise from a wholesale market in Khujand and sells it retail at a market in Kostakoz. His working capital increased quite a bit, and he was able to use the profit from his business to repair his house. Bobochon wants to use his next loan to purchase 10 boxes of black tea.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of black tea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional chickens for her project

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné C. est une femme mariée, mère de 2 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de s’activer dans la vente de savon, lait, huile, café et céréales. Les revenus générés lui permettront de s’occuper de la santé de ses enfants et de subvenir à ces besoins.
texts.en:
Ngoné C. is a married woman and the mother of two. She is requesting this loan to become active in selling soap, milk, oil, coffee, and grains. The generated revenues will allow her to take care of her children’s health and to provide for their needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell retail soap, milk, oil, coffee, grains, and charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Dodoma in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,she is separated from her husband and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 7 and 1 years,she also cares for other 4 dependents.

Elizabeth started her own business selling local beer  1 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 95,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Elizabeth`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for local beer.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Elizabeth hopes to save more money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Narcisa Domínguez tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un niño menor de 2 años, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.

Es oriunda de la ciudad de Mbuyapey, de familia humilde, a sus 14 años debido a la gran necesidad económica, vino en busca de trabajo en Carapeguá donde consiguió trabajar como empleada doméstica. Cabe destacar que la señora con quien trabaja es de profesión peluquera, con ésta aprendió a trabajar en la mencionada profesión, además los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de perfumes y artículos de mercería que también significa un ingreso más para el sustento de su familia. 

Hoy día gracias a la aceptación de sus productos, logró formar una cantidad considerable de clientes en su ciudad natal, por lo que tuvo que recurrir a nuestra entidad. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de perfumes, remeras.
texts.en:
Sra. Narcisa Domínguez is 26 year old and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is a single mother with a 2 year old child.

She is a native of the city of Mbuyapey and comes from a family of humble means. When she was 14 years old, out of financial necessity, she came to Carapeguá looking for work and eventually found a job as a maid. The woman who hired her is a hairdresser by profession and started teaching Narcisa everything about her business. On the weekends, Narcisa also sells perfumes and men’s clothing and accessories in order to earn money to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes and T-shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes & T-shirts

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: T. Alice est née vers 1979 à Zanzounmè. Alice est mariée à METONOU Adrien. Alice est mère de quatre enfants mais en plus de ses enfants, elle a deux autres enfants à charge. La famille vit à Missérété dans la commune de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN.  Alice vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. C’est depuis cinq ans que Alice vend le maïs et les divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). C’est au marché Ouando qu’Alice fait ses provisions et vend ses produits chez elle à la maison. Alice est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux développer son activité, Alice demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Alice T. was born around 1979 in the town of Zanzounme. Alice is married to Adrien Metonou. Alice is the mother of four children, but in addition to her own children she has two others in her care. The family lives in Misserete in the community of Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Alice is able to help her husband in the support of their family thanks to her business. For the past five years Alice has sold corn and various other items (candies, cookies, bottled milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pastas, as well as laundry, dish, and personal soaps, batteries, candles etc.). In the Ouando market Alice buys her supplies but she sells her products from her home. Alice is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner), and she has always repaid her loans successfully. In order to expand her business, Alice requests a loan that will be used as working capital.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn and various other products.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Southern Poblacion. She is 34 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en: Nosa sells clothes and body creams in the market. She is 28 years old and married with a child. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She requests a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes and body creams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and body creams to sell

loans.name: Nhel

texts.en: Nhel N. is a 42 year old fruit seller in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about eight years and she makes US $5 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and is able to make US $5 per day as well. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Nhel is asking for a loan of US $750 to make two investments: she would like to use US $500 to help her husband purchase a trailer, and put the remaining US $250 into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruit to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities to increase her daily income.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her husband and reinvest in her fruit business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and containers for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria Marina L. T. de 24 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapán en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad. Gloria posee una venta de frutas en el mercado de Cojutepeque, dicho negocio lo posee desde hace ocho años. Gloria es una mujer muy esforzada, la cual trabaja muy duro por ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más frutas, ya que este es un producto el cual se vende muy rápido y genera muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria Marina Lopez T., who is 24 years old, lives in San Pedro Perulapán in the town of Cuscatlan. She lives with her life partner and two sons who are 8 and 5 years of age. Gloria sells fruits in the Cojutepeque market, and says that she has had the business for eight years. Gloria is a very brave woman, who works hard to help her husband with household expenses. That's why she applied for a loan through which to buy more fruit, as this is a product that sells very quickly and generates very good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits for sale

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Elconida

texts.en:
Elconida N. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elconida owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling homemade ice-cream in the local community. Elconida has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Elconida joined Kiva partN. HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business
