loans.name: Din

texts.en: Din M. is 42 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, where she has established a small family. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school while the other one is an employee in the pure water company. Din M. is a local teacher for a public school, while her husband has the skills to examine patients in the village (as a medical doctor.) The couple also takes time to cultivate a rice crop as their annual business. Due to the coming dry season and the weather becoming dry everywhere, Din M. is hardly finding enough water for their crop. Din M. is applying for a loan to buy a machine and pump to irrigate her rice crop.

loans.use: To buy a machine and water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more stationery materials to sell, and improve business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline se dedica a  comercializar ropa de niño, su esposo trabaja en el interior, es militar, con rango de Sargento. Sus fuentes de ingreso derivan de estas dos actividades, así cubren la manutención de su familia, tienen 2  hijos con las edades de 9 y 4 años. Viven en casa de sus padres Zona Litoral de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (ropa de niños) para su posterior comercialización.
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells children clothing; her husband, who is a sargeant in the military, is stationed in the country's interior. Their family's income derives from these two activities; this is how they support their family, which is made up of two children, who are 9 and 4 years old. They live in their parents' house, which is in the Litoral zone of the city of El Alto. The funds will be used to buy children's clothing to sell. This is her second loan with Impro; her good behavior with her previous loan qualifies her for another one.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Marta Yolanda T. T. cuenta con 21 años, soltera vive con sus familia materna, en la actualidad ella se dedica a la sastrería “elaboración de sudaderos y pants” se acerco a la asociación ASDIR para  un pequeño préstamo para poder comprar una Aserradora de cortes de tela,  los encargos que se le hace requiere de maquinaria especial para sacar productos realmente sofisticados en sus labores diariamente, brindándole esta pequeña ayuda ella podrá mejorar su producción, como  en su trabajo la eficiencia para sacar cortes exactos y así  podrá mejorar su  condición de vida.
texts.en:
Marta Yolanda T. T., 21, lives with her maternal relatives; she is a seamstress "sweat-shirts and pants making." She called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a small loan to buy a pattern cutter. The work orders she takes on require specialized machinery to produce really sophisticated product daily. This small help will make it possible for her to improve her production allowing for her to cut exact pattern pieces thus improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fabric pattern cutter.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 20-year-old married woman and the mother of one young child. She has been working as a beautician for the past three years. This is her third loan from Kiva and she is very grateful for her previous two loans because her business productivity and income have both increased as a result.
Zahraa chose to repay her second loan several months early, and is now requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to add to her savings to buy a car. This will facilitate her business travel to clients' houses, as she also offers her services in customer's homes at their request.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en:
Fumi has a computer centre where she renders computer services to her customers. She hopes to own a computer school in the future where she will teach young girls and boys how to use the computer.

Fumi also sells stationery at retail prices. She has been in these businesses for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more stationery to sell. She loves this business because of the profits she makes.

Fumi is 38 years old and is married with two children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery to sell

loans.name: Mary Nataana

texts.en:
Mary Nataana T. is a 43-year-old widow and the mother of three school-going children. She is owns a piece of land which she has farmed for the last three years now.

Mary Nataana learned about KADET from other women who had already registered as members. This will be her first loan which she is planning to use to plant more maize which normally does well in her area due to the good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Mary Nataana’s dream is to do large-scale farming and become financially independent. Despite being a widow, she is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To plant more maize on a bigger piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm kennel to sell.

loans.name: Loep

texts.en: Mrs. Loep S., 32, owns a medium-sized restaurant including music, where she sells food, beef, wine, beer, and soft drink to people who come directly to eat at her restaurant. She also receives helps from her husband to conduct the business (he appears in the photo). Loep S. has newly started her business and she still needs some money to accumulate her business capital. She dreams of having many clients recognize the good service that she provides. That is why Loep S. is looking for a $1000 loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To accumulate the business capital.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio D. is from the village of Unidos Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Leoncio is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Leoncio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as cooking oil, salt,shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Leoncio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leoncio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leoncio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jennifer Johanna

texts.es:
Jennifer de 25 años, vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) de Guayaquil, ella reparte almuerzos a casi todo el sector de Duran. 

Ella desde muy joven empezó a estudiar y como era una niña muy aplicada la becaron en la universidad, al pasar el tiempo ella recibió un premio en dinero por su buen desempeño académico, y lo invirtió en alimentos para hacer su propio negocio. Desde ese tiempo ella tiene un servicio de almuerzos a domicilios, ella mismo hace la comida y la reparte. Tiene un promedio de almuerzos diarios entre 120 / 150. 

Pero como ella cocina en su casa no tiene oportunidad de cumplir con todos los pedidos que le piden sus clientes por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar una cocina industrial. Y en el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio de comidas a domicilio.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 25 years old and lives in Duran (a suburban area with various hills, streams and lakes that still exist as remnants of an ecology in dissolution) in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She delivers lunches to almost everyone in Duran. She started studying at a very young age and as she was a very talented little girl, she was awarded a scholarship at the university. Over time she received a cash award for her good academic performance, and she invested it in foods to start her own business. From that time she has had her lunch delivery service, which she herself prepares and distributes. She averages between 120 and 150 lunches a day, but because she prepares the meals at her home, she doesn't have a chance to fulfill all of her customers orders. For this reason, she wants to purchase an industrial kitchen. In the future she wants to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, D. 47 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene cuatros hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en L. localidad D. San francisco, ubicada en L. ceja D. L. selva peruana, donD. tienen su propia casa. Hace mas D. 20 años, se dedica a vender comida criolL. y típica D. L. selva, en donD. sus clientes gustan mucho D. L. sazón D. sus platos. Un tiempo atrás instaló en el segundo piso D. su casa, un negocio D. entretenimiento, que es el juego D. billar, D. esa manera obtiene otro ingreso extra para su familia. Pero el trabajo que más disfruta es L. preparación D. comida, no obstante, los ingresos que tiene lo está ahorrando, ya que piensa abrir un recreo turístico, siendo un negocio que dentro D. su localidad es escasea. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. su esposo y su rutina diaria es a partir D. las 7:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 9:00 D. L. noche D. lunes a domingo, siendo su punto D. venta, frente a un mercado. Este es su decimoséptimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar D. manera oportuna y responsable, además está satisfecho con grupo comunal, por los beneficios que lo otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en el acabado e inhalación para el nuevo terreno que compró, por que piensa tener un campo deportivo. Un negocio que lo considera muy rentable.
texts.en:
Zonia is 47 years old, married, and has four children to her credit. The family lives in their own home in the town of San Francisco, located on the ceja (eyebrow) of the Peruvian jungle. For more than 20 years she has sold the food typical of her country and of the jungle. Her customers enjoy very much the taste of these dishes. Some time ago she installed on the second floor of her home pool tables, which became another source of income for her family. But the work that she most enjoys is food preparation. She is saving a portion of her income because she thinks of opening a recreation area for tourists; there is a shortage of recreation areas in her town. She generally works by herself but occasionally is helped by her husband. Her work day begins at 7am and lasts until 9 at night, from Monday to Sunday, these being the hours that her market site is open. This is her seventeenth loan from MFP; she is committed to making payment in a timely and responsible manner. Also, she is satisfied with her communal bank because of the benefits it provides. She thinks she will invest this loan in the development of a new plot of land that she purchased. She wants to build an athletic field, which she believes to have great commercial potential.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build an athletic field

loans.name: Punitai

texts.en:
Punitai T. K. is 32 and married with 5 children (ages 12 - 21).  She owns a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  Punitai has many years of experience in this business. Punitai needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Punitai joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Punitai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD. Since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn S. is a 50-year-old, married woman and is blessed with six children. One of her children is now married and the other five are single. She currently stays at home to sell a few produce items in her small store in front of her home. Her husband owns a trailer-motor that he uses to operate a taxi service. 

Sorn S. has been planning to build a new house for her married child to live in, but her goal does not come true because of a lack of funds. To help achieve her goal, Sorn S. has decided to look a loan of $1,200 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, to add with her personal savings in order to construct a new house.

loans.use: To construct a new house

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda L. is from the village of Cabisera 25. She is 44 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $100 whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2009, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more baby livestock. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en:
Lotoi L. is 45, married, and has three children aged from six to sixteen. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Lotoi has two years' experience in this business. Lotoi is requesting a loan of 1,250 WST to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Lotoi joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Lotoi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Marilou is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.ru:
Fuad A. 31 qod. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , doch kotoroy 7 let uchitsya v shkole , doch 5 let uchitsya v detskom sadike i sin  3 qodikov . Fuad yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselene iz Fuzuli qoroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

Fuad uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya etim biznessom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u dyaydi svoyeqo kotoriy i posovetoval yemu zanatsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. U sebya doma Fuad prodayet moloko , sir, kefir. Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en:
Fuad A. is 31 years old. He is married and has three children: a 7-year old daughter who goes to school, a 5-year daughter who goes to kindergarten and a son who is just 3. Fuad is an Internally Displaced Person; he is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region.

He has been in this business for four years, having learned it from his father, who had encouraged him to go into raising cattle. Fuad sells milk, cheese, and kefir out of his home. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Jeny Ruth

texts.es: La señora Yeny trabaja como intermediaria de mercadería con la aduana , desde hace dos años, no cuenta con mercadería especifica,  ya que la señora comercia cualquier mercadería que llegue a aduana y que no cuente póliza de importación la señora se ocupa de realizar los tramites de aduana y posteriormente lo comercia al por mayor y menor a personas particulares entrega esta mercadería a distintos puestos  . Solicito el crédito para poder cancelar tramites en fonvis (fondo de vivienda social) al comercio se dedica con la colaboración de su esposo, ya que le ayuda en el traslado de la mercadería, es una persona muy activa y trabajadora,  trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Yeny has worked in the shipping department of the country's border services.  She doesn't have any type of specific merchandise for resale because she sells whatever merchandise that comes to through her office that does not meet importation policies.  She sells these items on wholesale and retail to various individuals. She requests a loan to pay off her Fonvis debt (a social housing fund). She works together with her husband in this business. He provides transportation of the goods. She is a very active and hard working person. She works from the very early morning hours. She is very grateful for the support provided to her.

loans.use: To make social housing payment.

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira S. is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married. Together with her spouse, who works as a driver, she has three daughters; the eldest is married, the second one is a student, and the youngest - a schoolgirl. The family earns extra money by cattle breeding and milk selling. Out of their profits they have so far managed to pay for their daughter’s studies. In order to give their daughter a proper education, the family needs to obtain a loan. In future Sabira is planning to build a shed. 

Sabira’s partners:

Aizat A., 32, is married. Her family has three children. Following her sister’s advice, Aizat decided to start her business in cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase winter clothes. 

Gulzira I. is the treasurer of the group. She is 26 and married. Together with her husband she is bringing up one son. Gulzira earns a living by working as a hairdresser, and besides that, her family is engaged in cattle breeding. The loan purpose is to purchase two calves to expand their herd. 

Aizada I., 34, is married. She is currently a housewife raising three children. Aizada’s husband supports the family financially by working in militia station. Their loan purpose is to purchase winter clothes. In future the family aims to obtain a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for their daughter's education

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William P. tiene 32 años y quiere tener su propia compañía de “chapiadores”  (Cortadores de césped).
Es el de Canalate de Alajuela, una comunidad caracterizada por el emprendurismo de sus mujeres ya que hay varias organizaciones lideradas por ellas así como empresas.
El tiene varios  años de dedicarse a la corta de Césped de las  en su comunidad, ahora los clientes son cada vez más, es porque él necesita ₡604 000 (Seiscientos Cuatro mil colones) para la compra de una desbrozadora nueva y para arreglar la que ya tiene. El dice que su meta es crear una sociedad donde pueda tener otras personas trabajando  y así poder atender más clientes.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica .Este será su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
William P. is 32 years old, and wants to have his own lawn service company.

This is Canalate de Alajuela, a community characterized by the entrepreneurial spirit of its women, since there are a number of organizations led by them, as well as companies.

For a number of years, William has been cutting lawns in his community.  Now his customer base is constantly increasing, and for this reason he needs 604,000 colones to buy a new brush cutter and to fix the equipment he already has.

He says that his goal is to create a company where he could have other people working and in this way provide service to more customers.  

He is a member of the Canalete community bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy a brush cutter

loans.name: Onesme

texts.en: Onesme is 46 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 6 and 21 years old. He runs a store in Rugarama district in Rwanda. Onesme has had his construction business for four years and he currently employs one person. He works from 8am until 4pm every day, except on Saturdays. The main challenges to his business is expansion. This is his first loan requested from Kiva through the Vision Finance Company and it will be used to buy more sheet metal for construction. The extra income from this loan will help his business in the future, as he plans to reinvest it and continue to buy more construction products.

loans.use: To buy more sheet metal.

loans.name: Mama Inuka Group

texts.fr: Francoise M. est entrepreneur, Secrétaire du groupe Mama Inuka, âgée de 42 ans, divorcée, mère de 6 enfants.  Elle vend l’huile de palme. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son ex mari avant qu’ils divorcent. Il ya 2 ans qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima pour renforcement de son capital. Elle installe ses produits  au long de la rue, prêt du petit marché sectoriel du quartier Ndosho. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  les 2 fus d’huile de palme, 2 sacs de riz, 1 sac de haricot. En plus, elle ambitionne augmenter son compte épargne, scolariser, nourrir et vêtir confortablement ses enfants. La cliente Francoise M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Le groupe Mama Inuka est constitué de 8 membres.
texts.en:
Françoise M. is an entrepreneur, and secretary of the Mama Inuka group, which consists of eight members. She is a 42-year-old divorced mother of six children. 

She sells palm oil, a business she started with her own funds received from her former husband before they divorced. She has been engaged in this activity for two years. She displays her merchandise along the street near the local market of the Ndosho neighborhood.

She received a loan from the Hekima MFI to strengthen her working capital. This new loan will allow her to boost her stocks with two drums of palm oil, two bags of rice, and one bag of beans. 

She also plans to increase her savings, send her children to school, and feed and clothe them comfortably. 

Françoise M. wishes to thank Hekima for helping the less fortunate who can’t turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: Buying two drums of palm oil, two bags of rice, and one bag of beans

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem K., 34, sells hand-made brooms, earning an income of $4 per day. K. is married and resides with his wife and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply, and $55 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase palm sugar to stock for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy palm sugar to stock for sale

loans.name: Rabii

texts.ar:
ربيع في عمر 33 سنة يعمل في صالون للحلاقة رجالي له فيه 17 سنة يحب عمله ويريد التجديد والتطور فيه متزوج وله ولد
له زبائن كثر من محيطه جيرانه كان للقرض السابق عليه اثر جيد فهو يحب دائما ملاحقة ما هو جديد في العمل لديه خبرة كبيرة
يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات جديدة للحلاقة زائد تحسين ديكور المحل كان يلقى منافسة كبيرة
لكن ينقصه المادة
texts.en: Rabii is a 33-year-old husband and father who has been serving his neighbors and generA. community as a men’s hair stylist for the past 17 years. Rabii is always eager to reinvent himself professionally and accordingly is constantly following the latest developments in hair fashion. Although his last loan was very helpful, because his business faces stiff competition, Rabii would like to apply for a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase new hairstyling equipment and to spruce up the store’s décor.

loans.use: To purchase new hairstyling equipment and spruce up store's decor

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces milk and eggs which are sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She recently repaid a previous loan of 61,200Kes from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested another loan of 61,200Kes to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. She says that with the dairy cow she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale.

Sara is 44 years old and married with 4 children whose ages range between 7 and 20. Three of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sarlince

texts.en:
Sarlince is a-38-year-old lady who works as a tailor. Sarlince is married to Ricky and has six children. They are: Rizal, who is in the third grade of a Senior high school; Sari, who is in the second grade of Senior high school; Yosua, who is in the second grade of Junior high school; Sella, who is in the first grade of Junior high school; Nickyds, 4 years old; and Lili, 8 months. Sarlince and her family live in the middle of town, exactly in the village of Naikolan. 
Sarlince is a persistent woman who is always looking for opportunities to expand her business in the field of sewing. She has been running this business for almost four years. 

Sarlince always tries to make innovations in sewing by creating her own models. Although her business is categorized as a small business and can only generate a small income, Sarlince dreams of improving her business to become bigger. 

Currently, Sarlince is using one sewing machine to fill her customer orders. Sometimes Sarlince receives many orders at a time. She would love to complete all of her customer orders on time with satisfactory quality.  

Therefore Sarlince hopes she can buy a new sewing machine. The new machine will be used to create button holes and to do other specific work. To make her dream come true, Sarlince is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. Sarlince believes that the loan will be a good support for her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Juana Mercedes tiene 41 años, a esta edad ella ha aprendido a luchar a mantener activo su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y está ubicado en su vivienda por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Poco a poco Juana ha ido creciendo con su negocio, a pesar de las dificultades como brindar el espacio suficiente para colocar sus productos en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes y pan. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes is 41 years old.  At this age she has learned to fight to keep her business active.  Her business activity is a grocery store, which she has had for over five years.  It is located in her home because she has three children under her care.

Little by little Juana has been making her business grow.  She does this in spite of the difficulties like finding sufficient space to place her products in her home.

The loan she is requesting is for work capital to buy basic grains, sweets, natural soft drinks, detergents, and bread.  Her wish is to increase her work capital in order to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anna Noemi

texts.es:
Anna, de 35 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, donde vive con su esposo y un hijo de 6 años de edad, ella administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, ella inicio este negocio hace un año y medio, con ayuda de su esposo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, esta inversión es con la intención de mejorar la atención a los clientes, ofreciéndoles mayor variedad de productos de uso familiar.
Ella tiene como objetivo mantener el negocio fuerte, que le genere ganancias para ayudar así a su hijo a iniciar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Anna is 35 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with her husband and 6 year-old son.  She has a general store that she set up a year and a half ago with the help of her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy staple goods in order to improve customer service and offer a wider variety of products.

Her goal is to keep her business strong and generate enough earnings to help her son who is beginning his education.

loans.use: To buy staple goods

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda, es originaria de San Juan de Limay, esta casada, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Ella se dedica a llevar contabilidades. Comenzó a los 23 años de edad a trabajar en este negocio, ella estudiaba contaduría publica los sábados y los días de  semana trabajaba llevando contabilidades, ella misma con sus esfuerzos logro pagar su carrera universitaria sin la ayuda de nadie, ya que  su padre era agricultor y su madre ama de casa y no podían pagarle estudios profesionales. Este ha sido su primer negocio, actualmente brinda servicios de contabilidad y tiene 5 clientes a los cuales tiene 7  y 10 años de trabajar con ellos. Su esposo trabaja reparando celulares y así cooperar en el hogar. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar material de construcción como  cemento, arena, pintura,  y pago de mano de obra para remodelar su oficina y su vivienda.   Le ayudara a darle una mejor presentación a su negocio que lo tiene ubicado dentro de su vivienda, así atraerá mas clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Tiene como planes futuros dar a conocer sus servicios contables atraves de medios radiales, poner un pequeño negocio de elaboración de refresco. Así ayudarse para ahorrar y pagarles estudios profesionales a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Teodolinda, originally from San Juan de Limay, is married, and has 2 children, aged 18 and 15 respectively. She is an accountant.  Teodolinda began this work when she was 23 years old. She studied public accounting on Saturdays, while on week days she worked at accounting. She paid her own university expenses without anyone's help. Since her father was a farmer and her mother a house wife, they couldn't pay for her professional studies. This has been her first business. She offers services to 5 clients and has from 7 to 10 years of working with each of them.  Teodolinda's husband repairs cell phones and thus helps in the home.

Teodolinda requests a loan to buy construction materials, including cement, sand, and paint, and to pay for labor to remodel her office and house. This will help give her business, located in her home, a better appearance, bringing in more clients and augmenting her income.

Among her future plans are to make her accounting services better known through radio advertising, and to install a small refreshment-making business. This will help her to save and to pay for her 2 children's professional studies.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS, INCLUDING CEMENT, SAND, AND PAINT, AND TO PAY LABORERS TO REMODEL HER OFFICE AND HOME

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a  la señora Hilda, Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de  cuatro  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad,  con ella vive su hija que también es madre soltera de un bebé que es la alegría de nuestra amiga.
 
Tiene una tienda en su casa, allí además de víveres también vende artículos de bazar, medicinas y útiles escolares, labora todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, trabaja sola aunque a veces le ayuda su hija y nos cuenta que no le gusta tener muy tarde abierto por la inseguridad que hay por su localidad. Sus productos los compra en el centro de la ciudad y algunos los recibe en su local.  Lleva más de 20 años con su tienda y además de ser un medio para ganarse la vida también le sirve de entretenimiento.

Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares que es lo que más  se vende en esta temporada. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is one of the poorest in the city. It is also known as a prison area since the Women’s Prison of Portoviejo is located here.

Sra. Hilda is being presented here. She is 61 years old and a single mother of four adult children. Hilda lives with her daughter who is also a single mother. Her grandbaby gives her much joy.

Hilda has a store in her home where she sells provisions, bazaar items, medicines, and school supplies. She works every day from 6am to 9pm. Hilda works alone, but sometimes she has the help of her daughter. She says she does not like to stay open late because of the lack of safety in her community. Her products are purchased in the central part of the city and some of them are delivered to her store. She has been in business for more than 20 years. In addition to being a means of earning a living, her store also keeps her entertained.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies since these products sell the most during this season. This is her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys having credit. Her dream is to grow her business each day.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush T. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Kaps.  She is married and the proud mother of two children: a 15-year-old daughter and a 19-year-old son.  She considers herself a hard working honest person and for the past 18 years, she has been a farmer.  She has a high school education and dreams for both of her children to graduate from the university.  Her daughter will graduate high school in two years and her son will finish his army service next year.  Siranush is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and wheat seeds.  According to her plan, this investment will increase the family income by 15%.  She is pleased with microfinance services, especially because the monthly repayments are organized to be made in her village.  With many friends and relatives nearby and the fresh air, Siranush enjoys living in Kaps.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and wheat seeds

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 36 años de edad, él es soltero y vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en una zona rural, en el caserío Callejón de Cascaja en el distrito de Olmos a dos horas de la  ciudad de Chiclayo.

Mariano se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de transporte publico en una mototaxi que es de sus propiedad y adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de limón con varios años de experiencia en el rubro tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Mariano a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder darle un mantenimiento a su mototaxi  y capital de trabajo así mejorar sus ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Su meta es comprar una moto más a corto plazo y formar su propia empresa, por eso se le caracteriza a Mariano como un persona emprendedora, trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Mariano is 36 and single. He lives in his own home which is located in a rural zone, in the Callejon de Cascaja hamlet in the Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Mariano offers a public transportation service in a mototaxi which he owns. He also sells lemons. He has several years' experience in the area and has good personal and work references.

Mariano has requested  a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to maintain his mototaxi and to use as working capital in order to improve his income and obtain a better quality of life.

His goal is to buy another moto soon and form his own company. Thus he is an enterprising, hard-working and responsible person.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 33 years old and is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. She has a small rice farm, which she has been managing for 11 years. Her husband is a farmer. Together they work hard to be able to raise their four children.

With a loan from CEVI, she has easily bought farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. Aside from having a rice field, she also raises pigs. 

In the future, she hopes to manage a bigger farm and a piggery so that she will be able to fund the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nyakabare Bakyara Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Happy is happy-go-lucky and happily married with 4 lively kids. Her kids are all in school in Ntungamo. Ntungamo is where she operates from. She has been in the pub business for 2 years now. It is fair to say that the decision she took to engage in this business was right as evidenced by the increasing clientele at her pub every evening. That not only means more revenue, but better consolidation of her achievements so far. 

Happy began with an agro sales business. She relied on profits from this business to begin the pub. At the pub, she sells a variety of hard and soft alcoholic beverages. Happy says despite being busy at her pub, she still finds some time, especially on the weekends, to oversee her agro produce sales business. If she does not find time, she says she delegates the running of the business to her brother. 

Happy says with determination, hard work and prayers she will achieve even more than she has achieved now. She says the only limit is the sky. Weekly, this business generates her 120,000 UGX as sales profits. Happy intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more crates of hard and soft alcoholic beverages to sell at her pub.

loans.use: to purchase of more crates of hard and soft alcoholic beverages to sell

loans.name: Supa

texts.en:
Supa is a married woman with children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old, married with 3 adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, noodles and other daily basic needs of the community. Marina had this business for 10 years.

Marina is requesting for a loan of Php 11,000 to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and rice to sell. Each month, Marina earns about Php 4,000 in her selling business.

In the future, Marina hopes that her business will increase profits and she will become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and rice to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua prepares and sells a meal known as "kenkey" at the Abura market. To prepare her kenkey, she buys maize from the market and soaks it in water to soften the maize for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day. She divides the risen dough into two parts and mixes one part with water to get it into a porridge-like consistency form, which she cooks until it is firm but not fully cooked. She later mixes the rest of the uncooked dough in with the half-cooked dough. She molds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husk. She then cooks these till they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces, such as pepper sauce. It is often served with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, or roasted turkey.

Ekua has received a junior high school education. She is unmarried and has five children. She has been preparing and selling kenkey for three years and is responsible about seeing to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize with which to prepare kenkey to sell. She intends to use the new profits from her business to provide for a meaningful eduation for her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize with which to prepare kenkey to offer for sale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida vive en su tierra natal al lado de su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Junto con su esposo decidieron hace 13 años aprovechar el patrimonio familiar que ambos tienen, es así que disponen de sus terrenos arcillosos para su fabrica de ladrillos. Los primeros años de trabajo fueron muy duros ya que  contrataron mano de obra, por lo cual significaría una ganancia minima. Con el paso de los años su negocio ha ido creciendo en capital y en la actualidad puede contratar mano de obra que hace más ligero el trabajo que le permite atender a sus hijos, esta fabrica familiar le ha permitido sostener a una familia numerosa y darles una calidad de vida. Por otro lado manifiesta que uno de los factores de crecimiento  de su negocio son los créditos anteriores. Ya son 16 ciclos de trayectoria de trabajo grupal que tiene con MFP,  de las cuales aprovechó adecuadamente para  el crecimiento progresivo que hoy disfruta. El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de  mayor cantidad de insumos para fabricar sus ladrillos.
texts.en:
Zenaida lives in the place of her birth alongside her husband and their six children. She and her family own their home. Thirteen years ago, Zenaida and her husband decided to make use of the inheritances they received from both of their families by establishing a brickyard and using the clay that was available on their land. The first few years that they were in business were very difficult because they had to hire workers and gained minimal returns. As the years passed, their business grew as well as their capital. At the moment, Zenaida hires workers to help make the workload much lighter, which allows her to spend time with her children. This business helps support several family members and provides for their quality of life. Zenaida says that one of the factors that has helped her business grow is the availability of her previous loans.

She has already participated in 16 loan cycles with MFP as a member of her group. Zenaida has taken advantage of this support and has grown progressively to the point where she is at today. The money she is requesting will be invested in a large quantity of supplies for making bricks.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last six years by buying and selling fruits, especially coconuts, in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by also running a variety store on the side. Thanks to her own hard work and some help from NWTF, she has been a success and hopes to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dayan Fernando

texts.es:
Dayan es un joven emprendedor que aprendió al lado de su padre a forjar el hierro, desde hace algunos años consideró la posibilidad de trabajar como independiente pues siempre ha soñado con tener una gran empresa, por eso desde hace dos años y con el apoyo de su familia decidió independizarse y tener su propio local para empezar a tener sus propios ingresos. 

Este emprendedor oriundo del municipio de Sonsón al Oriente de Antioquia, necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima: hierro, lámina y carbón y así empezar a producir mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dayan is a young entrepreneur who learned how to forge iron at his father’s side.  Starting a few years ago he considered the possibility of working independently.  He has always dreamed of having a large business.  

That is why two years ago, with help from his family, he decided to become independent and to have his own place in order to start having his own income.

This entrepreneur is from the Sonsón municipality in Eastern Antioquia.  He needs a loan to buy raw material like iron, sheet metal, and coal.  That way he will start to produce a greater quantity in order to improve his sales and to get more customers.

loans.use: to buy iron, sheet metal, and coal.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 62 years old and married. He is the old father of eight lovely children. Four of his children are married and live independently, and his other four children are all single. Presently, Kong generates business as a rice farmer located in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. From this business he can earn $1.50 USD each day. To assist his income, two of his children are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh where they can earn a fixed salary each month. 

Due to the rainy season, Kong would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials but he lacks money so he wishes to request funds through Kiva's partner, HKL. Kong hopes that this loan will allow him to produce more output than in other years, and he hopes to one day build a bigger house. Kong is very grateful to all lenders that provide these funds to his family. This is his first loan from Kiva and HKL.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Judith has a retail shop where she sells hardware products like fluorescent lamps, electrical bubs & solvent like rugby (adhesive). She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of hardware products.

Judith is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of hardware products.

loans.name: Fernando Manfredo

texts.es:
El señor Fernando Manfredo es casado, tiene 33 años de edad, curso sus estudios de maestros en educación, no tiene hijos, trabaja para la empresa de energía eléctrica de Guatemala, lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para comprar una motocicleta que servirá para trasportarse a los diferentes lugares donde realiza su trabajo, y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Fernando Manfredo is married. He is 33 years old and is studying to be a teacher. He does not have children. He works for the electric energy company in Guatemala where he has ten years experience.

He is requesting a loan and will use it to buy a motorcycle that will be used to transport him to the different places where he works and to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Macedonia

texts.es:
Maria, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro  hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, el  oficio lo empezó hace un año, desde las 6:00 am a 12:00 pm,  todos los días de lunes a domingo y en su casa tiene ademas la venta de productos lácteos (queso, quesillo, crema) no tiene un horario establecido.

El préstamo lo necesita para fortalecer su negocio de las tortillas comprando maíz  y una nueva plancha, por el cual tendrá producto para poder seguir aumentando en su negocio de esa forma obtener más ingresos.

El sueño de Maria es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, poder siempre mantener el negocio estable para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and 4 children. She makes tortillas. She started the business a year ago. She works from 6:00 am until 12:00 pm every day, from Monday to Sunday and in her house she also sells dairy products (cheese, soft cheese, cream). She doesn't have a fixed schedule.

She needs the loan to strengthen her business and buy corn and a new grill, with which she will have the products necessary to continue growing the business and in this way she will make more income.

Maria's dream is that her children continue studying and that to always be able to maintain a stable business for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and grill to cook the tortillas on.

loans.name: Yeni Adriana

texts.es: Yeni Adriana tiene 23 años, ella es docente de primaria lamentablemente con lo poco que gana no había podido realizarle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda. Ella trabaja todos los días, es por eso que quiere realizar este crédito es para la compra de bloques, arena, piedrín entre otros. Este es uno de sus sueños el poder realizarle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y así podrá construir. Yeni es una mujer trabajadora y agradece el financiamiento que será utilizado en los productos necesarios.
texts.en: Yeni Adriana is 23 years old. She is an elementary-school teacher but sadly with the little money she makes she has not been able to make necessary improvements to her home. She works every day, and she is requesting the loan to purchase blocks, sand, gravel and other items. This is one of her dreams, to make the necessary improvement to her home since summertime is approaching and she will be able to work on it. Yeni is a hard-working woman and is grateful for the loan, which she will use to purchase the necessary products.

loans.use: to purchase blocks, sand, gravel and other items.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 39 years old.  She sells sugar, rice, salt, cooking oil and scholastic materials such as books and pens. 

She is married with seven children who go to school.  

With this loan she plans to buy adding merchandise to sell.  Monique plans to use the profits to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Monique dreams to have a big store

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has been selling fish for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

Sandra was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to add more stock of fish for sale. 

Sandra will save the anticipated profit to help pay her children's school fees. In the future, Sandra hopes to grow her business and own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 34 years old and married with two children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns income from rice retailing.

Corazon aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anok

texts.en:
Anok is a 42-year-old a married woman with five children. All of them are in the school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Anok requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, onions and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions and rice for sale.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 52-year-old married woman with 3 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Esterlita sells food items like rice cakes and other delicacies. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month from this business. Esterlita plans to use her loan to purchase sugar, flour, sticky rice and other ingredients. Esterlita hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, sticky rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Monique Ibidjoke

texts.fr: Monique est une femme mariée et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Coiffeuse de formation, elle y a associé la vente des mêches et de pagnes. Pour étendre son secteur d'activité et  satisfaire sa clientèle, elle fait recours à Finadev visant ainsi à atteindre son objetif en vue de maximiser son profit et de contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Monique is a married woman who doesn’t have any children yet. Trained in hairstyling, she started selling hair extensions and pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing). To broaden her business and satisfy her clientele, she is seeking the help of Finadev in order to reach her goal of maximizing profits and to contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 hair extensions and 30 pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing).

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Edita  es casada, tiene 7 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Violetas” grupo  conformado por 7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Edita   trabaja desde hace  15 años en la venta de golosinas en  frente de un  colegio este trabajo surge porque ella quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de sus hijos ya que lo que su esposo ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a sus 7 hijos  y a su vez trabaja en un comedor popular de cocinera , pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos pueden ir al colegio ,  se ha comprado algunos artefactos eléctricos y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería golosinas, dulces .  Sabemos que Edita  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Edita is married and has 7 children. She is currently a member of the communal savings group “Las Violetas”, a group made up of 7 members who work in different commerce related activities. Edita has worked selling sweets outside a school for the last 15 years . She started working because she wanted to help her husband with housekeeping expenses and providing sustenance for their children, as what he earned was not enough to keep all 7 of them. She also works as a cook in a community soup kitchen. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she currently earns a better income, her children can go to school, she has bought some electrical appliances and, most importantly, her family’s living standards have improved. The loan she was granted was for buying sweets.  We know Edita will achieve her objectives by working hard and putting a lot of effort into what she does, and that Edaprospo’s loans will help her do this.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweets)

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina is 52 years old, married and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the last five years, she has earned a living by providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She earns about PHP 10,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport her passengers. Last year, Adelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and life. In the future, she hopes to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in a transportation business.

loans.name: Hinviton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HINVITON est composé de trois personnes qui se cohabitent. La représentante du groupe, nommée Akoivi Agathe (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 64 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Akoivi Agathe est veuve et mère de six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à sa charge. Akoivi Agathe vit seule avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Akoivi Agathe vend du maïs depuis une trentaine d’année par la technique de distribution. Akoivi Agathe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Akoivi Agathe ensemble avec les membres du groupe HINVITON sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs.

loans.name: Jennifer De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jennifer es una joven madre soltera con una niña de dos añitos de edad, le fue mal con su matrimonio ahora ella sola está intentando salir adelante con su labor como asistente en una institución, cuenta con un pequeño ingreso extra que obtiene de su negocio de pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación el cual cuida su madre. Con el crédito que solicita Jennifer invertirá en el negocio con granos básicos, carne, cereales, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros como productos enlatados como sardinas lo cual se consume bastante para esta época de verano.

loans.use: Jennifer solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio, con el objetivo de levantar las ventas y obtener más ingresos para su familia.

loans.name: Altin

texts.en: Altin B. is 51 years old and lives in Kardjali. He graduated machine construction and he has worked in an auto-repairs garage for more than 30 years. In 2002 he decided to set his own garage and to start own business. His specialty is an auto painting. Altin Bopiadjiev is one of the most popular painting masters and he is well known not only in the town but in the whole region. His wife is unemployed and his son works with him in the garage. Altin B. needs $ 1 600 to buy a special painting compressor

loans.use: To buy a special painting compressor

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is married with two daughters. She runs a small store selling groceries. The store is located on the first floor of a big apartment building which provides easy access for her clientele. She has been in this business for 7 years and has built up about $1,000 of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to $400-500. Antonina is very cheery and optimistic. Her little grocery store faces high competition as there are many supermarkets in the neighborhood. However, her customer-friendly service and the individual attention she can give help her keep loyal customers. Her responsibility and perseverence have helped Antonina repay all loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Antonina is requesting a loan of $1,200 for a couple of purposes. She is going to do some remodeling work inside her vending facility and she’d like to increase the assortment of food products she has available. Antonina is planning to use the generated income to help her younger daughter launch her own business venture after she graduates from college this year. This loan will help Antonina expand her business, having a positive impact on her trade profitability, and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

Антоніна – одружена, в неї двоє дочок. Вона – власниця невеличкої крамниці з продажу харчів. Крамничка розташована на першому поверсі великого багатоповерхового будинку, через що в Антоніни завжди багато клієнтів. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 7 років, сума її загального робочого капіталу складає приблизно 1000 доларів. Щомісячний прибуток становить приблизно 400-500 доларів. Антоніна – дуже життєрадісна та оптимістична. Їй доводиться стикатися з жорсткою конкуренцією, тому що в цьому районі знаходяться багато великих супермаркетів. Однак, привітне обслуговування та індивідуальний підхід до кожного покупця допомагають Антоніні зберегти відданих клієнтів. Її відповідальність та наполегливість допомогли їй сплатити усі позики, які вона отримала від „Надії України”. Антоніна просить про позику в 1200 доларів через декілька причин. По-перше, вона планує зробити ремонт в крамниці та збільшити асортимент продовольчих товарів. Використати отриманий прибуток Антоніна хоче для того, щоб допомогти своїй молодшій донці почати власний бізнес після того, як вона закінчить навчання в університеті. Ця позика допоможе Антоніні розширити її бізнес, значно збільшить торгівельну прибутковість та допоможе й надалі покращувати економічне та соціальне становище її родини.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Liidia

texts.en:
I sell tortillas throughout my neighborhood, where I find my best clients. I've been running this business out of my home for five years. Now I need to buy corn in order to sell my product this month. My profits help me and my husband provide for our children and send them to school.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi negocio es la venta de tortillas en todo mi comunidad, los cuales son mis mejores clientes. Este negocio lo tengo en mi casa y hace 5 años que me dedico a la venta. ahora nesecito la compra de maiz para poder vender en este mes. Ya que tengo que ayudar a mi esposo para que mis hijos ternimen sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a 39 year old father of five from Juliaca. On Sundays and Thursdays he travels to local ferias, where he buys and sells cattle. He has been trading cattle for three years now. During the rest of the week, Eusebio drives his tricycle taxi around Juliaca.

With a loan of $150, he will be able to make some necessary improvements to his tricycle taxi and to invest part of the loan in the cattle he trades.

loans.use: Make improvements to tricycle taxi and invest in cattle.

loans.name: Lava

texts.en: Lava is one of the first SPBD members from 2005, but then she left. She rejoined again because she needed help with her five year old business which is a shop. She wanted to expand into a mini supermarket and with her profit of $140 a week after all expenses from the previous years, in order to extend her shop she needed extra cash to finish the job. So she rejoined and within two months, her profit and payments increased, making her eligible for the next loan.

loans.use: To expand shop into a mini supermarket

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a more hygienic food kiosk.

loans.name: Pat Sok's Group

texts.en:
These two families live in a small village off of National Road Two, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They are requesting this, their first group loan from Maxima, to expand their businesses of producing knives and selling fish. Mr. P. S. was selected to be a group leader by members looking for a loan from Maxima.

1. Mr. P. S. (age 57) got married in 1960 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. He has been in the business of producing knives since 1965. His wife, Mrs. Morm My, is a housewife. Two of their children are married and live in separate houses. The other two of them are working in a garment factory. He is requesting a $200 loan from Maxima to expand his business of producing knives.

2. Mrs. S. Sreymom (age 32) got married in 2002 and has three children, one son and two daughters. She has been in the business of selling fish in her village since 2000. Her husband produces rice wine at home. One of her children is studying in the local school and the other two stay at home. She is requesting a $200 loan from Maxima for her fish sales.

loans.use: Group loan to produce knives and sell fish.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia O. is 50 years old.  She is married, has seven children and lives in Benin City. She sells soup items. Currently, she seeks a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more soup item to sell.  She believes that this will improve her business. Felicia has been in this business since 1992. She is a LAPO client and thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy more soup items for sale

loans.name: Bukaye B North A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Namaganda Z.. She is currently in the business of selling tianshi drugs and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs for sale. Namaganda is 52 years old and is married. Her husband has a butcher shop. She has 4 children ranging from age 11 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Namaganda makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and cater to home needs. Namaganda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more drugs, and the loan was paid back on time.

Namaganda is joined in her small group by Sauda M., Fatuma K., Zaina B., Muzaimu N. and Edith N.. Sauda M. has a retail shop business and wants to increase stock in her shop. Fatuma K. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and a retail shop and wants a loan to buy more poultry feed and also add items to the shop. Zaina B. operates a business of maize produce and wants to boost business. Muzaimu N. is currently in the business of charcoal making and is requesting a loan to buy more timber for burning charcoal. Edith N. has a retail shop and wants a loan to buy more shop items.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for sale

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy Y. is married with two little children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To make a living, she runs a laundry for the people in her community. Each day, she can normally make around $4 in revenue. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and earns around $5 each day in revenue.

Mrs. Thy Y. and her husband have recently requested a loan to purchase a piece of farmland and a hand tractor so that can grow rice crops and various kinds of vegetables. They will use the rest of the money to fill the land beneath her house to protect it from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy farmland and a hand tractor to grow rice crops.

loans.name: Sounkarou

texts.fr:
Sounkarou Kébé, age 30, is divorced and takes care of four children. She is an energetic member of the management committee of the village bank of Diaobé and has been loyal to Caurie for five and half years. She buys peanuts and makes peanut butter, which she sells at the Diaobé marketplace. Her income enables her to look after her children. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Sounkarou Kébé, 30 ans, divorcée, 04 enfants en charge est membre très dynamique du comité de gestion du banc villageois de Diaobé et fidèle à Caurie depuis cinq ans et demi. Elle achète des graines d’arachide et les transforment en pâte d’arachide qu’elle vend au marché de Diaobé. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir ses enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts

loans.name: Elika's Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Elika is 45 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 24,18 and 15 years old. Elika sells soft drinks. She started in 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Agness, Kesia and Digna, who have tailoring businesses, and sell maize and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks items for her business.

loans.name: Ronald Efrain

texts.es:
Ronald C. is a gentleman who runs a general store from his home in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. Ever since he started his business nine years ago, he has managed to improve the store’s condition, having invested in shelving and a refrigerator in which to store the beverages he sells.

He has excelled as a good entrepreneur who always attends to his customers, offering them a wide selection of products. He reached these achievements ever since he started working with Ceprodel, which has invested in his business by providing him with loans. Once again, he is seeking financial support in order to purchase merchandise to sell in his general store, thus continuing to maintain his household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald C. es un caballero que se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Desde hace nueve años que inició el negocio ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio habiendo invertido en la compra de estantes y de un refrigerador donde almacena las bebidas que comercializa.

Se ha destacado por ser un buen comerciante que en todo momento atiende a sus clientes ofreciéndoles gran variedad de productos. Estos logros los ha alcanzado desde que inició a trabajar con Ceprodel el cual al darle créditos los ha invertido en el negocio directamente. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo crediticio para la compra de su mercadería para ofrecerla en su pulpería y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Rocio

texts.en:
María is 33 years old, married, and has a 9-year-old daughter. She belongs to the Solución Village Bank and has taken out a loan already once before. María works in the Magdalena market where she makes juices. She and her husband together own a car which they use to transport harvest during the sweet potato harvest season. María purchases potatoes from the producers and sells them in Nazca. In turn, in Nazca she buys “guano” (turkey excrements) to then sell it to the Ayacucho farmers.

María currently needs a loan of US$1,075 to repair the car that she and her husband use for their business. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a new car, add more floors to her house, and open a hotel to ensure financial stability in old age.

loans.use: Repair of a car for business purposes

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Tuzamurane solidarity group of hard working entrepreneurs from Kigali in Rwanda!

This group is composed of 10 members. Uwingeneye Jackline is 20 years and old single. She sells different items like soap and salt, and she operates a small restaurant. She earns $60 every month. Ndayisaba is 35 years old and married with five children. He owns a small restaurant and earns a round $60 every month. Mutuyimana A. is 37 years old and married with six children and one adopted orphan. She sells second-hand clothes in the local markets and earns about $50 every month. Uwimana S. is 49 years old and married with five children. She sells women's fabrics in the market and earns about $60 every month. Kabayondo Patricia is 66 years old, a widow of the Genocide with six children. She sells different items like Sorghum flour, corn flour, cassava flour, and kilograms of salt and sugar in the area. She earns about $30 every month. Mujawayezu is 30 years old, a widow of Genocide with one child. She sells tomatoes, potatoes, rice, sugar, salt, cassava flour, etc. Haragirimana Jmv is 36 years and married with five children. He sells Sorghum to the local beer breweries in the area. He earns about $50 every month. Bayiro is 50 years old and married with 10 children. He owns a small shop selling different items like sorghum, pieces of soap, salt, sugar, matchboxes, etc. He earns about $60 every month. Habumugisha is 45 years old and married with five children. He buys and sells sorghum to different breweries in Kigali. Rutayisire is 45 years old and married with seven children and four adopted orphans. He buys beans from the local growers and sells them to markets in Kigali town. He earns about $60 every month.

This group includes a total of 36 children and 6 adopted orphans. The loan request is 80,000 RFW per each entrepreneur. The loan will be used to expand their businesses.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand their businesses

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 40 years old. She is married with six children between the ages of twelve and twenty-two years old. Since February of 2008, she has been in the business of selling firewood and bites (snacks). She works daily from 6am to 8pm and earns a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

Mwajuma is requesting a loan of $525 to expand her business by adding to her current stock of firewood and snacks. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have their own businesses selling bites and juice.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock of firewood and snacks.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia T. is 42 years old. She is a wife and mother of five children. Four of her children have completed high school; the youngest is still in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling fresh tomatoes, pepper and dried and smoked fish for twenty years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of tomatoes, pepper and fish from the farmers and fishmongers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy fresh tomatoes, pepper and dried fish in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support two of her children when they enter university, hopefully next year. Leticia is a member of a community group called "Nyame Mma" (God's children) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, dried fish, smoked fish and pepper to sell

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Mariée à ADOUNVO Staël, dame A. Denise est originaire de Covè dans le département du Zou. Née le 26 mai 1985, elle n'a jamais été à l'école et a été élevé par l'une de ses tantes. A 12 ans, elle aidait cette dernière à vendre de la nourriture. Après s'être mariée, elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec l'aide de sa belle-mère et de son mari. Elle vendait d'huile d'arachide et de sel de table. Pour pallier aux difficultés financières, elle a choisi de faire un prêt. Elle en est à son quatrième crédit d'un montant de 120000fcfa. Elle compte l'investir dans la vente de pagnes qu'elle fait depuis un an.
texts.en:
Married to Staël ADOUNVO, Ms. Denise A. is originally from Covè in Zou County. She was born on May 26, 1985 and has never attended school. She was raised by one of her aunts. At the age of 12, she used to help her sell food. After getting married, she started working on her own with the help of her mother-in-law and her husband. She sold peanut oil and table salt.
