To fend off financial difficulties, she has chosen to borrow money and is on her fourth loan in the amount of 120,000 francs CFA. She intends to invest in the selling of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), something she has been doing for a year.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 lengths of HITARGET-series pagnes

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 40 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su conviviente, quien la apoya en lo posible. Se dedica a la venta de comida, desde hace un año atrás, vende dentro de su casa, brindando desayunos y almuerzos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo cocinar bien, al gusto de los mismos. Le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y desde luego cuenta con sus clientes que le son fieles desde que inició. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Olinda, who is 40 years old, has five children and lives with her domestic partner, who helps her as much as possible. She has sold meals from her home for about a year, offering breakfasts and lunches. What she likes best about her work is giving good service to her clients and above all cooking well and to her clients’ taste. Her business is profitable because it is located in a good spot and because she counts on clients who have been faithful since she started. This is her first loan with Kiva field partner MFP. With the requested loan, she will construct a kiosk to be able to sell more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. is a single parent and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Stella prepares porridge, which is known as Koko, and a special kind of doughnut which is also known as Koose. She uses corn and millet for the preparation of the Koko and she uses beans and flour to prepare the Koose. She normally sells in the morning as breakfast to her customers at Ataabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 1990. Stella uses her income to pay for utility bills and the children's school fees. Stella will use the loan to increase production and sales by buying more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients which are needed for the food production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to invest in her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To purchase more corn, millet, beans and other ingredients which are needed for the food production.

loans.name: Prosy

texts.en:
Prosy N. is 28 years old and a responsible mother to 4 children, all in school. She has 2 years' experience in the retail business. She mainly sells fast-moving consumer products.

The loan is helping Prossy to replenish her stock of maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and paraffin. Her dream is to open up a supermarket and educate her children up through university.

loans.use: Purchase maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and paraffin for re-sale

loans.name: Main De L'eternel Group

texts.en:
Albert D. operates a roadside pharmacy and boutique. He is forty years old, a father of three children between the ages of 5 and 10, who all go to school. He has been in his business since 2000. He began with a capital of US$ 50 which allowed him to start a kiosk of soaps, biscuits, canned goods, matches, candles, etc.

From 2000 to 2002, with hard work, good management, and a profit of around US$ 10 per day, Albert’s business prospered and he increased his working capital to US$ 1000. He bought a plot of land in a good area for his business and he decided to stay there with his family and make his business permanent there. From the profit gained over time, he extended his business by adding clothing and children’s shirts, some of which he sent to the Kasai province in DRCongo for sale.

From 2004 to January 2008, Albert stabilized his business until he joined one of Hope’s groups called “La Main de Dieu” which means “God’s Hand” in English. Today, his business makes US$ 30 per day. Currently, his working capital is US$ 700. He has training as a nurse, and his dream is to open clinic in his area. The group consists of 27 members. He lives and sells in Masina, the most populated area of Kinshasa, located in the northern area of the city.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in order to add new products to his pharmacy

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
A pesar de haber tenido una vida muy difícil con la crianza de sus ocho hijos, Lorenza a sus sesenta y ocho años confiesa no tener otra opción mas que seguir adelante pues aun sueña con tener un estilo de vida mas estable económicamente. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo lo esta logrando.
Hace dos años Lorenza empezó con el negocio de alquiler de trajes y disfraces. Empezó rentando un local para su negocio un poco lejos de su casa, donde no duró más de medio año ya que la renta subió de precio. Luego de ello, estuvo un tiempo ofreciendo el mismo servicio en un puesto de una amiga suya en el mercado de su localidad; sin embargo, la dueña del puesto se lo reclamó, es por eso que decidió mudarse nuevamente de local. Esta vez consiguió un local más cómodo y cerca de su casa donde se mantiene hasta la actualidad.
Por lo pronto se encuentra creciendo en la variedad de trajes para el alquiler, no obstante su meta a futuro es conseguir un local ubicado en una zona mas comercial, y sobretodo poder pagarlo.
Por ahora, ella esta separada de su esposo, los gastos de su cada los cubre ella; además esta juntando dinero dentro de poco brindarle educación superior a su nieta de dieciocho años de quien es su apoderada.
texts.en:
Despite having led a very difficult life with the raising of her eight children, Lorenza, at sixty eight years of age, confesses that she has no other option than to forge ahead as she still dreams of a more financially stable lifestyle. Little by little, and with much effort, she is achieving this. Two years ago, Lorenza started a business renting suits and costumes. She began by leasing a site that was somewhat far from her house, a location that she didn’t last at for more than six months because they raised her rent. After this, she spent some time offering her goods from a friend’s stall at the market in her area. However, her friend then reclaimed her location, forcing her to move again. This time, she was able to obtain a more comfortable site closer to her home that she still has. She finds her supply of rentals growing, yet her goal for the future is to get a spot in a more commercial area that she can, above all, afford. For now, she is separated from her husband, and she must cover all her own expenses. In addition, she is saving money to provide an education for her 18-year old granddaughter, who she supports.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her granddaughter's education and for the purchase of new suits.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo en casa de su suegra. Desde hace 2 años se dedica al bordado, actividad que realiza en la comodidad de su casa y de paso atiende a su hijo menor, esta labor no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, y siempre gusta de combinar los colores en los fustanes que borda, para ella es un arte que cada día cultiva y desea mejorar. Además, que esta actividad es bien recompensada, ya que cada fustán dependiendo de su complejidad  puede llegar a costar hasta mil soles y eso es muy rentable. Según el tiempo de entrega de su trabajo puede llegar a bordar hasta 2 fustanes en un día. Para el futuro, Natalia quiere aumentar su producción, para lograrlo contratará a personas que sepan bordar tan bien como ella. Es la primera que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está decidida a ser una integrante muy activa en su banco comunal. Con el dinero requerido comprará telas e hilos de bordar grandes cantidades para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Natalia is 26 years old and lives with her husband in her mother-in-law's house. For two years now, she has an embroidery business which she administers from her home, and as it doesn't require a great physical effort, she is also able to care for her youngest son.

She likes combining colors in the fustians she creates; for her, it's an art that she cultivates and wants to get better at every day. Also, this activity is well-paid and depending on how complex, a fustian can sell for up to 1000 soles (3 soles = $1USD, approx.), which is very profitable. Depending on time of delivery, Natalia can make up to 2 fustians in a day.

For the future, Natalia would like to increase production by hiring people who can embroider as well as she can.

This is Natalia's first loan with MFP and plans on being a very active associate of the Communal Bank. With this loan, Natalia will buy a large quantity of fabrics and thread for embroidery, in order to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.en:
K. Saidbek is a young, married man who breeds calves in a small village in Zafarabad district of Sugd region. Saidbek is young but full of energy; he tries every single day to make the life of his family better.

He started his business three years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Saidbek has great experience in cattle breeding because he learned it from his childhood.

Saidbek would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his life conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more calves in order to expand his business

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
D. Takhmina is an enterprising woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and, as his salary has not been stable, sometimes they have accumulated debts. To help her husband, Takhmina decided to start her own business designing and making national dresses for women. She began her business after her first child was born and started with a small machine that she already owned. Now, she has a small workshop and two employees that help her cover the demands of her clients. The good service and fine quality she offers has made her business grow into a small company. Takhmina wants a loan of US$ 1500 to buy a sewing machine and material to help fill her customers’ orders. She promises to return the loan in 12 months. The loan will help her business grow and improve the quality of life for this family. Takhmina sincerely thanks you for your help. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine with computer-based embroidery for dressmaking business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A. was a laborer before. Now, he is managing a small farm for his family. His wife is helping him work in the farm  to provide all their family needs.  He is 29 years old. He married early and has one child. He wants to grow his farm and wants to buy another farm to improve their family economic condition.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer, 16 liters of crude oil for the tractor and to pay the laborers. The loan will help his family improve their harvest even more and have a better income. 


CEVI provides people with a chance to start and have their own business. It provide not just loans to their clients but also training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer, 16 liters of crude oil for the tractor and to pay laborers

loans.name: Gavidia

texts.es: Gavidia tiene 23 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Desde hace más de un año vende libros a domicilio, desde temprano por la mañana hasta la tarde, recorre las calles de su ciudad ofreciendo libros académicos para escolares. Gavidia visita a sus clientes de casa en casa, tanto para cobrar cuando los deja al crédito, como para ofrecer las novedades. Cuando vende al crédito obtiene mayores márgenes de ganancia, pero también debe asegurarse que le pagarán a tiempo. Para más adelante, Gavidia desea tener un puesto estable de venta de libros e incursionar en la venta de útiles escolares. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de los miembros que  promueve la unidad en su banco comunal, el cual lleva el nombre de “Unión Cahuide al Tambo”. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de libros para aumentar sus posibilidades de ventas.
texts.en:
Gavida is 23 years old and lives with her parents. For over a year she has been selling books door-to-door. Working from early morning until late afternoon, she travels the streets of her city selling school books for students. Gavida visits her clients in their homes, both to receive payments when she has sold them books on credit, and to offer them the latest arrivals. When she sells on credit she earns more, but she has to make sure she will be paid in a timely manner. Eventually she hopes to establish a locale from which she can sell her books, and in addition she wants to offer school supplies. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is one of the most active members of her community bank, which is called “Union Cahuide al Tambo.” The loan proceeds will be used to purchase more books to sell, in order for her to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - purchase books for resale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 55 years old, widowed, and has four children. Two of her children have already finished their studies in college, while the two youngest are presently studying.

Wilma owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling pop-rice and popcorn. Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of PHP8,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hopefuls Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado “Esperanzados” esta dirigido por la señora Eldy Verónica y conformado por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. ropa, cosméticos, comida y al trasporte público D. pasajeros. La competencia dentro del rubro a los cuales se dedican los socios es bastante competitivo por lo que tiene que esforzarse para obtener un ingreso que sustente a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para tener un capital D. trabajo y adquirir mayor mercadería para ampliar sus negocios y mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo que ayudara a brinda a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En el marco D. la experiencia en grupos solidarios los socios se encuentran cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no cuentan con mucha experiencia, pero saben ser muy trabajadores y responsables ya que D. ello depenD. su hogar.
texts.en:
The group called “Hopefuls” is led by Mrs. Eldy Verónica and is maD. up of 12 members, who mostly sell clothes, cosmetics, food, and public transportation for passengers. These sectors are very competitive, so the members must make a great effort to earn enough income to support their families. Because of this, they need a loan to have capital for their work and to buy more merchandise to grow their business and improve their tools for work, to help them offer their families a better quality of life. Since this is their first loan cycle, the members do not have a lot of experience in solidary groups, but they are known to be very hard-working and responsible, especially because their households depend on them.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for businesses

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia M. tiene ya mas de dos años con su negocio de papelería y renta de computadoras, esté es el ingreso de su familia ya que en trabajan ella y su esposo, para darles lo mejor a sus dos hijos pequeños que tiene.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y una muebles para tener en mejor condición las maquinas y unos anaqueles para la mercancía pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así realizar la comprar que necesita para la inversión del negocio. Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que genera el negocio con la mercancía que se compra.
texts.en:
For more than two years, Sra. Julia M. has been operating her stationery and computer rental business. This provides income for her family. Sra. Julia and her husband both work to give the best to their two young children.

Her business is lacking a variety of merchandise, the computer furniture is not in the best condition, and she needs more shelves for displaying products. At the moment, she does not have the money necessary to make these changes but doesn’t want to cripple her business. This is why she is requesting a loan and will buy everything she needs to invest in her business. She will repay the loan with the income she generates from the merchandise she plans to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and furniture for her business

loans.name: Byamba-Ochir

texts.en: Byamba-Ochir D. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and 20-year-old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His son is currently attending college. Byamba-Ochir started a mobile grocery business in 2005 with the help of his wife. He travels in his car to countryside areas, where quality grocery stores are lacking, and sells grocery items to people who are unable to travel to the province capital.  He would like to use this loan to expand the number of products he sells as the demand for more diverse food items in his area is increasing. However, his and his wife's ultimate goal is to make sure their son receives a good education and becomes a good person.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Mundo Magico Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mundo Mágico inicia su primer ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. repuestos, abarrotes en general, comida, libros, ropa, también brindan servicios D. sastrería, cabinas telefónicas y reparación D. carros.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. repuestos D. carro, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, telas.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, tener un local propio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos de carro, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, telas.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: L. Bernadette est née vers 1978 à Hanzounmè à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Bernadette est mariée à METONNOU Bathélémy. Le couple a quatre enfants. La famille vit à Akpro-missérité. Bernadette a fait le cours primaire. C’est ensemble avec son mari que Bernadette assure les charges de la famille. Bernadette fait la couture ; mais principalement, Bernadette coût  les vêtements et les met en vente. Bernadette a déjà douze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Bernadette est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Bernadette demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Bernadette L. was born around 1978 in the district of Hanzounme in Porto-Novo, the capital city of Benin. Bernadette is married to Bathelemy Metonnou. The couple has four children and they live in the town of Akpro-Misserite. Bernadette completed primary school. Together with her husband, Bernadette covers the family expenses. Bernadette is a hair stylist, but mostly, she makes and sells clothing. Bernadette has gathered 12 years' experience in this occupation. Bernadette is a client of Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she has always managed to repay her loans. In order to meet customer demands, Bernadette requires a loan, to be used as working capital.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, to make clothing.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
United Group is a group of five borrowers led by Saah M.. He is 29 years old and a single father of two children, both five years old and in kindergarten. Saah also cares for two siblings. Saah is a college student. He lives and works in WestPoint, a slum north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Saah's business is general home use products. He buys them wholesale and sells to the residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
He started this business with LD $2500.00 and has been running his business for six years. Saah takes care of his children with the income from this business. He approaches his customers in a very good manner and sells good products to them to encourage them to always come and buy from him.
Saah is hoping to expand his business in the future.
He needs this loan to purchase more general home use products in order to expand his business.
He dreams of giving him and his family a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more general home use products

loans.name: Wilsa

texts.en:
Wilsa E. is from the village of Banlag, Valencia City. She is 30 years old. Wilsa is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Wilsa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Wilsa has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wilsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilsa is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong S. is a widower caring for two teenage children. Kong S. is currently a local carpenter who makes tables, chairs, and cupboards for sale. He sells furniture to the customer after he finishes making it. Almost all of his clients need to wait a few weeks. Kong S. has operated his business for a long time, but he still needs some materials.  Kong S. is pursuing a loan to purchase extra carpentry materials to better supply the good service he provides.

loans.use: To purchase extra carpentry materials

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 50 years old. She is married to Mr. N. who is a civil servant and they have eight children.

Philomena sells groceries and drinks and does this trade to make her living; she manages the business with her last two children who are in school. Philomena intends to add other items like fresh fish, vegetables, etc., to her sales as the level of demand for them is high. This will attract sales and maximize her profit.

Philomena’s challenge is power failure. She is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase a generator that will power her freezer and other electrical appliances at the shop.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and a generator

loans.name: Pekina

texts.en:
Pekina M. is currently in the business of selling beans, peas and maize, and is requesting a loan to buy other items like posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize flour), sugar and rice to sell. Pekina is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house in her settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dresses, skirts and baby clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Omid-E-Sarak Dowom Group

texts.en:
The Omid-e-Sarak Dowom group is made up of four female members. Soma is the group leader. She is 35, married and has a beauty salon in which she is busy during week days. She is a hard-working woman and all her family members benefit from the income she generates. She has requested a loan to buy new quality cosmetics and some other required materials necessary for the progress of her business.

Another member of this group is Bebe Keshwar who wants to take out a loan for her son’s gas selling shop. With the loan, he would like to purchase more gas balloons. The third member is Fahima who wants to take out a loan for her husband’s retail shop and the last member, Zahera, would like to take out a loan for her brother’s general store which he will use to buy more materials.

They all have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy soft drinks and water for resale and ice to cool the beverages

loans.name: Unidas Para Progresar 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Maxima is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Para Progresar (United to Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 5 children.

Maxima is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business making curtains by purchasing large rolls of cloth and different decorations, such as bows and sequins with which to decorate her curtains. She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children and in her home by refinishing the floor. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Cloth by the roll, decorations

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es: Doña Catarina Z. Gutiérrez cuenta con 54 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y Venta de  Ropa Típica”  habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 8 años de Vender en su negocio que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Catarina Z. Gutiérrez is 54 years old, is married and lives together with her husband and 2 children. She is a businesswoman who buys and sells traditional clothing. She and her husband work in the same business, and have sold clothes for 8 years. Their business is found in Paraje Xolcajá, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. Her clientele's demand has increased but she doesn't have the economic conditions to increase her working capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of buying materials and in this way increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her sons progress and give them better living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery products to stock up her store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío La Pava, una zona agrícola del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque; ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de cuatro años. Ella cría aves de corral en un ambiente destinado para este propósito que se encuentra situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio; los animales que mas cría, debido a que tienen mayor acogida, son los pavos. Angelita nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a dedicarse a esta actividad porque su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica a trabajar como obrero en labores agrícolas y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más aves para engordarlas y venderlas a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Angelita es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que se le considera una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Angelita is a 45 year old mother of a family who lives with her husband and her children in a La Pava, an agricultural zone of Mochumí district, Lambayeque province, located 1 1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 4 years she has raised and sold animals. She raises poultry in a corral constructed for the purpose in the back part of her house. The poultry she favors, because of high demand, is turkeys. Angelita commented that she had to start dedicating herself to this activity because her husband, like the majority of men of the zone, works as an agricultural laborer and the income he receives is insufficient to cover family expenses. She wants to expand her business by buying more birds to fatten and sell to business people who visit the zone regularly. With this motive, she decided to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,500 New Sols to help her achieve her objective. Angelita is happy, hard-working, and very committed to her family. She has worked before with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her payments, for which reason we consider her an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING POULTRY TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama C. sells cooking pots and utensils in Jukwa. She is divorced and has two children. She has received junior high education. Ama is responsible for feeding, clothing and providing a better education for her children. Her loan will be added to her own capital to buy various types of utensils for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy various types of utensils for sale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 34, married, and has two children who go to school. She bakes Maandazi (African doughnuts) and prepares uji (porridge) for sale in Nairobi to earn a living.  She also sews clothes to earn extra income since the living costs are high in the capital city.  Her customers are mostly the area residents who keep on returning because of her good customer care skills.  

She saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya which enables her to access loans. She hopes to grow her businesses now that she can access loans and this is her second loan. She had previously taken out a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid.  She has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add stock of flour, sugar, sewing materials and a sewing machine. She hopes to open a restaurant and tailoring premises in the future.

loans.use: Flour and sugar; sewing materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz F. is a wife of M. aslam and lives in the city named Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home and does household chores. She is fond of cooking and prepares healthy food for her family. 

Her husband involves in a ice blocks selling business. He places the ice blocks in his four-wheeled cart. His business grows especially in the summer season because people approaches him for purchasing ice which they used to drink chilled water. 

Kaniz is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband's business. So he can purchase more ice and increases his income.

loans.use: Purchase ice blocks for selling

loans.name: Phang's Group

texts.en: Five people make up this group loan. Phang C., 31, is their leader.  Each member will use part of the overall loan for different purposes.  Phang wants to expand her general store to support her family.  Business is going well.  Phang is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell.  Her husband is a soldier.  She is the mother of three children.  Two attend a local public school and the youngest is too small to work or study.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Narciza Margarita

texts.es:
Narciza de 39 años, vive en Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) de Guayaquil, su esposo es taxista con el tiene cinco hijos. 

Ella tiene un puesto de venta de tripita (llamado así en Ecuador porque son los intestinos de la vaca que los hacen como parrillada). Comenzó ayudándole a su prima en un puesto que ella tenia poco a poco con esfuerzo ella pudo tener su propio puesto de venta de tripita. Ahora ella trabajaba  desde las 15h00 hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con ayuda de un triciclo recorre las calle. 

Pero para tener mas efectividad en sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo otro triciclo para transportarse con mas cuidado y limpieza. E el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Narciza is 39 years old and lives in Duran, an urban area in Guayaquil. The area was originally uneven, with many hills, streams and lakes that exist as the remains of a dissolving ecology. Her husband is a cab driver and with him she has five children. Narciza has a stall where she sells tripe, called this in Ecuador because it is grilled cow intestines. She began by helping in her cousin's stall, and little by little, with effort, she was able to get her own stall selling tripe. Now she works from 3 to 6pm every day, with help from a tricycle that she drives around the streets. In order to be more effective in sales, she wants a loan to buy another tryicycle so that she can travel more carefully and neatly. In the future, she wants to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle to help improve her food sales

loans.name: We Don Cam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “We Don Cam” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata S. (who is pictured in the middle, back row). Fatmata is age thirty-two, and she was born in Makeni. She is married with three children. Her husband is a professional worker and one of her children is in secondary school, the other is in primary school and the last is still a baby. 

For eleven years now, Fatmata has been selling market food – rice, groundnuts/peanuts, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggii (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc.  With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, groundnuts/peanuts, palm oil, Maggi cubes, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 54 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 8 años en su casa propia, pues sus hijos mayores son independientes y viven separados de ella. Hace más de 6 años trabaja vendiendo verduras, en un pequeño puesto dentro de un mercado situado en el distrito de Chancay. Desde ahí ofrece sus productos desde muy temprano en la mañana, lo cual le resulta rentable y tranquilo. Este trabajo le da satisfacción pues una persona que le gusta el comercio, aunque a veces le es cansado, por tener que traer la mercadería desde su casa a su puesto, pero felizmente su pequeña hija la ayuda en el negocio. Ella espera en un futuro poder seguir implementando y ampliando su puesto, para así lograr mejores ventas y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y se caracteriza por ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, y con ello espera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 54 years old and shares her life with her husband and her eight year old daughter. They live in their own home. She also has adult children who are independent and live apart from her. For more than six years, Isabel has been selling vegetables from a small market stand in the district of Chancay. There she begins offering her products early in the morning, resulting in a profitable and peaceful business. Her work provides her satisfaction since she is a person who enjoys selling. Sometimes she gets tired from having to carry her merchandise from her house to her stand, but happily her young daughter helps with the business. In the future, she hopes to continue operating and expanding her business so that she can improve her sales and move her family forward.

This is her third loan with MFP. Isabel is known for being prompt with all of her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise in hopes of improving her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more perishable products to increase her sales

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Mr. S. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo here. S. makes wooden furniture. He sells his finished product to buyers who come directly to his house and he transports his furniture to sell around his community. He is married to Chan Chreb, age 40, and they have three school-aged kids. To earn additional profit, S. is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more products to sell.

loans.name: Mairo Mbili Drivers Association Group 1-Jinja

texts.en:
She is an industrious lady who has been at the helm of a six-year-old beauty salon business in Jinja. Running a business like this requires making continuous audacious decisions and that is exactly what M. Regina has been doing. Her set objective has always been to see her business get into that position of improved circumstances. This diligent lady used the money she had set aside as savings to open this business. Her first business was a pub.

This 48-year-old single mother of four makes about $13 a week.  She supplements these profits with earnings from her charcoal-selling business. Customers at her beauty salon are mostly community members. With this loan, she wants to buy more hair chemicals and hair pieces for her salon and also more bags of charcoal for reselling.

loans.use: to purchase more hair chemicals for her beauty salon and bags of charcoal for reselling

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María A. G., tiene la edad de 38 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos. Ellos tienen 19,15,14,11 y 5 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos de engorde. La idea es criar los pollos de engorde, aumentar la cantidad para luego venderlos a otros clientes, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Ella cuenta  con un local para el desarrollo y engorde de los pollos.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Ana María desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Ana María A. G., 38, is married and has 5 children: aged 19,15,14,11 and 5 years. She wants a loan to purchase broiler chickens. The idea is that she will raise broiler chickens and breed them, later selling them to her customers. This way she will have the highest possible income when she sells them. She has a place where she can raise the chickens. This is the first time that she has taken a loan from FUDECOSUR, and she is very pleased with the ease of payments that they offer. Ana Maria hopes that this business will help her to provide economic support to her household. In the future she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna R. is 53 years old. She is a single parent and a good mother to her three minor children. They currently live in Hamtic, Antique. She has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for more than eight years and also gets involved in a variety store as another source of household income.

She plans to utilize this loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to expand her hog-fattening business and variety store and to continue to be involved in other businesses for supplemental profits. This loan will be used to support the maintenance of her hog-raising and pay for inventory for her store. She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty.

During her eight years as a member of ASHI, Myrna has shown very good performance with her group mates and center. Having this loan will enable her to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a successful business, to fund the educational needs of her children until they finish college and to have a better life and a happy family as well. She is very thankful to ASHI and Kiva for the continuous support of her dreams.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of her hog-raising business and pay for inventory for her store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, aged 30, is married to David, who works as a mechanic. They have no children and live in the town of Kariobangi, which is located on the outskirts of a Nairobi. For many years now, Catherine has operated a shop where she makes and sells bead work. Kariobangi is a highly populated area with many poor people nearby. With this loan, she plans to buy more of the raw materials she needs to make the items she sells. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open other shops in the city center and on the outskirts of Nairobi

loans.use: To buy more materials to make beaded items to sell

loans.name: Inelda

texts.es: La Sra. Inelda E. C.  ella es Trabajadora activa del colegio San Cristóbal  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  veinte y dos años de trabajar como docente, es casa actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Inelda E. C. works at the San Cristóbal school as an elementary school teacher. She is married, and she has worked as a teacher for 22 years. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and she has used each of them to buy construction materials to improve the house where she lives. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since they have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Buying sand, cement, quarry stone, iron and construction blocks

loans.name: Larkoh United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Larkoh United” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Yayah Larkoh. Yayah is aged forty-four and he was born in Magburaka. He is married. Yayah is a lorry driver and a businessman. He sells palm oil, groundnuts, shoes, clothes, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items to sell and will also buy spare parts for his motorcar

loans.use: buy palm oil, groundnuts, shoes, clothes, etc., and also spare parts

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La  señora Pascuala O., es casada tiene 4 hijos la mayoria mayor de edad, la señora se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal de San Estanislao, según ella comenzo vendiendo mandioca y banana por la zona de Santani en una camioneta venia con su hijo cada dia.
Con el  correr de los tiempos, y con el sacrificio y la lucha constante acompañada por su hijo, consiguio alquiler un pequeño salon  en el mercado donde ella pueda almacenar sus mercaderias y atender mejor a cada uno de sus clientes, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda la Fundacion Paraguaya ahora ya compro otra camioneta donde sus hijos hacen reparto de sus productos por toda la zona de San Estanislao, su sueño es de tener un local propio para que puede trabajar en forma eficiente y asi tener una vida digna para poder salir adelante y lograr sus metas u objetivos propuestos.
texts.en:
Sra. Pascuala O. is married and has four grown children. She sells vegetables and fruits at the municipal market of San Estanislao. Pascuala says she began selling cassava and bananas from the District of Santani that her son brought in by truck each day.

As time passed and with great sacrifice, she continued to struggle along with her son. Pascuala was able to rent a small space at the market where she could store her merchandise and provide better service to each of her customers. Thanks to the assistance provided by Fundación Paraguaya, she has now purchased another truck so that her children can deliver her products throughout the area of San Estanislao. Her dream is to have her own store where she can work in an efficient manner. She wants to have a decent life in which she can get ahead and achieve her goals and proposed objectives.

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar:
حسن متزوج وله ولدان عمره 55 سنة يعمل في نقل الخردة والحطب يعمل في مصلحته من اكثر من 8 سنوات يحب عائلته فهي اولى اهتماماته يحب
ان يطور عمله ويريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب لنقل الخردة والحطب له زبائن كثر من محيطه العملي وهو مقصود لنقل خردة التجار المحيطين به
لكنه تعب من نقل الخردة والحطب على العربة يتلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته لكي يحسن وضعه الاجتماعي المادي جدير بالثقة فهو جدي في العمل صادق ودقيق
texts.en: Hassan is a 55-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much and wants to put them on firmer financial footing. Hassan in turn receives considerable support from them. Hassan has more than eight years experience collecting scrap metal and wood, with his many customers hailing from business colleagues who retail his materials. Hassan is very earnest and rigorous in his profession. Because he has become worn out from carting all this scrap metal and wood around, he is currently seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to procure a pick-up truck to facilitate his work.

loans.use: To purchase a pick-up truck to collect scrap metal and wood

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora T. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers, such as chicken, pork adobo, afritada, and  caldereta, in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be Nora's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en:
Mr. Purevjav is 24 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and two sisters-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since his family does not have their own housing yet, they live together in his sisters-in-law's apartment.  His daughter is 1 year old and stays at home with his wife's younger sister.  His wife works in the marketing department of a local company.  

Previously, Mr. Purevjav worked at a wood factory in Khentii province before he moved to Ulaanbaatar. In 2008, he moved to Ulaanbaatar and began his small mobile phone retail business with only 2 million MNT, when the Tedy-3, a mobile phone market, was established.  At his stall, he sells mobile phones to local residents.  Today, his working capital has increased to 6 million MNT.

Mr. Purevjav is naturally hardworking and known to be friendly to his customers.  Compared to the other stalls around him at the market, Mr. Purevjav's mobile phones are better quality. He also sells a wider variety of mobile phone model choices.  

He has been successfully expanding his business and was able to improve his living condition gradually.  He said, "I want to grow my business with this loan. I would like to be able to buy my own house in the future." In order to increase his mobile phone variety for his customers, Mr. Purevjav is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of mobile phones

loans.name: Ximena Katherine

texts.es:
Ximena Katherine M. M. tiene 26 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Ximena Katherine se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz cacao y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es sembrar mucho maiz

Le gusta pasear y viajar mucho
texts.en:
Ximena Katherine M. M. is 26 years old, she is single and she lives with her parents in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos province. She has 1 daughter.

The V.R.C. Divino Niño (Divine Child Communal Bank) is located in the Estero Lindo precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; it is composed of 12 members who engage in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Ximena Katherine engages in agriculture, sowing maize, cocoa and rice. She buys her products in the Farma-Agro and sells them in the same place.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of sowing a lot of maize.

She enjoys walking and she likes traveling a lot.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent N. is from Ibanda. He is 32 years old and married with two children. 

He has a business of cattle fattening where he buys cattle and raises them for a while, then sells them at a profit. He works together with his wife and this has kept his family strong and together. 

His has no specific customers but deals with the general public. 

He also has another source of income from the sale of bananas. He has been in business for more than 15 years and he began the cattle fattening business after saving from the sale of bananas and goats. 

Vincent needs a loan to be able to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. In 2007, Safaa opened his own food market in an area where the competition is minimal. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

Safaa is requesting a $3000 loan to install new windows for the shop and put a sign at the entrance. He is aiming to extend his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install new windows for the shop and put a sign at the entrance

loans.name: Vilma De Jesus

texts.es: Vilma De Jesús tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella ofrece una variedad de granos. Es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora por lo que vive muy feliz con su negocio a pesar de ganar mucho con este negocio le proporciona lo necesario para mantenerse a ella y la familia. Ella solicita urgentemente para comprar frijoles, azúcar, aceite, arroz, concentrado maíz entre otros. Su deseo es mantener siempre su record crediticio porque sin él no podría avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma De Jesús, 42, sells basic grains.  She’s been in business for over 9 years.  She offers a variety of grains.  She is a very cheerful, hard working person who lives happy with her business.  Despite not earning much with the business it provides the basics for her and her family’s support.
She urgently needs to buy beans, sugar, oil, rice, concentrate and corn, among other.  Her wish is to always maintain her credit history because without it she’d be unable to progress with her business.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, oil, rice, concentrate and corn, among others.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino A. M. es vecino de  Cartagena en Guanacaste, es uno de los socios que participaran en el proyecto de la venta de miel para ganado (melasa.
En este momento el necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una Tanqueta de miel necesaria para iniciar su proyecto de venta de una miel conocida como melaza, esta sirve de alimento para el ganado  y se ha convertido en un gran negocio para la comunidad. El asegura que son más de 40 ganaderos que van a necesitar de sus servicios a penas inicie el proyecto 
El es parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena, una de una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Marcelino A. M. lives in Cartagena in Guanacaste. He is one of the members who participate in the project selling sugar for cattle (molasses)

He needs a loan in the amount of 500 000 (five hundred thousand colones) to purchase a tub of molasses that he needs to start his business selling the sugar known as molasses. This is used as feed for cattle and it has become a profitable business for the community. He is certain that there are more than 40 farms that will require his services and he has only started the business.

He is a member of Empresa de Credito Communal de Cartagena, one of the 110 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase molasses

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline Rugut is 45 years old and married to John Rugu, a driver. They have two children, aged 18 and 16 years old. Angeline rears poultry for both eggs and meat on their farm in Chemundu village in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of eight years, getting a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Angeline has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, this being her fifth loan after she successfully serviced her previous loans well She intends to use the money to buy feed for the chickens (KES 28,000) and also to order more chicks (KES 22,000). The profits will be used to extend the poultry farm and also improve their living standards.

Her dream is to own a dairy farm and also to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Хамдамов Шокиржон проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 44 года. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Образование-среднее. Он занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи и арбуз по сезону. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Shokirjon H. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 44 years old. He is married and has six children. He has secondary education. He is in agriculture and he mainly grows vegetables and watermelon during the season. He has been in this business for eight years. Shokirjon is asking for the loan to buy watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Twunguranibitekerezo Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel N. est agriculteur de riz dans le secteur du Ruhuha, membre du group Twunguranibitekerezo et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 41 ans, il est marie, et il a 6 enfants entre 4 ans et 17 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Emmanuel est ne a Ruhuha, au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit et son deuxième cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire d remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des fertilisants, et de la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir une caisse mutuelle de 5000FRW entre les membres du groupe, avoir une réunion entre les membres du groupe chaque mois, avoir une épargne, et l’augmentation d’étendu de son activité.  Il voudrait améliorer la culture de riz, et donner à chaque membre du groupe une vache dans 5 ans.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait éduquer ses enfants, et les autres membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel N. is a rice farmer in the Ruhuha sector.  He has been a member of the group Twunguranibitekerezo and a client of ACB since 2010. He is 41 years old and married, and he has six children, aged 4 to 17. Four of his children are going to school. Emmanuel was born in Ruhuha, in Rwanda, and he has a primary school education. This loan cycle is his second one with ACB, and he has a good repayment record. 

Emmanuel is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor. His strategy for business growth is to have a mutual account of 5,000 FRW among the group members; to have monthly meetings of the group members; to have a savings account; and to expand his business. He would like to improve his rice crops and to provide each group member a cow in five years. For his family, he would like to educate his children, as well as the other members of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Sehllin Liseth

texts.es:
Sehllin comerciante de ropa, zapatos y electrodomésticos, iniciando este negocio hace nueve años con fondos propios, proveniente de su esposo el cual labora de maestro de obra.
Comenzó con pocos productos  las ventas, lo que se hizo socia con su mama para elevar el inventario generándole mejores resultados económicos, luego comienza con financiamiento en Afodenic , lo que logro comprar más ropa, zapatos, electrodoméstico, el cual vende al contado y al crédito, comprando a proveedores a mejor precio, para vender a bajo costos sus productos.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: cuatro licuadoras, seis abanicos, seis planchas, ropa, zapatos, para seguir con sus ventas, y cumplir con sus pedidos de sus clientes.  Gracias a la institución ahora su negocio ha crecido, para el bienestar común de la familia.
texts.en:
Sehllin earns a living selling clothing, shoes and domestic appliances.  She set up her business nine years ago with funds provided by her husband who works as a master builder.

She began selling only a few products but joined forces with her mother to increase inventory and achieve better economic results.  Later she took out a loan through Afodenica and began buying clothing, shoes, and domestic appliances which she sells on a cash or credit basis.  She buys from suppliers at better prices and is able to sell her products at lower cost.

With the new loan she plans to buy four blenders, six fans, six irons, clothing, and shoes in order to fill the orders she already has taken.  Thanks to the institution her business has grown which has helped her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy domestic appliances, clothing and shoes to increase sales.

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus, from the town of Kitale in western Kenya, has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years and sells his milk and eggs to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. Protus faces the challenges of poultry diseases and insufficient poultry feed.

Protus is making his third loan request from Juhudi Kilimo for 40,000 Kes to purchase an additional stock of chickens and construct a poultry house. This loan will improve his production of eggs and earn him more income, thereby enabling him to better provide for the needs of his family. He plans to have 2000 chickens in the next five years and be the main supplier of eggs to the local market.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of chickens and construct a poultry house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old, married to Linet, and together they are blessed with one child. He sells African handicrafts which he has been doing for the last four years. The business earns him a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy more handicrafts for sale. Peter hopes to educate his child and be a successful businessman by joining international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale

loans.name: Elivase

texts.en: Elivase is 26 years old. He has two children who are ages three and seven years old, the youngest is in school. His wife is a business woman. Elivase sells scrap (old metallic subsistence) He has done this business for the past four years and his business is doing well. He is requesting a loan to buy more scrap from which he expects to make profits. He plans to continue meeting the needs of his family with the profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying scrap for sale.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has two children.

Mansour has had a shop since 2004 selling and repairing satellite equipment. He has much experience, a deep understanding of local consumers and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, tiene la edad de 51 años, está casado, vive con sus3 hijos y su esposa. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de una vaca para el engorde. Ella compra ganando para engorde lo mantiene en su finca y cuando esta para listo para su venta lo vende al comercio de la zona generándole así ganancias para su bienestar. Ella con esa compra quiere aumentar la cantidad de animales a su poder y así tener más animales luego para su posterior venta y aumentar las ganancias para lograr varios proyectos de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Arturo, 51, is married and living with his three children and his wife.  He intends to use the money to buy a cow to raise.  He buys cattle to raise that he keeps on his farm and when it’s ready for sale he sells it in the local market to generate income for his wellbeing.  He wants to increase the number of animals he has in order to have more for subsequent sale and increased profits to carry out life projects.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dagni

texts.es:
Dagni de 30 años de edad, vive con sus hijas en casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en  el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece a la provincia de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Dagni se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Dagni es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dagni is 30 years old and lives with her daughters in her parent's home which only has electricity. It is located in the district of Tambogrande which is part of the Piura province. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.  

Over the last few years Dagni has sold groceries including milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs and beverages. She runs her business from home because it is a comfortable and safe option. With the profits she makes from this business she tries to cover her costs and improve her family's standard of living. 

To expand her business, Dagni is applying for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more groceries. She would like her business to grow and to have more products to offer her customers to cover the loan and her home expenses. Dagni is responsible, dedicated and hardworking, and aims to provide her children with greater comfort in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk to replenish her store's supplies

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rubie is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rubie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rubie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the gasoline to provide the services.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es: Frank, de 22 años es un joven muy dinámico, alegre, trabajador. El es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus abuelos a quienes ayuda con los gastos del hogar.El trabajo de Frank es muy pesado. El se dedica a realizar el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, se levanta por las madrugadas para salir y así poder ganar los pasajeros que van a los centros escolare y a los centros de trabajo, esta actividad ya la realiza hace casi tres años, lo hace por las calles de la ciudad.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que se divierte al mismo tiempo que genera un ingreso a la economía de su hogar, lo que no le gusta es que las calles de la ciudad son muy descuidadas y le maltrata a su vehiculo y a sus riñones ya que a veces sufre dolores fuertes en la espalda. Espera mas adelante poder ampliar su actividad, poder comprar algunos otros productos y vender al mismo tiempo que seguir trabajando con su mototaxi.Este es el segundo préstamo de Frank con la institución MFP, le agrada trabajar con un grupo tan responsable con el que tiene y espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución ya que esta muy agradecido que le den la oportunidad de crecer económicamente y así poder apoyar a sus abuelos que le educaron para ser muy agradecido.Con los 1000 soles solicitados el comprará repuestos para su vehiculo, ya que esta un poco maltratado y el sabe que tiene que cuidar su herramienta de trabajo ya que sin el no podría seguir ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en:
Frank, aged 22, is a very dynamic, good-natured, and hard-working young man.  He is single with no children, and lives in his grandparents' home, where he helps them with the household expenses.

Frank's work is very hard.  He works providing passenger transport into and out of the city.  He gets up at dawn to leave for work, and  find the passengers who are going to the educational and business areas.  He has been doing this work for nearly three years, throughout the streets of the city.  What he likes most about his work is that he has fun at the same time has he earns an income for household finances.  What he doesn't like, is that the streets of the city are very neglected and damage his vehicle and his body; sometimes he suffers from bad back pain.

This is Frank's second loan through the MFP institution.  He appreciates working with such a responsible group as this, and hopes to be able to continue working with the institution.  He is very grateful to them for giving him the opportunity to grow financially, and in this way be able to help his grandparents who educated him, for which he is very grateful.

With the 1,000 Soles requested, he will buy spare parts for his vehicle as it is a little damaged.  He knows that he has to take care of his means of work, as without it he won't be able to continue contributing to the household,

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle, as it is a little damaged and he knows he has to take care of his means of work.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a hardworking individual who desires to uplift her lifestyle and provide the needs of her family. According to her, being a single parent is quite hard because she has to do all the responsibilities of being a parent to her four children. All of them go to school. That's why Madelyn doubled her hard work to provide all their needs. 

Madelyn operates a restaurant located in the public market. She has had this business for one year and she's glad because some of her friends help her in running it to grow. With her determination in life, she works hard to send all her children to a higher level of education, she is asking for financial support from the lenders. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy raw meat, vegetables, soft drinks, ingredients and rice needed for her restaurant. She will be glad if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, vegetables, soft drinks, ingredients and rice needed for her restaurant

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 27 year old young woman, married and has one child. The family is residing in the province of Isabela. It's been Marivics's dream to own a motorcycle for subsistence, which was brought into reality through hard work and determination. Her husband is the one who drives their motorcycle,  sending passengers to designated areas safely. It allows them to earn PHP 4,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too.

A loan of PHP 5,000 will absolutely help Marivic to repair her motorcycle. The availability of these funds is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan, Marivic is expecting to pursue her job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. She hopes to sustain the daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 22 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 2 hermosas hijas: Gelen y Mayli. Ellas son su razón de vivir y juntas viven en el centro poblado de Unión Autiki. El camino para lograr su estabilidad económica, fue difícil. Cuenta que logró obtener 2 terrenos agrícolas con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Ahí siembra café y plátanos con mucho esmero, pues sabe que depende de ello la buena cosecha que obtendrá y por ende sus ganancias. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia sembrando y lo que más le gusta es comercializar sus cultivos en la ciudad de Pichanaki, pues ve concretado su esfuerzo, además aprovecha sus viajes a la ciudad para comprar vestido y alimento a sus hijas. Su objetivo es consolidar un negocio propio y así obtener una ganancia extra; ya dio su primer paso con la conformación de una tienda de golosinas, donde está vendiendo muy bien, pero le falta capital de trabajo, por ello comenzó a trabajar con este grupo de mujeres que conforman su asociación, está segura que logrará convertir su pequeña tienda en una lugar surtido y con más productos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
