Lourdes de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de golosinas para su tienda y 2 mil plantitas de café para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Lourdes is 22 years old and is a hard-working single mother of two beautiful daughters: Gelen and Mayli.  They are her reason for living and they live together in the town of Unión Autiki. It was very hard for her to achieve financial security.  She shares that she managed to get two agricultural plots with a lot of hard work and effort.  There she works hard farming coffee and plantains, because she knows she is dependent upon the harvest for her earnings.  She has 8 years of experience farming and her favorite part of the job is selling her products in the city of Pichanaki, as it provides concrete evidence of her labors. She also takes advantage of her trips to the city to buy food and clothing for her daughters.  Her goal is to start her own business and in that way, earn a little extra money.  She has already taken the first step by starting her own sweets shop, where she is having a lot of success.  However, she lacks the capital for her business.  This is why she began to work with this group of women in the loan group.  She is certain that she will be able to make her little store one that is well-stocked and offer more products.  She belongs to the "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) community bank and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is hopeful for the support of all of you to achieve her dreams.  She also promises to be punctual with her loan payments.  Lourdes will use the loan money to buy sweets for her store and 2,000 coffee seedlings for her next planting.

loans.use: buy sweets to stock her kiosk, as well as 2,000 coffee plants

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, el habita junto a su esposa, su hijos ya todos son independiente, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder mejorar la vivienda, don Francisco desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para poder comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para su inducción ya que sin ellos la producción no sale en tiempo y forma hasta podría ser una pérdida total si las plagas llegaran a invadir el cultivo . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva.
texts.en:
Francisco is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe zone. He lives with his wife; his children are all independent.  His plan for the future is to improve living conditions and to make some home improvements.  

Francisco has been a pineapple farmer for several years.  The main problem he faces is not having the necessary economic resources to buy fertilizer and needed farm supplies for their “inducción” [a method to attain uniform maturity and also to control the time of harvest] because without them fruit is not produced in a timely fashion and can even be a total loss if pests manage to invade the plants.  

He is grateful for the trust Afodenic places in him through the Kiva fund.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora  Catalina  se dedica  a la  venta de artesanías  desde hace veinte años, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque de él se mantiene.
Tiene  cuarenta y ocho años de edad  es dejada  pero eso le da más fuerzas para enfrentarse a la vida.
Tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos dos se le murieron  y le quedaron  dos mujeres  Ofelia Catalina  de treinta años  y Luz de veinte ocho años de edad.
Está muy contenta con el crédito   por que  gracias a  eso puede seguir  asiendo lo que más  le gusta que es  bordar.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar  más: manta, hilos  de colores, hilo de ceda blanco  e hilo para maquina.
Uno de sus sueños es  seguir trabajando  y hacer  un local para exhibir sus huipiles,  sus batas y sus  blusas  que están bien bonitas.
Si  quisiera  tener otro negocio sería  el de vender  ropa para bebes  que es lo que más le gustaría parte de bordar.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo  que le ha dado para seguir trabajando y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Catalina has been selling crafts for 20 years. She likes her works very much because it supports her. She is 48 years old, and her husband has left her, but that gives her more strength to face life.  She has four children; two have died and two women remain, Ofelia Catalina who is 30 years old and Luz who is 28 years old.

Catalina is very happy with the loan because thanks to it she can continue doing what she likes which is embroidery. She has asked for a loan to buy more fabric, different colored thread, white silk thread, and sewing machine thread. 

One of her dreams is to continue working and have a local shop to display her very beautiful huipiles (traditional embroidered dress), coats, and blouses. If she would like to have another business it will be to sell baby clothes because that is what she likes to embroider the most. She thanks the foundation for the support that it has given her to continue working and reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy threads, fabric, sewing machine thread, ribbons for embroidering dresses, blouses, and huipiles.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 24 years old, married, and has one child not yet in school. She has had a business of selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Doris requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, tea leaves, and glasses for easy operation of the business. She says that she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves, and glasses.

loans.name: Zaldie

texts.en:
Zaldie is a patient, hardworking father who endures many difficulties in his business. On his daily schedule, he operates a motorcycle transport business to acquire income, and provides for the needs for his one infant child. He only finished high school, so he was not able to seek employment, and was early to marry. 

He needs to improve his services to gain more profit, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy new pairs of tires and side mirrors for his motorcycle.

In the future, Zaldie hopes to make his business profitable despite hardships in providing the service.

loans.use: to buy new pairs of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle

loans.name: Milman

texts.en:
Milman is a 33-year-old married man with 1 child who lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Milman operates a service-based business providing transportation to local community members. He has been doing this for 5 years and he earns PHP 15,000 a month. 

Milman has requested a loan of PHP 45,000 to make repairs on his existing vehicle so he can better service his customers.

Milman has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, he hopes to finish education of his child and to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to make repairs on his existing vehicle.

loans.name: Rosa Lida

texts.es:
Rosa Lida es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura crianza de animales, tiene sembrios de maíz, papas, trigo, cebada, el siembra en terrenos propios.
Las compras y las ventas  lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar terrenos, abonos, semillas y poder sembrar.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá tener espacio para poder cultivar y tener más producción. El sueño es construir una casa y poder dar el estudio a los hijos.
El desafío que ha diario se ha enfrentado es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En los tiempos libres le gusta dedicarse a la familia, salir a pasear y disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval y San Pedro.
texts.en:
Rosa Lida is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children aged 6, 4, and 1 in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Luis belongs to the Ventanal community bank located in the community of Guantuncoto in the parish of Julio Moreno in Guaranda canton, located half an hour from the main office. The members of the community work in agriculture, raise livestock such as pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.

Rosa is a farmer and also raises animals. She grows maize, potatoes, wheat, barley on land which she owns. She buys goods and sells her produce in Guaranda. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy more land, fertilizer, and seeds so she can plant her fields. 

With the assistance of the loan she will have a greater area to plant and will increase production. Her dream is to build a house and be able to provide an education for her children.
 
A daily challenge is the pests and diseases that attack her crops. In her free time she likes spending time with her family, going out for walks, and enjoying carnivals and the festival of San Pedro.

loans.use: to buy land, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en: Elpidio a 45-years-old and takes care of four children at home. He manages a farm in order to ensure food security for his family. Elpidio is a hardworking, conscientious man. He is married. His wife works as a full-time house wife. He grows and sells crops. He began growing rice. He is continuing his business and wants to expand it. Elpidio would like to receive a loan to purchase seeds to grow and fertilizer and pay workers' salaries.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth de 29, años, vive en su propia casa junto  de su pareja Efraín de 29 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Marco de 05 años y Jeyson de 11 años de edad a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación para que en un futuro próximo sean hombres de gran provecho. Ruth es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su casa familiar. Ella se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura donde siembra sus tierras con cultivos de café. Viene realizando esta actividad hace 8 años con mucho esmero,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró su terreno para seguir cultivando. Después  de cosechar los frutos de las plantas los lleva a los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad e San Francisco y Quimbiri donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos. En tiempo de cosechas y deshierbo de malezas tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ruth necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo, tiene planeado realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas comprando abono para cuidar sus  plantas de café; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza para sacar adelante  sus sembríos y a sus hijos. Este es crédito numero 04 con MFP, por ello espera del apoyo de los financistas para poder concretar sus planes y por ende se compromete a devolver  puntualmente los pagos. En su banco comunal ocupa el cargo de presidente quien vela por el progreso de los socios. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas comprando abono y fertilizantes para aplicar a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ruth, 29 years old, lives in her own house with her partner Efraín, 29, and their two children, Marco, 5, and Jeyson, 11.  They want to provide them with a good education so that in the future, they will be successful men.  Ruth is a hardworking woman who strives every day to give the best of herself to the members of her family.  

She works in agriculture, where she plants her fields with coffee crops.  She has done this work for eight years with great care, because thanks to the fruit her plants provided, she was able to purchase her land to continue planting.  After harvesting the fruits of her plants, she brings them to the collection centers in the cities of San Fransisco and Quimbri, where she gets the best prices for her grains.  During harvest time and weeding, she has to hire day laborers in order to get the work done more quickly.  

Ruth needs the support of the financial institution to carry on her work.  She needs to maintain her crops and purchase manure to care for her coffee plants, so she came to the lending institution MFP, which helps low-income people who want to improve themselves.  For the sake of her work, she hopes to have the same drive to improve her crops and her children.  This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes for the support of the lenders so that she can finalize her plans.  She promises to make her payments on time.  In her community bank, she serves as the president, who watches over the progress of the members.  

With a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, she can maintain her plants by purchasing manure and fertilizer to apply to her crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María es de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 2 hijos y está casada. Ella se dedica al comercio hace varios años y nos cuenta que tiene una despensa donde vende artículos de primera necesidad  y productos varios.
Ella cuenta que empezó con una pequeña despensita, pero que con el correr del tiempo y gracias al esfuerzo que han imprimido ha podido salir adelante y crecer como microempresaria. Su objetivo es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus hijos, que son su motivo de lucha diaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, verduras y demás productos de primera necesidad. Agradece por la oportunidad recibida y por la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
María is from the city of Encarnación.  She’s married and has two children.  She has been a merchant for several years now and she relates that she has a store where she sells basic staple items and assorted products.

She tells us that she started out with a tiny store but as time went by and thanks to the effort she’s put into it, she’s been able to get ahead and grow as a micro businesswoman.  Her objective is to stay in business and continue to grow and help her children who are the motivating force behind her daily efforts.

She is asking for the loan to buy meats, baked goods, vegetables and other basic staple items.  She thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne received an equivalent to $7 from her father in 1995 to start a business following the death of her husband. Yvonne is primary school dropout and has no formal training. She has one child and is also supporting her younger sisters, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. With the loan of $150 she intends to boost her stock in order to improve her income and service to her local community.

loans.use: To stock her Minishop

location.town: Simba Chai, Amukura Division, Teso Distr

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing A. sells drinks in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with two (2) children. She learned the trade for six (6) months, after which she started her business in the year 2004. According to her, the loan will help her to expand her business. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of water and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of water and drinks for sale

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown children. She owns a small business selling women’s clothing in one of the local markets in Stryi. She has one hired employee. Galina has been in this trade for nine years. Currently, she has about $2,000 worth of inventory in stock. Her monthly gross profit is about $1,000. Her net profit amounts to $300.

Galina is very enthusiastic about her business. One of the biggest attractions of her business is the reasonable prices she offers. Credit services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a help to her as she has developed her trade. She has been a partner with “Nadiya Ukraine” for three years.

Galina would like to receive a loan for $1,200 to purchase 20 women’s suits, pants and skirt sets. She is planning to increase the variety of classic and trendy suit styles she has for sale in her kiosk so she can fit every working woman. The funds will allow her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and easily update her product selection. We believe that this loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for Galina and her family. Moreover, it will help Galina generate the capital needed to start a new venture she is planning – to open a grocery kiosk in the local food market.

loans.use: To purchase 20 women’s suits, pants and skirt sets

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a very hardworking woman. She is married and lives alone with her husband. He has an illness that prevents him from continuing work. Faced with the necessity of obtaining an income in order to cover their basic needs, Delia began two years ago with the sales of cosmetic and natural products. This business has permitted her to live a good life with her husband, and thanks to the recommendations of her clients, she has succeeded in making the business grow.

Now she is requesting a loan for $475 dollars that she will invest in buying merchandise to meet the demand of her clients. She is sure that she will be able to repay this amount in five months. You can be part of the development of this business and help this family. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Delia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y vive sola con su esposo, él tiene una enfermedad que lo incapacitó para continuar trabajando, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades básicas Delia inició con la venta de productos naturales y cosméticos desde hace dos años, este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante con su esposo y gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes ha logrado hacerlo crecer.

Ahora está solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella esta segura que podrá regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Tú puedes formar parte del desarrollo de este negocio y ayudar a esta familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Adrian Ruben

texts.es:
"I would like to have a fence around my house for added protection and security for my family, in particular for my kids. I would also like to put some bars on the windows of the house". I would like a loan of $1000.00 to be able to put this fence up and protect the house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

"Me gustaría hace una barda en mi casa para darle más protección y seguridad a mi familia pero principalmente a mis hijos, también quiero poner unas protecciones en las ventanas de la casa”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para hacer una barda en mi casa y poner las protecciones.

loans.use: To build a fence and protection/Construcción de una barda y protecciones

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun M. is 40 years old, is married and has one child. He lives in the village of Yenikand in the Salyan region. Djeyhun has been running his own farm for 8 years.  He is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Tres

texts.en:
Mr. L. Tres is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his widowed mother along National Road 6, about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Tres has been a fisherman since 1998.  It's a skill he learned from his brother. He fishes in the Mekong River around his village and sells the fish every day. Beside fishing, Tres also buys and resells recycled material in his village. His mother also helps him with the fishing too. He has not even finished primary school.

Tres is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $350.  He will use this loan to purchase fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Rukia's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Rukia, age 30, is a single mother of a 10-year-old. She also takes care of her 20-year-old niece who is dependent on her. Rukia owns a cosmetics business, which she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 8 pm daily and can now make a monthly profit of about $280 from her sales.

Rukia hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in clothing, juice, and food sales.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Salome M. is 29 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 3, 6 and 9. She also has one other dependent, her brother in-law. In 2005, Salome established a salon business. Salome now requires a loan in order to purchase salon equipment and cosmetics.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment and cosmetics

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally Khouen and her husband, Chea Sambath, were married in 2000. They have two children; one daughter and one son, both who are still young and stay at home. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Phally has been selling fishes for eight years. She bought them from the fishing lot for resale in her village. Her husband has been a construction worker for ten years. 

Mrs. Phally is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $600 to purchase a boat for carrying fishes from the fishing lot to her village for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for carrying fish

loans.name: Brenda Eloisa

texts.es:
I have run a store out of my home for the past year.  I am the one who tends to the store all day since my husband also works in a factory in order to help cover expenses.  I would like to invest in my business in order to have more merchandise to offer my clients.   I am requesting $500 U.S. to invest in my business.
Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.
Tengo una tienda en mi vivienda desde hace 1 año, yo soy la que esta atendiendo todo el dia ya que mi esposo también trabaja en una maquiladora para ayudar con los gastos, me gustaria invertir en mi negocio para tener más mercancia que ofrecerles a mis clientes". Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para inverir en mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in my business

loans.name: Atha Hal Haq

texts.en: Atha Hal Haq lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his own family. He just finished school and started working because of economical problems. He has a retail shop and he wants to take out an individual loan to complete his lease purchase for a premises for his business. He is very happy with this loan process  in Afghanistan he would like to thank Kva lenders who help poor people.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Sivai

texts.en:
Sivai M., 37, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro plantation and pancake business. She sells to the general public and villagers 3 days per week.

Sivai has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD). SPBD loans are Sivai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Both she and her husband are unemployed, but are self-employed runnning their business. Their three children are schooling at their village primary school.

loans.use: Part of her loan will be used for purchasing gromoxone, sting, weedkiller and for her pancake business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora N. is a 44-year-old married woman with 5 children. Her husband works at Ott Transport to help support the family from a financial standpoint. She recently started a pancake business, and she is selling her food to the village community and school children 5 days per week. Typically, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 300 Tala ($125 USD).

This is the first loan she has requested via SPBD. In truth, SPBD loans are Nora’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from any of the traditional banks. With the loan proceeds, she is hoping to expand and improve her business by purchasing various inputs (e.g., flour and oil) and equipment (e.g., frying pans and gas cookers).

loans.use: To ramp up her business' operations by purchasing raw materials (flour and oil) and equipment (frying pans and gas cookers)

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two grown kids who live with her. She supports her family with a business selling groceries. She has been in this business for only 7 months and has already gained some experience as an entrepreneur and as a sales person. One of the things she enjoys the most about her business is the opportunity to help her customers get healthy and nutritious foods. She tries to have a variety of products on hand so that she is able to offer a range of choices and meet each customer's needs. Presently, Nataliya has over $5000 in inventory. Her net profit is about $300 each month.

Nataliya's goal is to continue to learn and improve her business. She has requested a loan for 5000 Grivnas ($1075 USD) so that she can purchase some additional inventory. Summer time is a very busy season for many grocery market vendors in Ukraine. This loan will enable Nataliya to be prepared for increased demand and earn some additional income that will help herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Mohbi

texts.ru: Хочиева Мохби жительница города Яван. Возраст 39 лет,она не замужем. Живет с родителями. Она одна обеспечивает своих родителей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли.Торгует продуктами питания. Бизнесом занимается уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ей увеличить ассортимент товара . Ее магазин находится в центре кишлака, поэтому ее дело помогает населению приобретать товар, не выезжая за приделы села.Кроме того она хочет развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mohbi H. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 39 years old and unmarried. She lives with her parents, and is their sole source of support. Her area of business is sales. She sells groceries, and has been in the business for 8 years already. She decided to take out a loan in order to increase her sales. It will help her expand her inventory selection. Her store is in the center of a village, which is helpful to the residents, as it allows them to purchase goods without needing to leave their town. She also wants to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Nyarko is 57 years old. She is divorced, with seven children. Only one child is in school. Margaret sells frozen food; she also buys dried fish and smoked fish from middlemen and fishmongers, and resells it in the local market.  Margaret has been in this business for fifteen years.  She says income is very low since she pays high rent on the store from which she operates. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen food, so she can increase her business and make enough money to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen food to expand her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 45 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos Ricardo de 24, Irma de 22, Diana de 20, los cuales ya se encuentran trabajando, haciéndose cargo solo de su hija Marlene de 19 años, quien aún está estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de carne en un mercado muy conocido de la ciudad de Juliaca, tiene 30 años de experiencia en esta labor, ya que antes trabajaba para sus padres, pero desde hace 6 años decidió poner su negocio propio, en el cual ahora le va muy bien. Trabaja por las mañanas hasta promediar las 7 de la noche de forma ambulatoria, siendo lo más difícil soportar el frío que hace al estar sentada casi todo el día, pero lo más gratificante son las conversaciones con las colegas del costado. Margarita trabaja arduamente para brindarles a sus hijos mayores oportunidades de superación. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará algunos instrumentos que le  harán mas fácil el cortado de la carne, además de comprar mayor mercadería. En el futuro, Margarita quiere tener su propio emporio comercial.
texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years of age, is single, and lives with her children Ricardo, a 24 year-old, Irma, a 22 year-old, and Diana a 22 year-old, who now are working, leaving her responsible for her daughter Marlene, a 19 year-old, who is studying. She sells meat in a very well-known market in the city of Juliaca. She has 30 years of experience in this work, since before, she worked for her parents. 6 years ago she decided to open her own business which now is going very well. She works in the morning until, on average, 7 at night selling on the street. She feels that the most difficult part is standing the cold from sitting all day. The most gratifying part is the conversations she has with colleagues at her sides. Margarita works arduously to provide her children with the best opportunities to overcome. With the money from the loan, she will buy some tools that will make cutting meat easier and also to buy more merchandise. In the future, Margarita wants to have her own commercial emporium.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for the cutting of meat and also to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank O. is 59 years old. He is married with five kids, 2 of whom who are still in school. Frank is a dealer in assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, and similar hardware at Tema, a town where he has lived with his family for nine years. He buys his supplies at wholesale prices from importers in the greater Accra of Ghana, and then sells to his customers at retail prices. 

Frank requests the loan to enable him procure increased stock of merchandise to accelerate business progress. With the loan, he hopes to increase his savings so that he can expand his shop to include the sale of cement. He would be very grateful for your support.

Frank is a member of the community group called the Angels Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Frank's picture was taken at one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of assorted paints, nails, sandpaper, hammers, etc.

loans.name: Cristo Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
hola nuestro grupo se llama Cristo es mi fortaleza, nuestro grupo esta formado por tres personas las cuales nos conocemos muy bien y que somos nativos de la Colonia Juan Pablo David. nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Maria A.: soy la cordinadora del grupo tengo 44 años de edad y estoy casada con el sr. Francisco Flores con el cual hemos procreado 3 hijos, mi esposo trabaja como ayudante de Bus, yo me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, esta actividad me genera ingresos para poder aliemntar a mis hijos.
el Sr. P. se reconoce en la comunidad como una persona luchadora que ha salido adelante con su esposa Oneyda Ramirez, la que se dedica a la sastreria y tambien han procreado 3 hijos, el Sr. P. se dedica a la Agricultura y el comercio.
La Sra C. G. es una persona que trabaja arduamente con su esposo Daniel para poder sacar adelante su famia ellos han procreado 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
todas necesitamos este credito para poder hacer nuestros negocios mas grandes y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Members of the group “Cristo es mi fortaleza” are well-known to one another and are natives of Colonia Juan Pablo David. Their group consists of the following three people: Maria A. is 44 years old and the group coordinator. She is married to Francisco Flores and they have three children. Her husband works as a bus attendant, while she makes and sells tortillas. This business generates income to feed her children. Maximo P. is recognized throughout the community as a fighter who, along with his wife Oneyda Ramirez, has prospered. His wife is a seamstress and they also have three children. Maximo engages in both agriculture and trade. Urania C. G. and her husband Daniel work hard in order that their family might get ahead. They have two children. Urania sells tortillas. They are all in need of this loan in order that they might expand their businesses and increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, lime; tailoring supplies; and general grocery store merchandize

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Mrs. P. is 33 years old and sells grocery such as vegetable, meat, and food ingredients in her village of Srokthom in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling since 1999 and can earn around US$3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Bros, earns around US$5 per day working as a construction worker. Currently, her business is going well because she has good communication in the village. She cares for three children, all of whom are small young teenagers. In order to expand her business, P. needs a loan to purchase groceries to sell and remaining buy piece of land to fulfill in dirty place to be good place for attractive customers.

loans.use: to purchase grocery to sell and remaining buy piece of land to fulfill in dirty place for business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua N. is 60 years old, widowed, and the mother of eight children. All her children are independent. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living when she was in her mid-thirties. Her husband died some few years ago after a prolonged sickness. Currently she lives at Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

She now runs a clothing business and has been selling clothing and slippers over the last eight years. She mostly sells through hawking done door-to-door. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and a larger quantity of clothing to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance

Akua belongs to a village bank called ‘Eye Nyame’ which means "Is God". She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and slippers for re-sale

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Alicia M. trabaja en un consultorio medico en el departamento de encargado, este es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene solo un hijo pequeño de edad para el cual quiere lo mejor.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar el medicamento y tratamiento que le están haciendo a su papá ya que es una persona mayor de edad.
En este momento ella no cuenta con el dinero  necesario para pagar los gastos médicos de su papá.
texts.en:
Bertha Alicia M. works in a medical billing office. As a single mother, the money she earns in this job is her only source of income to take care of her young son. She is requesting a loan so that she can pay for medicine and treatment for her elderly father. Right now she does not have the money to cover his medical expenses.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help cover medical expenses for her elderly father.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 31 años, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Es dueña del restaurante más concurrido de su barrio, siempre está muy alegre y recibe con una sonrisa a sus clientes diarios, disfruta de atenderlos y brindarles la mejor atención posible, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Norma lleva 6 años en esta actividad y espera posteriormente poder abrir una sucursal de su restaurante en una zona más comercial, donde pueda vender su comida a muchas más personas y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ya que actualmente tiene muchos clientes que vienen desde muy lejos a probar su deliciosa sazón. Lo complicado de este negocio es preparar diariamente comida para casi doscientas personas. Es el quinto préstamo de Norma con MFP, y se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Este dinero le ayudará a incrementar su capital de trabajo, planea invertir todo el crédito en comprar las cosas que necesita para implementar más adelante un nuevo restaurante.
texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old and lives in the house her parents left her. She's a hard worker and is ready to excel in her life.

She is the owner of the most frequented restaurant in the neighborhood. She's always happy and greets her daily clientele with a smile; she enjoys serving them and giving them the best attention possible, as she knows the success of her business depends on them.

Norma has had this business for 6 years and in the future, hopes to open a locale in a more commercial area because already, many of her customers come from far away to try her delicious flavours. This would allow her to serve many more customers and, inevitably, increase her income. The difficult part of her job is to prepare meals for approximately 200 people a day.

This is Norma's 5th loan with MFP and she feels capable of paying it back on time because she trusts in her business and in the Communal Bank, of which she is happy being an associate.

This loan will help Norma increase her working capital. She plans on investing her gains in all the things she needs to implement a new restaurant in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils in order to open her next restaurant.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Маърифат  женщина 33 лет , мать троих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Сама Маърифат работает в колхозе на поле. Её дети учатся в средней школе. Она  кроме своей работы дополнительно занимается откормом и продажей скота. У неё сейчас три коровы и пять баранов. Узнав от соседей , что можно для расширения бизнеса можно получить кредит, она решила обратиться в Микроинвест. Её муж каждый месяц минимально посылает ей на жизнь 400-500 сомони. Поэтому Маърифат уверенно обратилась за кредитом , зная, что сможет погасить его без проблем.
texts.en:
Marifat is a 33-year-old woman, the mother of three children. Her husband is away working in Russia. Marifat herself works in the fields on a collective farm, while her children study at the secondary school. In addition to her regular job, she raises and sells cattle. At present Marifat has three cows and five sheep. She learned from her neighbors about the possibility of taking out a loan to expand her business and decided to deal with MicroInvest. Each month her husband sends her at least 400-500 somoni for living expenses, therefore Marifat turned to MicroInvest with confidence, knowing that she could repay the loan without difficulty.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.en:
Shamsullo is 46 years old and the father of four children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hardworking person and he has been providing taxi services for 12 years. The most important thing to him is that his children in future enter university and successfully finish it, so that they will become professionals and have a better tomorrow.

Shamsullo wishes to keep his taxi business growing and, for this, he needs to have his working tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve their condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work he has been able to stabilize his quality of life.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим- молодой человек 24 лет, пока не женат. Работает учителем по физической культуре для начинающих классов.Его заработная плата не хватает на проживание. Он живёт вместе с родителями, он единственный сын в семье.Кроме своей работы он выходит на продажу напитков, мороженого и молочного коктейля в разлив. Для закупа напитков оптом он решил получить кредит в Микроинвесте. Из-за того, что сейчас сезон данного товара Микроинвест решил поддержать бизнес Иброхима.
texts.en:
Ibrohim is a young man of 24, not yet married. He works as a physical education teacher in an elementary school, but his salary is not enough to live on. He lives with his parents, and is the only son in the family. In addition to his regular job, Ibrohim sells beverages on tap, ice cream and milkshakes. He decided to take out a loan with MicroInvest in order to purchase beverages wholesale, and because it is now the time of year for such products, MicroInvest decided to support Ibrohim's business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of bottled beverages, ice cream and milkshakes

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles H. C. tiene 27 años. Es una mujer soltera. Tiene un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica de María es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio consiste en la comercialización de cosméticos ambulantes y surge por la necesidad de continuar estudiando y es por medio de este negocio que realiza esta idea, además María es una mujer muy joven y luchadora y es por eso que solicita los financiamientos destinados para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, perfumes y cremas. El sueño de María es ampliar su negocio para que su hijo lo administre en un futuro.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles H. C. is 27 years old. She is single and has a son. María sells cosmetics and has been doing this for more than 5 years. Her business consists of selling cosmetics as a street vendor. She needs to continue studying and it is thanks to this business that she is able to do so. María is young and determined and this is why she is requesting a loan for working capital so she can buy lipsticks, perfumes, and creams. María’s dream is to grow her business so that her son can run it someday.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites quoted that “behind sacrifices awaits lots of prizes”. She believes that doing her best and sacrificing everything for her family will someday bear good fruit. She is a mother who is very supportive of her children. She is 38 years old and married to Bob who is a responsible husband. They have two children who are now in the elementary level. 
	
Marites operates a vending business, selling different kinds of cooked snacks such as banana cue (fried banana coated with sugar), peanuts and so on, in their village. She felt the need to work that led her to start her small business. She is now asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 6,000. She said that she will use the loan wisely for her business to become profitable for her family.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Yo Reinare Group

texts.es: El grupo “Yo reinare” esta representado por la señora Fabiana y conformada por 16 miembros los cuales una mayoría se dedican a generar ingresos en sus pequeños negocios de venta de productos como cosméticos, ropa, comida,  y al servicio de construcción de viviendas, peinadora, música y transporte público de pasajeros. Dentro de los rubro comercial existe un alto nivel de competencia pero las ganas de salir adelante hacen que nuestras socias trabajen para sacar adelante a sus familias; es por esta razón que requieren del préstamo que les ayudara en la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calida de vida de sus familias. La socias no cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios pero saben como responder a sus obligaciones ya que son gente trabajadora y honesta es por esta razón que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda y apoyo económico para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Yo Reinare group is represented by Fabiana. Sixteen members form the group, and most of them generate income in their small businesses by selling products like cosmetics, clothing, and food; building houses, hairdressing, music, and public transportation. There is a high level of competition within the commercial area. But, the desire to get ahead makes the group’s members work to help their families’ futures. They need a loan to help them acquire materials, supplies, and tools to improve their income and the quality of life for their families. The members do not have experience in unified groups, but they know how to respond to their obligations. They are hard working and honest people. That is the reason why the Agrocapital foundation offers them economic support so that they can give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Ikweta borrower group In Kinyanambo,Iringa.She is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child aged is 15 years.

Sophia started her own food business selling tomatoes,onions,potatoes 2 years ago,She works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sophia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,potatoes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of that loan Sophia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto M. is from the village of Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Crisanto is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanto owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Crisanto has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Crisanto joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Crisanto is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Crisanto from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Adolfo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Adolfo Antonio D. Q. tiene 29 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y compra de ganado. El negocio consiste en comprar y vender ganado, el realiza sus compras en comunidades por lo que es aquí donde le resulta mucho más favorable para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Los financiamientos siempre han sido utilizados para invertirlos en su negocio. Sus inicios se dan por su Papa quien le enseño este oficio y cuando tenía la edad de 7 años le regalo un ternero y así poco a poco fue logrando comprar vacas, toros y ternero y tener su propio negocio. La situación más difícil es que no tenía suficiente animales para ofrecer pero con loa financiamientos salió adelante. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de más ganado. su deseo es expandir su negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mr. Adolfo Antonio D. Q. is 29-years-old. His business consists of buying and selling livestock. He makes his purchases in communities because it is here where he will be the most successful in providing for his family. Funding has always been used to invest in his business. He got his start when his father taught him this trade when he was 7-years-old and gave him a calf. Bit by bit Antonio managed to buy cows, bulls, and calves and to have his own business. The most difficult part is that he didn’t have enough animals but with the financing he was able to move forward. He is currently seeking more funding so he can purchase more livestock. He desires to expand his business so he can be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Roberto Angelo

texts.es: Angelo es una joven muy hábil, se dedica a la confección de calzados de mujer. Comenzó con esta actividad gracias a su tio quien le enseño la profesión. Realiza calzados de cuerina y ahora quiere hacer calzados de cuero por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina más grande y con más fuerza. Angelo vive en la casa de su tía, la señora María Dolores, quien trabaja como empleada en el Hotel Camino Real y además ella recibe renta como administradora de su auto que hace trabajar de taxi. Ellos viven en la zona de Alto Pampahasi. Angelo vivía en la Ciudad de Cochabamba donde aprendió a hacer trabajos en bronce.
texts.en:
Angelo is a very able young man, dedicated to making women's shoes. He began this activity thanks to his uncle who taught him the profession. He makes shoes from imitation leather and now he wishes to make leather shoes, for which reason he asks for a loan to buy a larger and more powerful machine.

Angelo lives in his Aunt Maria Dolores' house. She is employed in the Camino Real Hotel and also receives income from her car which she lets out as a taxi. They live in the Alto Pampahasi zone. Angelo used to live in the city of Cochabamba where he learned to make objects in bronze.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A MACHINE TO SEW LEATHER AND 2 SETS OF SHOEMAKER'S LASTS

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy S. is a villager in the village of Ta Preas in the province of Takeo. She owns a rice mill which is used by other farmers. She is also a farmer herself and owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. In her planting work, she presently faces an obstacle because her field is far from any irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump and some hoS. through which to pump water to support the rice field.

Her husband, Mr. Him Thy, pictured at right, is a construction worker. He helps his wife’s work through his construction work.

Mrs. Sothy S. is 32 years old and is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and some hoses through which to pump water to support the rice field

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheang C. is a villager in Preak Tanop village in Kandal province. She and her husband are fish breeders. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Sokheang C. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish for breeding. Mrs. Sokheang C. has six children, three of whom work in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish for breeding.

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu sells roasted corn in front of the education office near where she lives. She takes delivery of stock from Techiman, a market town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children. Through hard work, and with support from her husband, all of her children attend school in her community.

Barikisu requests this loan to buy stock in bulk as she believes this will help her in times of price hikes. She dreams of providing her children with a high quality of life now and as they get older. She does not want any of her children to do the business she is doing; she'd rather see them through school.

loans.use: To buy maize, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk

loans.name: Jennyvie

texts.en:
Jennyvie R. is from the village of Tablon, Digkila-an, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Jennyvie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jennyvie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jennyvie has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jennyvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennyvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jennyvie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Jennyvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zainab Zarmina Group

texts.en:
The Zainab Zarmina group is made up of four members.
Amina is the group leader. She is married and the supporter of the seven members of her family. Amina wants to take a loan for her son. For more than two years he has had a fresh fruit cart, and with this loan he wants to buy more fruit for his cart.
Zarmina is the second member of Zainab Zarmina group. She has a carpet-weaving business, the income from which she uses to support her family. Her purpose in requesting a loan is to expand her business.
The third member of the group is Shokria, who is an embroiderer. With this loan she wants to buy some necessary things for her embroidery business.
The last member of Zainab Zarmina group is Zainab. She is busy with her carpet-weaving business. With this loan she wants to buy more materials for her weaving.
These four members have requested a group loan of 40,000 AFN. They want to thank all lenders from Kiva and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her son's fruit cart

loans.name: Frieda

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo en su actividad, la señora Frieda A. se dedica a la actividad de ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León donde a diario da lugar a la crianza de dichos animales en su localidad donde actualmente tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esto.
El crédito que ella está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de tres vacas ya que le urge obtenerlas para proceder con la crianza y luego extraer la leche para venderla comercializándola en su localidad. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera mejorará sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Frieda A. really enjoys her work raising cattle in the municipality of El Sauce, in the department of León. Everyday she takes care of the animals in the fields--she’s been doing this work for twelve years. The loan that Frieda is asking for will be used to buy three cows. She needs the money urgently so that she can get on with raising them, and eventually obtain milk which she can sell in the neighbourhood. She hopes that her request will be granted so that she can improve her own and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Redey Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Redey, cuenta con una familia estable que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su esposa quien trabaja como empleada del hogar de una familia en la zona donde el vive, El Sr. Redey tiene la actividad económica de servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi que realiza su hermano que es su conductor, El Sr Redey es el dueño del taxi y su hermano trabaja para el ya que el Sr Redey tiene otra acctividad trabaja como chofer en la embajada de Dinamarca, el cliente presta servicios como conductor personal de la Cónsul de Dinamarca en el País .

El cliente, actualmente este es su segundo credito bajo este programa. Con el dinero del credito el comprara una radio de comunicaciones para su radiotaxi y haci poder ofrecer mejor servicio a los clientes.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Redey has a stable family, which is comprised of his three school-age children and his wife. She works as a household employee for a family in the area where they live. Redey provides urban passenger transportation in a radio taxi. He works with his brother, who is his driver. Redey owns the taxi, and his brother works for him. Redy has another job. He works as a driver for the Danish embassy. He provides services as a personal driver for the Danish Consul in the country. This is his second loan under this program. He will use the money from the loan to buy a communications radio for his radio taxi. This way he will be able to offer better service to his customers. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a communications radio

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es: María Leonor C. D. R. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador.  Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tortillería en la cual se dedica a hacer y vender tortillas en su propia casa, así mismo se dedica a la venta D. perfumes, maquillajes y otros tipos D. cosméticos más los cuales comercializa D. forma ambulante, visitando casa por casa a sus vecinos y amigos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante, sobre todo en esos momentos difíciles en los cuales su esposo a carecido D. trabajo, ha sido ella a través D. sus negocios como ha logrado solventar todos los gastos del hogar y las necesidades D. sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar más cosméticos, los cuales venD. a crédito pero que ella debe pagar al contado, es por esto que es muy importante que cuente con el dinero necesario para seguir adelante con su negocio, el cual le ha permitido poseer  todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María Leonor C. D. R., 44, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department, in her own house with her husband and three children, who are students. María has a tortilla shop in her home where she makes and sells tortilllas. In addition, she sells perfumes, make-up and other kinds of cosmetics door-to-door. She is a very hard-working woman who has always maD. the effort to get ahead in life, especially during these hard times, when her husband hasn't had much work, it has been through her efforts that the family has been able to meet their expenses and fulfill the needs of the children. She is asking for funding to buy corn at wholesale as well as more cosmetics, which she sells on credit but she must pay cash. It is important for her to have enough money that she can count on so that her business, which has provided everything needed to survive, can continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora MARIA CONCEPCION G. V. tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios  hasta 3ero de Secundaria, madre soltera y  tiene 3 hijos pequeños quienes depende económicamente de ella. La socia  se dedica a la preparación y venta de pan, empanadas, alfajores, tortas, etc. Para la preparación de sus panes y pasteles ella utiliza insumos como: harina, manteca, pasas, aceite, manteca, etc. y compra estos insumos al por mayor en el mercado mayorista porque refiere que allí los encuentra a menor costo lo cual le beneficia. Finalmente cuando tiene listo los panes y pasteles los lleva en una carretilla a vender de forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para comprar harina y leña al por mayor y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos, leña, azúcar impalpable, manteca, etc. al por mayor.
Sueña con tener una panadería bien implementada donde pueda elaborar sus panes en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is 41 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district in the Trujillo province, within the La Libertad department and is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank. She has a junior high school education and is the single mother of three young children who depend on her. Maria makes and sells bread, empanadas, alfajores, pastries, etc. and uses ingredients such as flour, lard, raisins, cooking oil, etc to make her breads and pastries. She buys most of her ingredients in the large marketplace because she’s able to find it there at the lowest cost which benefits her. Finally, when she has everything ready, she takes the breads and pastries in a cart and sells them on foot. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to buy flour and firewood and she will use her next loan of 500 PEN ($200) to buy bulk amounts of flour, butter, eggs, firewood, sugar, lard, etc. She hopes to have her own, well stocked, bakery someday, where she can make her breads under better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en:
Kou K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers named Women of Faith.  Kou sells used clothes, and plans to use her portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more stock for her business.  Kou is 33 years old and married with four children ages 1, 8, 11, and 19.  Kou's school-age kids attend elementary school and junior high.  Kou says that she was never able to go to school due to a lack of support from her parents.  Besides her children, Kou also helps care for three siblings.

Kou has been running her used clothing business for about eight years now, and sells from a table near the Coal Field Poultry Market.  She says she started her endeavor with one bag of clothes, and has built her business since then.  According to Kou, the biggest challenge she faces is stiff competition -- many people in her area also sell used clothes.  Kou hopes that one day she'll be able to grow her business enough so she can open a proper storefront.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kou is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: María Gaby

texts.es:
María Gaby tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Insculas, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de un año a la comercialización de carne de animales: ella cría animales menores y aves de corral en su vivienda, los engorda, y cuando ya han alcanzado su desarrollo optimo, los sacrifica para luego vender su carne por kilos entre sus vecinos; el negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos ya que la zona en la que vive queda alejada de la ciudad y ellos no cuentan con los suficientes recursos para movilizarse hacia allá todos los dias.

Este negocio también es de ayuda para su familia ya que con los ingresos que percibe apoya al sostenimiento familiar. María Gaby desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Gaby es una joven bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es incrementar su nivel de ventas y hacerse más conocida en la zona. Ella es muy estimada por sus vecinos y clientes, los que la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
María Gaby is 27, single, and lives with her parents in the Insculas area, a rural district of Olmos, in Lambayeque province, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year she has been working selling meat. She raises young animals and birds in the yard by her house. She fattens them, and when they have reached their optimal size, she slaughters them so that she can then sell the meat by kilo to her neighbors. Her business is very useful to her neighbors since the area where they live is away from the city and they don’t have enough reason to go there every day. This business also helps her family since her earnings are a support for her family. María Gaby wants to enlarge her business by buying more animals to raise and sell. That is why she is asking for a loan for the first time from Edypme Alternativa of 1000 sols. María Gaby is a hardworking woman who is close to her family. He biggest goal is to develop the level of sales and to become better known in the area. She is very respected by the neighbors and customers-they see her as a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise to sell the meat

loans.name: Adjo Diane

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce  depuis 2004 dans une boutique qu’elle a loué. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle se compose de personnes de tout âge. Faisant face à une diminution de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour compléter ses économies et acheter 20 cartons de cannettes de différentes  boissons, 10 cartons de spaghetti,  des tomates en boîte de conserve et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
Adjo Diane K. makes a living selling grocery products in a rented store. She has been in this trade since 2004. She gets her supplies at the Great Market of Lomé. Her customers are people of all ages. Since her stocks are depleting, she came to WAGES and applied for a loan to add to her savings and buy 20 boxes of cans of various drinks, 10 boxes of spaghetti, canned tomatoes and similar items. Adjo Diane is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Operating  from a leased store on Campbell Street, a busy locale in Makeni, Isatu S. has sold assorted food items for the past four years. This well-organized lady is married to a trader and has four children.  She is now requesting a loan to buy provisions and confectionery, and hopes to use any additional profits to educate her children and buy a piece of land to build a dwelling in the future.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga G. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 51 years old. Dominga is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dominga owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dominga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Dominga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es la venta de esquimos,  Tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él y asisten a clases. Su actividad económica es la venta de helados, gaseosas y hot- dog. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, su negocio surgió por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de la casa, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar su actividad y proporcionarle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, pan, jugos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Diego Manuel is 45 years old and earns his living by selling Eskimo dairy products such as ice cream, as well as soft drinks and hot dogs. He has three children who attend school. Diego has been doing this work for more than nineteen years. It came about because of the lack of work so he had to find a way to help with household expenses. He is always thinking of ways to improve the business and provide his family with what they need. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, and juices etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 39 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen una hija, Anel de 8 años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Anteriormente trabajaba en el municipio de San Francisco, luego de muchos años de labor, decidió dedicarse de lleno al negocio, que es un Recreo Turístico, que conjuntamente lo realiza con su pareja,  desde entonces le ha resultado muy rentable, puesto que en la semana recibe una mucha gente, fieles a la sazón incomparable que le pone a sus comidas exóticas que prepara, es así que sus ingresos económicos va aumentado a paso lento y seguro. Normalmente su rutina diaria es a partir de las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 12:00 de la noche dependiendo de la cantidad de gente que tiene que atender. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su recreo turístico, con la finalidad de aumentar la capacidad, para que puedan recibir más turistas en su campo recreacional. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente contento con su grupo comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que toman. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de mesas y sillas, con el propósito de que sus clientes se sientan cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Irma is 39 years old. She lives with her partner and their daughter Anel, who is 8 years old. They live in a place called Quimbiri, where they have their own house, in the beautiful forest around Cuzco. Irma used to work in the town of San Francisco, and after many years of hard work there decided to work full time in her own business, a tourist restaurant, which she set up with her partner. It has become a very profitable business, with many people coming during the week for the incomparable flavour of the exotic dishes she cooks, and so their income has increased slowly but steadily. A typical day for Irma lasts from 9am to 12 midnight, depending on the number of people she has to serve. Her great longing is to grow the business and increase its capacity, so they can receive more tourists. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP; she promises to keep making her payments on time. She also says she is happy with the communal bank, thanks to the good decisions they take. She intends to invest the loan buying tables and chairs, so that her customers will be comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs so she can improve her service to her customers.

loans.name: Tetepelcingo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tetepelcingo, decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama el pueblo donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo y la mayoría del grupo son originarios de ahí, la historia es acerca de Verónica T. D., ya que ella es la representante del grupo, es casada tiene 3 hijos Paola de 9 años estudia la primaria, Ingrid de 3 y un bebe de 5 meses, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos.

Nos comenta que se decidió por este negocio por que dice que en el pueblo donde radica no hay quien venda comida por las tardes, además de que a ella le gusta preparar comida, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como son: aceite, sal, tomates, servilletas, platos, cucharas y chiles para así seguir preparando sus antojitos.

Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio se esta beneficiando mucho por que esta pudiendo sacar a sus hijos adelante, y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de la educación de sus hijos.

Comenta que con su negocio también esta beneficiando alas personas de su comunidad puesto que como es la única que vende comida ahí, ahora las personas que no tienen tiempo o ganas de preparar comida van con ella para comprar sus alimentos. 

La meta que se ha puesto verónica es darles una educación de calidad a sus hijos para que asi puedan estudiar una carrera y así tengan una buena profesión, para que tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacerse de un local donde pueda establecerse de manera definitiva y así obtener mejores ingresos.

Nos cuenta que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones, les gusta mucho el trabajo, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad, ya que ellos se conocen de hace tiempo dice que son personas pagadoras, no les gusta defraudar a las personas que depositan su confianza en ellos.
Verónica le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su hija a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos pudo cambiar su vida y la de sus pequeños hijos, puesto que a hora tendrá una mejor educación.
