Los integrantes de tetepelcingo y las actividades alas que se dedican cada uno de ellos son las siguientes:
Verónica T. D.-antojitos (REPRESENTANTE)
Marcela Hernández L.-venta de servilletas
Emilia mariana Nicolás-venta de servilletas
Eustolia Nicolás B.-venta de servilletas
Reina R. López-venta de servilletas
Rufina Hernández López-venta de servilletas
Sofía Hernández-venta de servilletas
Victoria López B.-venta de servilletas
Gloria Hernández Nicolás-venta de servilletas
Josefa Hernández L.-venta de servilletas
Demetria Hernández L.-venta de servilletas
texts.en:
This group is called Tetepelcingo. They named themselves after the village where their group is located. The majority of them are natives of this village. This story is about Verónica T. D. as she is the group representative. She is married and has 3 children, Paola, who is 9 years old and is in elementary school, Ingrid, 3, and a baby who is 5 months old. Verónica sells traditional street snacks. She tells us that she started this business because in the village where she lives there isn't anyone who sells food in the afternoons and she likes to prepare food. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy supplies like oil, salt, tomatoes, napkins, plates, utensils and chilies to prepare her dishes. She provides for her children with the earnings from the business and helps her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children. She says that her business is beneficial to her community as well, since she is the only person that sells prepared food here. Now, the people that don't have time or the desire to prepare food, can buy her food. Her goal is to give her children a quality education so that they can have a good profession and a better future. She also wants to set up a permanent local so that she can generate more income. She tells us that all the other members in the group are responsible people that fulfill their obligations. They like to work to overcome and excel given any difficulty. Since they have known each other for a long time, they are committed to repaying their loan. They do not want to let down those that have put their trust in them. On behalf of her and her daughter, Verónica would like to thank FRAC and Kiva because, thanks to them, she could change her life and that of her children since they will have a better education. The members of Tetepelcingo and what each one does for a living are as follows: Verónica T. D. (representative) - prepares and sells traditional snack foods Marcela Hernández L. - Napkin sales Emilia Mariana Nicolás - Napkin sales Eustolia Nicolás B. - Napkin sales Reina R. López - Napkin sales Rufina Hernández López - Napkin sales Sofía Hernández - Napkin sales Victoria López B. - Napkin sales Gloria Hernández Nicolás - Napkin sales Josefa Hernández L. - Napkin sales Demetria Hernández L. - Napkin sales

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as oil, potatoes, chilies, tomatoes, napkins, plates and utensils

loans.name: Akouavi Angèle

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Angèle est née le 04 mai 1974 à Adjaha dans le Mono au Bénin. Mariée à EDAH Gérard un chauffeur Angèle est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Angèle a fréquenté l'école et n'a fait que les cours primaires. Angèle vit depuis quatre ans dans le quartier Bazounkpa à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Benin. Angèle vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir et subvenir à ses besoins, Angèle mène comme activité, la fabrication et la vente de matelas et parallèlement la vente d'oreillers. Angèle s'approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin et vend à PK3 AKPAKPA (Cotonou). Angèle avait déjà bénéficié d'un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé avec un bon remboursement. C'est dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse que Angèle sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouavi Angèle A. has been born on May 4, 1974 in Adjaha in Mono Department of Benin. Married to Gérard Edah, a driver, she is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Angèle attended school but finished only the primary level of studies. Angèle has been living in the Bazounkpa district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for four years. Angèle helps her husband and shares the responsibility for family budget with him. In order to provide for her family needs, she manufacturers and sells mattresses, in addition, she also sells pillows. She stocks up in the North of Benin and sells in PK3 Akaka (Cotonou). She already had an loan from ALIDé in the past and repaid it well. In order to strengthen her business and respond to the growing customer demand Angèle is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 4 cotton bales for manufacturing mattresses and pillows

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard K. is twenty eight years old, married and has two children aged eight years and three years old. His business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga, a busy business environment and he is served by the Kitengela branch. He has been selling such items as power cables, bulbs, bulb holders and other items. He sells to the local people. He has been doing this business for five years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hiscustomers are spoiled of choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more cables, bulbs, bulb holders and generally restock to grow his business and meet his customer needs. He hopes to own a car and a house some day. He describes himself as business-minded, hardworking, kind and focused.

loans.use: T buy electronic supplies for resale

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia I. is 55, married, and has eight children. She owns a business venture selling chips. Silia has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to buy raw ingredients to make cooked foods. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Silia joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2010, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Silia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to make cooked foods

loans.name: James Raita Ole

texts.en:
James Raita Ole K. is 34 years old and he supports a family of four. His spouse is Elizabeth K. and she has formal employment.

James is a businessman running a shop in Narok town. He sells blankets, bed sheets, wall curtains and materials for making clothes to the tailors who are his frequent customers. He has been in this business for the last nine years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who was already a registered member in KADET. This will be his fourth loan, which he is planning to use to buy more curtains and materials to increase his stock. He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another shop.

James’s dream is to become a wholesaler and be a distributor in Narok town. He is a hardworking man with a great vision.

loans.use: To spend 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simon de 62 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. 

El para poder mantener a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos decidió invertir sus ahorros en víveres para vender. Desde ese tiempo trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas, caramelos. A podido capitalizar el negocio debido a la ayuda de la institución.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar para su tienda de víveres, en el futuro quiere tener la tienda mas surtida y así asegurar la vejez de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Simon is 62 years old and runs a small grocery store in the front part of his house.  He lives in a semi-urban zone called Paraíso, which is characterized by its dirt roads and deteriorating ecosystem.

In order to support his wife and four children, he decided to invest his savings in groceries to sell.  Since that time, he has worked from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day, selling rice, sugar, drinks, candies, etc.  He has been able to capitalize on business with the help of Fundación D-MIRO Mision Alianza.

With this loan, he wants to buy rice, oil, and sugar for his grocery store.  In the future, he wants to have the best-stocked store, and in this way, to be able to support himself and his wife in their old age.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more cheeses

loans.name: Teresiah Njeri

texts.en:
Teresiah has been operating her beauty salon in Olkalou town for the last 12 years.  She is 48 years old, married to David N., and they have three children.

She heard about KADET from a KADET field officer.  This will be her first loan and she plans to use the loan to buy a new hair dryer for her beauty salon.

In future, Teresiah hopes to expand her beauty salon so that it can serve many clients at once.

loans.use: To buy a new hair dryer

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 41 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende legumbres, enlatados, canes etc. 

Ha venido trabajando para poder mantener a su hijo con una buena vida y pueda estudiar. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Su tienda está ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa de caña, vende bebidas, arroz, azúcar, enlatados, etc. Una de los problemas que tiene para atender la tienda es el polvo que genera la calle de tierra cuando pasan los carros. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, enlatados para surtir más su tienda ya que quiere agrandarla. En el futuro quiere que su hijo termine sus estudios con éxito, y poder expandir su tienda en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a Peruvian zone with dirt roads and hills) and has a grocery store where she sells vegetables, canned goods, meats, etc.

She began working to raise her child in a suitable life so he would be able to study. She works in the store from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. everyday. Her store is located in the front of her cane home. She sells beverages, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc. Her biggest problem is the dust that builds up from the roads when vehicles pass by.

With the loan she plans to buy beverages and canned goods to supply her store since she wants to enlarge it. In the future she wants her son to successfully finish school and expand her store to other locations.

loans.use: To buy beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Hoseah

texts.en: Hoseah is a 33-year-old businessman.  He sells scrap metals to industries for recycling.  He has been in the business for two years.  He was previously selling household items such as utensils and electronics so as to earn a living.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Rose has operated a vegetable stall business for the past five years, selling vegetables retail and from home to her neighbors and passers-by. Rose faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.
With her 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables and potatoes for her vegetable stall. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables and potatoes for her vegetable stall

loans.name: Purevjargal

texts.en:
Purevjargal Y. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. His oldest two children both attend a local high school and his third child is in a kindergarten while his wife stays at home and takes care of their infant son. His wife also makes a variety of breads and pastries at home and sells them through local grocery shops to supplement the family's income.
Purevjargal operates a small wooden products production business in his town. He has been engaged in this business for the past three years and has gained significant experience over the years. Yet he has not expanded his business into a stable operation due to insufficient working capital. Purevjargal is a responsible and honest man who works very hard to provide for his family. He is requesting a 100,000 MNT loan for use as working capital.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es:
Dora Clemencia R. C., tiene 42 años, vive en unión libre con su conviviente, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Dora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ayudar a los hijos en los estudios.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Dora Clemencia R. C. is 42 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 7 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Dora engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of helping her children with their studies.

She likes watching television.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique.
Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her a loan to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Rafi

texts.en:
Rafi makes his living driving a taxi around the city of Isfara in Tajikistan. A pleasant mannered man, operating his own taxi has fulfilled Rafi’s long term desire to be self-employed. He offers good service to his customers and tries to give them an enjoyable ride. Rafi has been in business for about eight years. 

He has requested a loan of 8,000 TJS to help purchase spare parts for his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Rafi improve his business and continue his success. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for his car

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl es un padre de familia de 63 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace once años. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brindan. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga del sostenimiento económicao de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, sobre todo con la compra de útiles escolares por la campaña escolar, lo cual le brindará mayores ingresos y seguir invirtiendo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 63 year-old father.  He is married and lives together with his family in the agricultural district of Tambogrande which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Raúl has a small grocery store in his home which he has had for eleven years.  He offers his neighbors and customers staple products, essentials and groceries, candies and soda.  His business is very popular owing to the quality of the products that he sells and the good customer service that he provides.  He uses the profits from his business to financially support his family.

The growing demand that Raúl's store is experiencing has led him to think of expanding it, acquiring more products.  Above all, he would like to buy school supplies for the upcoming school year.  This will make him more income and he will be able to continue investing.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He believes that this will enable him to meet his customers' demand and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for the upcoming school year

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es:
la señora Melchi Susana R. P. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian y le ayudan en la limpieza de la casa, su esposo es policia preventivo
 
Melchi se dedica a la comercializacion de productos plasticos como ser: pailas, baldes, picheles, vasos, panas, termos para agua, tasas plasticas y mucho mas.

este negocio lo realiza desde hace varios años, Melchi tiene casa propia, ahorita la esta reparando.
tambien se dedica a vender mantequilla, queso y quesillo.

doña Melchi es muy trabajadora, viaja en bus para vender sus productos.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos fabricados de plastico.
su sueño es que sus hijos se graduen, Melchi es cristiana y muy alegre!!!
texts.en:
Sra. Melchi Susana R. P. is 35 years old, married, and has two children in school who help her with cleaning the house. Her husband works as a patrol officer.

Melchi sells products made of plastic such as basins, buckets, pitchers, cups, wash bowls, water bottles, cups, and other items. She has managed this business for several years. Melchi owns her home and is currently making repairs. She also sells butter and cheeses. Doña Melchi is an extremely hard worker who must travel by bus to sell her products.

This loan will be used to buy plastic goods. Her dream is to see her children graduate. Melchi is a Christian who is very happy.

loans.use: To acquire plastic goods such as basins, buckets, pitchers, cups, wash bowls, water bottles, cups, and other items.

loans.name: Ofelia Ines

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Ofelia  y nos cuenta un poco de su vida, ella tiene 50 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y  de esta unión tiene dos hijos que ya son  mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante de mariscos.

Ella tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de la ciudad de Santa Ana, en el cual prepara varios platos, vende desayunos y almuerzos, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 13h00 con la ayuda de su hija, nos cuenta que  este año empezó en este local por que antes  vendía la comida en su casa, con el crédito anterior adecuo el local y  ahora le va mucho mejor.
 
Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos y una parte para comprar pescado para el negocio del esposo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Nueva Luz” (New Light) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Santa Ana which is known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

We chatted with Ofelia here and she told us a bit about her life.  She’s 50 years old and is in a common law relationship.  From this relationship she has two adult children; one of them still lives with her.  Her husband is a seafood merchant.

She has a small eatery in Santa Ana’s market where she prepares a variety of dishes; she sells breakfasts and lunches.  She works daily from 5am until 1pm with help from her daughter.  She tells us that she started in this locale this year because she used to sell the food at her house.  She used the previous loan to equip her locale and now she’s doing much better.

This loan will be used to buy products needed to prepare her dishes and part of it will be used to buy fish for her husband’s business.  

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are a great help.  Her dream is to continue forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for meal preparation and fish.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson K. K. is 49 years old, married and the father of five children. He lives with his family in Mosop, Eldoret. His wife Elizabeth keeps poultry for sale. Jackson is a maize farmer. He has been farming for 11 years now and gets a monthly income of 9,000 shillings.

With this loan Jackson plans to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He wants to use the income that he will get from selling the maize to pay school fees for his children. 

In the future Jackson wants to buy a tractor that will help him with ploughing, and educate his children further.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children.  Jessica has had a small retail shop for one year.         

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a fridge and pay electricity bills.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Jessica hopes to own a wholesale shop. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing the capital in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and pay electricity bills.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
Jose tiene 50 años de edad es , no tiene hijos menores de edad.  vive con su esposa en una zona rural
 donde realizan sus actividades
 
José se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era más joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside.  El se dedica aesta labor desde hace  10  años aproximadamente


Jose desea adquirir un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles los cuales se utilizará para la comprar mas animales  y fertilizantes para su cultivo para que posteriormente tengan mejores ingresos

José es una persona empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 50, lives with his wife in a rural zone where they carry out their activities; they have no minor children.

José has been working in activities associated with agriculture since he was younger.  On the one hand he raises small farm animals, especially sheep, in some corrals located near his house; he feeds them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who frequent the zone where he lives. He’s been in this line of work for about 10 years.

José wants to get a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and fertilizer so that income will be better later on.

José is a determined, hard working person.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kholmuhamad

texts.ru: Холмухамад проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. В этом ему помогают двое его дочки. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Kholmuhamad lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 52 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been in the agriculture for more than twenty years. He has a small plot of land near his home where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. His two daughters are helping him in this business. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer. He wants to sow and gather a good harvest for resale.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells Fante kenkey at Elmina. Fante Kenkey — fermented mailze or casava wrapped in dried plantain leaves — is very common amongst the people in the Central Region of Ghana. Aba is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a fisherman. Aba has been selling Fante Kenkey for 9 years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Stanely Gitonga

texts.en:
Stanely is 42 years old and has been in mixed farming for 15 years in his hometown of Nkubu in Central Kenya. He is married, with 2 children aged 10 and 13. His farm produces potatoes, peas, cabbages and milk, which are all sold at the local market.

Stanely has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says the income will help him meet his family's basic needs such as the children's education. Stanely is focusing on doing dairy farming on a large scale. He says animal diseases and the high cost of feed are the challenges in farming. Stanely is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans are very efficient.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is 39 years old.  He is married and has 4 children.  Sadiq began earning income selling seasonal vegetables and fruits.  He has 7 years of experience in this field.  After a while, he began working at other jobs, but realized that his work wasn't bringing in enough income to cover the expenses of his family. 

Therefore, Sadiq decided to independently reengage in the seasonal vegetable sales business.  Gradually, he is becoming known in the area; however, he still needs additional capital to purchase vegetables and fruits for sale, given the high demand during the current season.  Sadiq is asking for a loan of 1,400 AZN.  With this money, Sadiq will be able to buy additional fruits and vegetables for sale and thus earn more profit.  Sadiq has a good client history and he is thankful to everyone for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase profit

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is married and has one child. She has been through junior high school. She sells underwear and slippers in Watreso near Abura, which she has done for one year. Her husband is a farmer. 

Faustina uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more underwear to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear to sell.

loans.name: David Fernando

texts.es:
David, se dedica a atender una panadería, tiene 10 años de estar en el negocio, está casado y es padre de un niño de 2 años, el negocio de David es por herencia de sus padres, quienes tenían el negocio desde un inicio.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de harina, huevos y leña, estos materiales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan, la inversión le ayudara para incrementar la producción y generar mayores ventas.
El objetivo de David es hacer crecer la panadería, fortalecerla y llegar a nuevas zonas donde se reconozca a nuevos clientes que le demanden más mercadería.
texts.en:
David is the manager of a bakery. He has been in business for 10 years. He is married and he is the father of a 2-year old boy. David inherited his business from his parents. They had the business since its beginning.

He requests a loan to purchase flour, eggs, and firewood. These products are necessary to make break. This investment will help him to increase production and to generate more sales.

David's objective is to expand his bakery, to strengthen it and to span out into new regions to reach new clients and to sell more products.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, and firewood to bake bread.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia, a 59-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a tailoring business in the Philippines for 19 years, Anastacia has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more threads and fabrics for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more threads and fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Susana Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Susana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es cómico.
 
Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda general en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como víveres, artículos de bazar, ciertas medicinas, además de productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Tiene más de diez años con su negocio y le va muy bien, cada día aumenta sus productos para dar lo mejor a sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos Avon, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 8 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener la mejor tienda de su barrio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, Manabí's capital, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Ave Fénix"(The Phoenix) hold a meeting every two weeks.
 
This is where we meet Señora Susana.  She is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband has two children who are 15 and 11 years old.  The children both go to school.  Her husband is a comedian.
 
Our friend has a general store in her home.  She sells all types of products in her store, such as provisions, convenience items, some medicines and Avon products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  Señora Susana works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with her store when they aren't busy.  She has been running her store for more than ten years, and it's going very well for her.  Every day she increases her stock to be able to give the best to her customers.

This loan will be used to stock up her store even more.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oils and Avon products, among other things.  Señora Susana has been with her communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because the loans have enabled her to improve her business.

Señora Susana hopes to have the best store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, Avon products etc.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a married woman with two children. She is 35 years old and she has a business selling frozen foods and different kinds of vegetables such as string beans, squash and eggplants. She has been running her business for almost 1 year. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds to plant and vegetables such as string beans, squash and eggplants to sell. Her husband is a worker, and adds to their daily income. Each month, Emely earns PHP 6,000 net income. This helps her support their daily needs, especially her children's education. 

She dreams that her business will become more productive so she can continue to send her children to school and to give her family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant and vegetables such as string beans, squash and eggplants to sell

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Zoljargal is 22-year-old and lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since February 2011, she has run a grocery store near her home.  Before that she operated a clothes shop called “Baby Shop” in another district. 

Zoljargal is an accountant and does all the accounting for her store by herself.  She hired a part-time salesperson to work in her store. 

Zoljargal wants a loan to purchase coal to heat her store and to supply food products, from local food vendors, to sell.  

She thinks she will expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase the coal to heat her store and food products to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 28 años, habita en el caserío de Shururuyoc. Ahí formó su familia, junto a su esposo Jesús. Ambos tuvieron 2 hijos, de los cuales falleció uno, quedando solo Cristian, al que cuidan en su casa propia. A pesar de la pérdida que tuvo, ella se mantiene con fuerzas, pues tiene que trabajar para el futuro de su hijo. Cuando era niña, aprendió las técnicas agrícolas que le sirvieron para la siembra de habas y arvejas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es fertilizar la tierra. Pero le disgusta la plaga de insectos y los factores climáticos que muchas veces son adversos para la buena producción, eso es lo arriesgado de la agricultura manifiesta, porque no sabe si todo lo sembrado rendirá en la cosecha. Pero eso no la desanima, pues ella cuida sus sembríos con mucho esmero. Además trabaja en una tienda de bordados, donde recibe un dinero extra; asimismo su esposo divide su tiempo con la música, ya que es artista y toca en diversos eventos sociales, donde también recibe un salario. Ahora ella desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Campo Verde” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está agradecida por el apoyo brindado, además dice que se mantiene puntual en el pago de sus cuotas pues quiere seguir trabajando con su grupo de manera responsable. Elisa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y un saco de semilla de habas para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elisa, 28, lives in the hamlet of Shururuyoc.  She formed her family there with her husband, Jesús.  They had two children but one of them died leaving just Cristian who they care for in their own house.  Despite her loss, she stays strong because she has to work for her son’s future.

When she was a little girl she learned the farming techniques that serve her for her lima bean and pea plantings.  What she most enjoys about her work is fertilizing the soil.  But she dislikes the insect infestations and the weather factors that often are adverse to a good harvest.  That’s what’s risky about farming, she states, because one never knows if everything planted will yield gains.  But this doesn’t discourage her because she cares for her crops with much dedication. 

In addition, she also works in a textile shop where she earns extra income.  Also, her husband divides his time between music, since he’s an artist and plays at various social events earning a salary as well.  Now, she wants to improve the quality of her crops.

She belongs to the “Campo Verde” (Green Countryside) communal bank and this is the 4th MFP loan where she’s grateful for all the support received.  In addition, she says that she’ll be punctual with her installment payments because she wants to continue to work with her group in a responsible way.  If Elisa were to receive your support, she’ll use the requested money to buy pea seeds and a sack of lima bean seeds for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and a sack of lima bean seeds.

loans.name: Faasiamani

texts.en:
Faasiamani is a 20 year old single woman.  She plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale.  Faasiamani has one year of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase farm supplies and equipment.  Faasiamani plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 240 Talas or US $100 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faasiamani joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faasiamani's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Vicente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Vicente es la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, fierro, ladrillos, clavos, lozas, arena, piedra chancada y otras cosas  más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Vicente requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cemento y piedra chancada. 

Vicente agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Vicente belongs to the “San Jose de Urubamba” communal bank in the city of Urubamba. The bank members gather every 30 days in the city and province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Vicente lives in Urubamba city where he carries out his economic activities. Vicente's principal activity is selling construction materials, such as, for example, cement, iron, bricks, nails, ceramic tile, sand, crushed stone and other things. For several years now he has dedicated himself to the business and it is going well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

On this occasion, Vicente needs a loan to buy more merchandise, such as, for example, cement and crushed store.

Vicente appreciates and values the loan and promises to comply with his monthly payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, like cement and crushed stone, to sell.

loans.name: Mirva

texts.en: Mirva is a 32-year-old married Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and their child. She has been preparing and installing computer programs since 2007. She works from home and her husband, who serves in the Lebanese army, helps her cover the high cost of living. Today, she is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new computer with a full complement of accessories so that she can proceed with her business properly. She notes that this computer will help her improve her work, and therefore facilitate her program implementation. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer with a full complement of accessories

loans.name: 030706-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngoãn, age 39, raises poultry and cattle to earn a living. She has been involved in this business for three years. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase chicks to raise and sell in future. She and her husband have two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 030706-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Ngoãn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngoãn has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Ngoãn faces in her business is lack of capital.

In the future, Ngoãn hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Maríanella

texts.es:
En el municipio del Sauce, departamento de León, La señora. Maríanella Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabaja, tiene  un hijos bajo su cargo donde ha mostrado buenos principios morales  logrando mantener el respeto de muchas personas de su lugar, ha logrado mejorar el bienestar de su casa, su salud y su familia viviendo en mejores condiciones. 

 Se presentó a Ceprodel  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para cubrir gastos médicos, que le ayudara a obtener las medicinas recomendadas por el médico, ya que con esto mejorará las condiciones de su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en: In the Municipality of Sauce, the Department of Leon, Marianella is known for being a very dedicated person to her job.  She has one son under her care and has shown to possess good moral principles, successful in maintaining the respect of many people in her community.  She has been able to improve the well-being of her house, her health, and her family's quality of life.  She presented herself to Ceprodel with the objective of seeking a credit to cover medical costs, in order to help her obtain the medicine recommended by her doctor and thus improve the conditions of her health and that of her family's.

loans.use: purchase medicine.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a 40-year-old man living in the Philippines. He is separated from his wife, but he has one child.

To earn a living, Roger operates a service-based business. Specifically, he provides transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for 27 years, and every month he earns approximately 4,000 PHP from this work.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,389.78 PHP to repair a transport vehicle that is used in his business. Roger has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Roger hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a business vehicle

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Pino  lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Paula quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 4 años  además trabaja en un restaurante junto a su esposo quien es cocinero de ahí. Ella invertira el crédito en la compra de mercaderia en cosméticos.

Las otras integrantes son Edda quien se dedica al comercio de ropa  desde hace 2 años, Sandra quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años y Rosibel quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada hace 2 ½ años.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Pino” group is made up of four hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Paula, who has been selling cosmetics for 4 years. She also works in a restaurant along with her husband, who is a cook there. She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics.

The other members are Edda, who has been selling clothing for 2 years, Sandra, who has had a small grocery store for 4 years, and Rosibel, who has been selling used clothing for 2.5 years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Santos Calixto

texts.es:
El Señor Santos es una persona muy  trabajadora dedicada  100% a su negocio,  vive con sus 4 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de  Honduras. Y  tiene más de 12 años de tener Llantera. El  préstamo lo invertirá en  la  compra  de llantas usadas y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas. Con el préstamo  espera superar sus ventas y así satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes.
Don Santos espera tener mejores ingresos para tener mejor forma de vida. Sus  sueños es poder mejorar su  negocio,  tener su propio local, para apoyar a sus   4 hijos y darles  una mejor educación.
Choluteca  Honduras  - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para compra de llantas usadas para su negocio

loans.name: Maritza  Johana

texts.es:
Maritza Johana  es una madre soltera con una niña, quien por el fallecimiento de su madre también tiene a cargo  a sus dos hermanos menores. Ella quiere terminar sus estudios de enfermería pues su proyecto es poder tener los recursos necesarios para poder brindarle a su hija una buena educación,  empezando desde su corta edad y poder contribuir para que sus dos hermanos menores puedan tener una educación especial de acuerdo a la incapacidad que ellos sufren, brindándoles asi la oportunidad de que aprendan algún arte para que se puedan defender en un futuro.
Ella quiere una vez terminada su carrera hacer un voluntariado enfocándose en niños y/o ancianos, pues su propósito es tener la satisfacción de ayudar a otras personas  y poderle enseñar a su hija el gusto de servir a los demás. 
Su anhelo es dejarle a su hija buenas bases morales pero también económicas y no dejarla totalmente desprotegida si algún día llegase a faltar, para esto una de sus metas son tener una microempresa de productos agrícolas sin dejar de ejercer su principal pasión que es la enfermería pero que este aporte económico que brinda esta profesión sea una contribución para levantar esta microempresa.
texts.en:
Maritza Johana’s a single mother of a girl but because of her mother’s death she’s also caring for her two younger siblings.  She wants to complete her nursing course because her project is to have the necessary resources to provide a good education for her daughter starting at a very young age and to be able to contribute so that her two younger siblings can get special education tailored to the disability they have thus providing them the opportunity to study some art so that they can fend for themselves in future.

Once she completes her studies she wants to do some volunteer work focused on children and/or older people because her goal is to have the satisfaction of helping others and to instill in her daughter the joy of serving others.

Her dream is to instill in her daughter not only good moral bases but also economic ones so that she will not be left unprotected if she herself should someday no longer be here.  This is why one of her goals is to have an agricultural supplies micro business while not leaving aside her passion for nursing so that the income this profession produces will contribute towards this micro business’ establishment.

loans.use: with her studies at Campoalto.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock rearing, a business he started with the intention of educating his children and to improve his standards of living. He also earns additional income from farming. 

Francis hopes to be a prominent businessman. His main challenges are inadequate capital and weather changes. 

He is requesting a loan to buy cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy cows for his farm.

loans.name: Khazal

texts.en:
46-year old Khazal temporary settled her family with three children in Xirdalan dormitory. She is  Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Kalbacar. 
Since 2000 Khazal has been engaged in manufactured goods at fair. 
Having borrowed 2 loans of $400-$600 from Komak Credit Union she significantly expanded her business,  to increase profits achieved progress in her business.The loans were paid back timely.
 Now she needs a loan of $800 to open own clothing store.

loans.use: To open own clothing store

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina O. sells food to the community; a business she started five years ago. She is 40 years old. She has evidence of the impact of a LAPO loan on her business. She requests a $500 loan for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for cooking

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
I make rich treats that I sell at schools and in my neighborhood for the past four years. I would be greatful if you helped me purchase more flour, eggs and sugar because I have numerous orders at schools to fulfill. This business has helped me be able to provide for my three children and keep them in school.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yo hago una ricas donnas que vengo a las escuela y colegios y en mi comunidad. Megustaria que me ayudaran para poder comprar mas harian, huevos y azucar ya que tengo varios pedidos en las esculas. Tambien con este negocio he podido ayudar a mis 3 hijos para que sigan estudiando en la escuela. hace 4 años que mededico a la venta de ricas donnas.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
If you should go to Phu Minh commune, Soc Son district and ask people to show you the way to Mr. Thanh and Mrs. D.'s house, you will hear them ceaselessly praise this couple.

Mrs. Nguyen T. D., aged 40, and Mr. Nguyen Van Thanh, aged 41, not only live in harmony but also are good at doing business. They have a corn business where she sells corn kernel and corn mash wholesale and retail. Normally he operates a milling machine to grind corn kernel, yet when their customers want to have corn delivered to their house, he can ride a rickshaw or drive a motor-cart to transport corn. From this business they earn about $12.5 a day. In addition, they have a rice field of 700m2. You may wonder how they can manage everything. The answer is simple and easy to understand. They have the encouragement from good results of their 4 school-going children aged 9 to 18. Thinking about the future of these dear children, Mrs. D. wants to borrow $1,200.00 to buy 6 tons of corn to expand her business. Of course they will be busier, yet they are willing to do everything for the sake of their children.

loans.use: She wants to buy 6 tons of corn for her corn business.

loans.name: Norma Galdina

texts.es:
Norma is unmarried and has a 36 year old daugher. She started her business because while alone and taking care of her daughter she needed to do something to be able to raise and provide her education. When Norma was a child she worked with her mother and learned how to make hammocks, so she decided to apply this talents to start her own hammock-making budsiness. Little by little the business grew since her work is good. People go to her to buy a high quality product at a good price. With her business she has been able to raise and maintain her daughter well, and she wants to continue the business to improve her quality of life.

Norma is asking for a six month US $475 loan to improve the room where she makes the hammocks, and to buy frames for weaving. She and her family are very grateful for the support you are giving so she can continue and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma no esta casada y tiene una hija de 36 años de edad, empezó con su negocio por que al quedarse sola al cuidado de su hija tuvo que hacer algo para poder mantenerla y educarla, así que ella desde muy joven trabajo con su madre y aprendió las técnicas para la elaboración de hamacas, así que decidió aplicar sus conocimientos y dedicarse a la elaboración de las mismas, poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio ya que el trabajo que ella realiza es bueno y bonito por lo que la gente recurre a ella para comprar un producto a buen precio y de buena calidad, con su negocio a podido crecer y mantener a su hija sacándola adelante y desea continuar con su negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Norma está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US 475 para mejorar su cuarto de trabajo en donde realiza la elaboración de las hamacas y comprar bastidores, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia están muy agradecidas por el apoyo que le brindes para continuar con su negocio y el crecimiento del mismo.

loans.use: To better her work space and buy frames for weaving hammocks

loans.name: Yanah

texts.en: Yanah is 32 years old and is married. She manages goat livestock. She buys baby goats and then raises them until they become bigger. Her husband Kamil is a laborer and usually earns $10 per week. She is a member of MBK and needs a loan to expand her business. She hopes it will help  finance her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Parviz Group

texts.ru:
Group "Parvis" has been successfully obtaining loans for the past few years. All members of the group sell clothes on city markets. Malvuda T. sells clothes that she makes herself. Azizova M. and Hosiyat S. sell children's clothing. They travel to purchase goods themselves every 2 weeks. Sometimes Hosiyat's son helps her. Marifat used to sell clothes on markets, but now she works as a sales woman in a department store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Группа "Парвиз" кредитуется уже на протяжении нескольких лет. Все участники группы торгуют одеждой на рынках города. Тохирова торгует одеждой которая сама шьет. Муяссар и Хосият торгуют детской одеждой, в месяц 2 раза они сами ездят за товаром. Иногда Хосият помогает сын. Марифат раньше торговала на рынке, на данный момент она торгует в магазине детской одеждой.

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Kazinga A (I) Group

texts.en: Juliet is 33 years old. She has a small poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits to expand her polutry business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Katebo Business Group

texts.en: Katebo business group is located in the Katebo trading centre in Buwama. The chairperson, N. Juliet is 52 years old, divorced with 9 children and cares for 6 grandchildren.  This has kept her in business since she has nowhere to turn to except getting a loan to boost her business. She runs a banana plantation where she also keeps cows and pigs. This loan will help her employ local workers and buy more pigs since they do not take long to mature. This will in turn help her continue paying fees for her school going children.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, cows and employ manpower for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly C. is a widow with three children; two sons and one daughter. Her sons study in Sihanouk Ville City and the daughter has full-time employment. The family lives along Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ly has been in the business of selling silk products for two years. She buys finished products from weavers in her village for resale in Sihanouk Ville City twice a month. She earns US $130 net profit per month. Ly is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $1000 for purchasing silk products for reselling.

loans.use: For purchasing silk products for resale

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum S., 51, has a motorbike-washing business in the Chhlang Moeung Tbong Village in Kandal Province where she earns about $2.5 per day. She lives with her husband, Thlang Pruonh, 54, and her only child, who repairs motorbikes and drives a soil truck. Pruonh earns around $2.5 per day as a soldier.

Mrs. S. now seeks a $800 loan to buy a air pumping machine for using in her motorbike-washing business. With the income generated by her business, she will be able to support her family’s financial stability easily.

loans.use: To buy a air pumping machine for using in her motorbike-washing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To continue investing in merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mesi

texts.en: Mesi S., 47, is married with 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in general business. She sells to the village and general public 6 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Mesi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She wants to improve business and accommodate her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase ice cakes, pancakes, pork cakes, etc

loans.name: Leuta

texts.en:
Leuta R. is a 56-year-old married woman with 8 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation/ice cake business. In practice, she sells her products to the public and village people 3 days per week, which normally generates a positive weekly net cash flow of approximately 400 Tala ($166 USD).

She has received 1 previous loan from SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Leuta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with any of the traditional banks. With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase equipment to improve her operations on the plantation and to commence the ice cake business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her operations by purchasing equipment for her plantation and by beginning an ice cake business

loans.name: Nisveta

texts.en: Nisveta is a married woman from the town of Doboj.  Together she and her husband have 2 children.  Her husband works full time, and Nisveta does farming at their home, mainly planting & growing  vegetables to feed their family.   This is her 1st loan from Zene za Zene, which she is requesting in the amount of 1200 KM.  She wants to use this loan to buy a bunch of chickens, as well as food for them. She plans to fatten the chickens, and sell them at a time when their meat is most valuable.  It is Nisveta’s goal to earn income this way so she can help her family meet their household needs.

loans.use: To buy chickens and food for chickens

loans.name: Muhamadazim

texts.ru:
Мухамадазим, ему 27 лет, он женат и имеет троих детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность начал в 2005 году с продажи  кондитерских изделий в арендуемом магазине. В данный момент у него большой ассортимент товаров. Он торгует конфетами и кондитерскими изделиями производства России на рынке «Саховат» города Душанбе. В его ассортименте также имеются сухофрукты, такие как изюм, миндаль, сушеный абрикос, фисташки и орехи. Свой товар закупает в оптовых магазинах «Сафар-Центр»-а города Душанбе и у оптовиков из города Худжанда и Исфары. 
Услышав о программе Кива, решил участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Muhamadazim is 27 years old, married and has three children. He started his entrepreneurship in 2005 selling confectionery products at a leased store. Currently, he has a wide assortment of products. He sells Russian-produced candy and confectionery at the Sahovat market in Dushanbe. Muhamadazim’s product assortment also includes dried fruit and nuts, such as raisins, apricots, almonds and pistachios. He buys his goods at wholesale stores in Dushanbe, Khujand and Isfara. Once he heard about the Kiva program, Muhamadazim decided to participate and obtain a loan of $1200, needed to increase his goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase confectionery products

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: K. Rose is a member of Abateesa women's group and the mother of Serubogo Jane Francis, also a group member. Rose has a clinic that is managed by her daughter but her main business for the past 6 years is poultry farming. She has over 800 chickens, both broilers and layers. She is married with 10 children, including 4 orphans belonging to her late children. This is her forth year with her lending group, and has nothing but kind words regarding the group lending, especially for people like herself who lack collateral to get loans from big banks. Whenever she gets a loan, she makes sure that she stocks chicken feed and mash.  Repayments are usually possible with the sale of eggs and broilers. Right now, the maize for chicken feed is quite expensive and this has increased the price she must ask for her eggs and chickens. If not for the loans from Pearl Microfinance, she would be out of business.

loans.use: Kiwanuka Rose plans to stock chicken feed and mash for her broiler and layer chickens.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Carmen tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió quinto D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. 03 hijos (01 con familia y 02 solteros), vive en la Av. Ejercito Nº 578 del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo – Puno.

DesD. el año 2003 integra  el Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo. A la edad D. 37 años empezó hacer negocio D. plastiqueria  a la fecha, venD. en su puesto que tiene en el mercado D. Yunguyo.

Con el crédito D. S/.2000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar: 02 paquetes D. lavadores con S/.660.00, 01 paquete D. baldes con  S/.200.00 y otros (plastiquerias).

Su meta es tener una tienda granD. D. plastiquerias (surtido) y  su hija menor termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carmen is 57 years old and she attended school up to graD. 11. She is married and she has 3 children (one still lives with the family, and the two others are independent). She lives in Av. Ejercity No. 578 in the district and province of Yunguyo - Puno.

Since the year 2003 she has been a member of the community bank "Winay Marca" in Yunguyo. When she was 37 years old she started selling plastic products, and she continues to carry on this business. She sells from her stand in the market of Yunguyo.

With the loan of S/.2000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 2 packs of washers (costing S/.660), 1 pack of pails (costing S/.200) and other plastic items.

Her goal is to have a large store to sell her plastic products (bearing a wiD. variety) and she dreams of seeing smallest daughter complete her schooling.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en Republica de Panamá Nº 159, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una cerrajería en casa, el cual le brinda ganancias. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la administración de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 4 kilos de soldadura y 6 latas de pintura.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado. Ahora tendrá la oportunidad de apoyar sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia belongs to the community bank of Bellavista located in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and has 2 children who are still young, she is married and her husband works as an independent contractor. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for $/.300 she invested it buying candy. She has 4 years working with the community bank. Currently has a hardware store at her house, which provides good profit. She also has the support of her husband managing the store. With the loan of S/.1,000 which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy 4 kilos of iron and 6 cans of paint. Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has improved and she will have the chance to help her little children.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 kilos of iron and 6 cans of paint.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 14 años. Desde muy niña le fascinaron los animales y a medida que estuvo creciendo logró convertir este gusto en una manera de ganarse la vida, criando y vendiendo. Es así que esta actividad la viene acompañando por 20 años, pero lo más importante es que no tuvo que alejase de sus seres queridos para poder trabajar, sino que tuvo el tiempo necesario para estar pendientes de su familia. Además, la venta de carne en los mercados es solvente y el consumo que hay en la zona y en diversas ciudades lo hace un negocio muy rentable. Yolanda es nueva en el tema de créditos, pero está comprometida en asumir  la responsabilidad de pago para con la institución. Utilizara en dinero solicitado en la compra de ganado y algunos animales menores  para venderlos en estas festividades.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and lives with her husband and 14-year-old son. Since a very young age animals fascinated her and as she was growing up she succeeded in turning her fascination with animals into a way to earn a living by raising and selling them. She has been raising and selling animals for 20 years, but the most important thing is that she did not have to leave her loved ones in order to work and had the time necessary to be available to her family.

Additionally, the sale of meat in the markets is reliable and the consumption in the area and in different cities makes it a very profitable business. Yolanda is new to the microfinance system, but is committed to assuming the responsibility of paying according to the institution. She will use the money for the purchase of livestock and some smaller animals in order to sell them during these festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in her livestock

loans.name: Rakhib

texts.en: Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Azerbaijan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables.  Rakhib M. has been selling fruits and vegetables in a small village of Sabirabad city for the past ten years.  He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings, as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur.  Rakhib began selling in the newly built shop on central street with very little stock to offer his clients.  Slowly, he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall.  Rakhib is a father of two adorable daughters that are in school.  Like any father, he is doing all he can in order to ensure his children the best future and make them well-educated.  Now, he needs a loan of $1,200 USD in order to increase his stock of goods.  He promises to repay the loan within 15 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for sale

loans.name: Mariela Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Doris es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Doris tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Doris necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños de Doris son aumentar su negocio y tener otra tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of Faith Communal Bank. She is a a 27year-old single mother with one child. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries daily. Doris needs a loan of 1200 soles which she will use to buy milk, sugar, and oil. Doris dreams of growing her business and having another store in the center of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Tahira M. Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Tahira baji is the wife of M. N., who is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).Tahira baji owes a two room brick house and has lived there, with her family for the past 10 years. Tahira baji is a lady who believes on hard work. She has taught this strength to her son. Her son attends 7th grade and studies hard. Tahira baji wishes to give him a good future. For this reason she makes embroidered dresses and takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. She charges $3 for per dress. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw so that he will be able to continue his work. 

She is a loan group leader of some other women in her locality. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires and switch boards) for her electric supplies selling business. Aqsa baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Waziran baji and Bushra baji wants a loan to buy meat for their meat selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Hace pocos días atrás Félix cumplió 62 años de edad, es soltero vive en su casa con su hermana y sus sobrinos. Ahora que los años pesan siente nostalgia de no haber formado familia, y muchas veces siente que su trabajo no tiene un por qué, ni para quien sacrificarse tanto; pero a la vez está agradecido a Dios por darle una buena hermana y sobrinos que lo acompañan y apoyan en sus  cultivos. Viene sembrando alverjas, maíz, y un algo de papa en chacras de la comunidad y en algunas chacras que él ha adquirido en todo este tiempo de agricultor. Félix está feliz de labrar la tierra, ya que sus cultivos le dio bonanzas económicas, como también malos momentos por los precios bajos del mercado. Como ahora en los choclos que no los cosecha por los bajos precios del mercado, prefiere dejarlos en la chacra, para hacer que maduren y hacerlos secar en mazorcas, después desgranarlos y venderlos como maíz seco, solo así recuperará el dinero invertido en este cultivo. Félix está muy contento por ser un cliente de MFP, ya lleva 8 préstamo consecutivos, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, asimismo hace los mismo compromisos para este crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semillas de alverjas de tipo mejorada, por ser apropiado por el clima, y le resulta de muy buena producción.
texts.en:
Felix celebrated his 62nd birthday a few days ago, and is single living in a house with his sister and his nieces and nephews. Now that he's getting older he feels a little nostalgic about never forming his own family, and he often feels that his work is meaningless, and not worth all the sacrifice. At the same time, he thanks God for giving him a good sister and nieces and nephews that help and support him with his crops. He grows peas, corn, and a few potatoes in his community's public fields, as well as in some of his own which he has acquired in his years as a farmer. Felix is happy to work the land because his crops sometimes earn him a lot of money, but there are also bad times in which the low price of his crops means he earns very little. Like now, with the corn price so low he doesn't bother harvesting it, instead preferring to leave it in the fields so it ages, dries into corncobs, which he later breaks down and sells as dry corn. This is the only way for him to recover the money he has invested in this crop.

Felix is very happy to be a client of MFP, and has already taken out 8 loans. In all this time he as demonstrated himself to be punctual with his loan payments, and promises to do the same with this loan. The money he is asking for is to buy higher quality pea seeds (special seeds that are better for the climate) that give him a very good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth and ingredients for dyeing cloth

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for three years, Z. Ilhomiddin was born in 1973 in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and responsible for four people including his wife and three children.

Very dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his flock and repair his enclosure, so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from more than 20 km from his village.

With this goal in mind, Ilhomiddin is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also to make some investments.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his flock and repair his enclosure

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Магмуродова Малохат проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 30 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Муж работает в военной части. Сама уже 10 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует тканями. Работает на рынке "Сафина". Товар привозит из города Душанбе.Получает около 600 сомони прибыли. Для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и завезти сезонный товар Она решила обратиться к нам за кредитом. Таким образом она сможет развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Malohat M. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works in the military service. She has been in the retail business for ten years now selling fabrics. She works on the Safina market. She brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe. She makes about 600 somoni (US$138) of profit. To increase the variety of her inventory and bring in seasonal merchandise she decided to apply for a loan with us. This way she can develop her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Kuong

texts.en:
Kuong T., 50, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works driving a horse and cart taxi. He owns a cart and he also uses it to pick up passers-by and merchandise in and around his community.

Kuong T. now has one son who is no longer in school and is unemployed. She wants her son to have an occupation as a motor-taxi driver. Due to the lack of capital, Kuong T. has decided to ask a loan on Kiva to be used to buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
“Behind the clouds, the sun is still shining,” shared Lydia B. when asked about her view of life. Lydia, 50 years old and blessed with four children, is a business-minded woman residing in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela, where she is married to Rogelio, a farmer.
