Two of their children are already married and the other two are still single, the youngest studying in college. Through Lydia’s vending snacks in their village and her husband patiently maintaining their farm, they have been able to provide their four children with a college education. At present, her two married children are working for their own families while her third child is assisting them with some of their finances at home and the education of their youngest one.

Aside from selling snacks, Lydia also sometimes sells vegetables harvested from their farm. She is very patient and diligent in her business because she wants her family to have a good future and is hoping to avail a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase more products to sell. She still wants her youngest child to finish her college degree to be able to attain her dreams just like her elder brother and sisters. With the help of the Almighty, she knows that He will guide them in reaching each of their goals in life. She also prays for the good health of the family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Heydi Sugey

texts.es: Heydi Sugey G. T. tiene la edad de 32 años. Es una mujer casada. La actividad económica de Heydi es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio esta actividad por la necesidad de obtener un medio de vida, debido a la situación económica que ella enfrentaba no pudo seguir estudiando, ella ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, además de ofrecer estos productos también ofrece un poco de granos básicos. La ubicación de su negocio en es un pequeño establecimiento en el mercado, es aquí donde ofrece leche, cuajad, queso y mantequilla. El dinero que  está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como leche y granos básicos. El sueño de Heydi es ampliar su negocio para tener el espacio suficiente para sus productos.
texts.en:
Heydi Sugey G. T. is 32 years old and married. Heydi sells milk products, and has been doing this for over 10 years. She started this business because she needed to make a living; due to the economic situation she was faced with, she was not able to pursue studies. She has fought much to keep herself afloat. In addition to offering these products, she also stocks a small amount of basic grains. Her business is in a small establishment at the market, which is where she sells milk, cuajad, cheese, and butter. The money she is requesting is for working capital so that she can buy raw materials, like milk, and basic grains. Heydi's dream is to grow her business to so that she can have enough space for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan Félix

texts.es: Don Juan Felix  M. tiene 22 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposa  e hija, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación  ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Félix M., aged 22, is married and lives with his wife and his daughter. He is a weaver by trade and has two looms in his workshop named "Making of Traditional Ladies' Wear". He and his wife are engaged in the same trade. They have hired two workers for this activity. They have been making dresses for six years in their home in a hamlet near Aldea Vásquez in the department of Totonicapán in Guatemala. Recently the demand of his customers has grown, but his economic situation prevents him from making the necessary capital investments. For this reason he came to Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan, intending to buy raw material and thereby increasing his sales and giving his family the chance of better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 66 years old and lives with her farmer husband and seven-year-old grandson. The land in her village is mostly used for rice and vegetable production and Magdalena and her husband are one of the many couples who farm these as a business. The rice and vegetables they harvest are sold in the municipal market on market day and at other markets in other municipalities. This has been Magdalena's family's source of income for 34 years. In the past the business was on and off because of lack of finance and no available credit. It started to become more stable when Magdalena joined Kiva partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), and was able to take a loan. From then on, her business eventually grew and she started to dream for her grandchildren, especially the one who lives with her. 

Magdalena wants to take a larger loan from ASHI in order to sustain her business and enhance it further. She hopes that some day, out of her profits, she will be able to build a house made of stone so that her family will not bothered when typhoons come and strong winds hit the house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for rice and vegetable production

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is a 47-year-old woman married to Ricardo, who is a 47-year-old farmer. She lives in the peaceful town of Jala-jala, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She has no children, but she really longs for them.

Even though she has no children, she is still determined to have a source of income, aside from her husband's farming income. In 2001, she happily joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her first loan, she invested it in the resale of charcoal as her primary business. She is also involved in fishing and farming, both as secondary businesses.

As the years pass, she has noticed that her investment in the resale of charcoal is getting better, and it is providing her with good income. She buys the charcoal from the charcoal maker and resells it in their village. Now on her tenth loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos as additional capital for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for two hundred sacks of charcoal for resale, and also its transportation expenses.

She dreams of expanding her business so that she can save for their future, and be able to build a more spacious and durable house.

loans.use: Purchase and transportation of bulk charcoal

loans.name: El Quior Group

texts.es: Las socias que conforman el grupo residen en la zona D. “El Quiro”  es D. ahí el nombre del Banco Comunal, El grupo va cursando ya su tercer ciclo a la presidencia del la señora Mirian, demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad, puntualidad y ganas D. trabajar es por esta razón que la fundación Agrocapital le da un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan adelante. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a al venta D. productos como cosméticos, ropa, zapato, comida, abarrote en tiendas D. barrio, artesanías y servicio D. peluquería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. telas al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos.
texts.en:
The members of this group all live in the "El Quiro" neighborhood, hence the name of the Communal Bank. This is their third cycle under the leadership of Mrs. Mirian. They have demonstrated responsibility, honesty, puctuality and a desire to work and for these reasons, Agrocapital approves a new economic incentive for them to continue forward. Most of the members are involved in cosmetic, clothing, footwear, food and grocery sales as well as handicrafts, neighborhood stores and barber supplies and services. As in all commercial activities, competition and supply and demand exist but these members have learned how to progress and continue to reap good incomes to better proviD. for their families. This loan will be used to diversify inventory, to purchase wholesale fabric, seasonal merchandise, and raw materials with which to produce better and more varied products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Funds.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: El Joven Pablo Emilio A. M., tiene la edad de 23años habita en San José de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar sus padres , el joven agradece a la institución ya que gracias al financiamiento obtenido logro cancelar en tiempo y forma ; a la vez estableció ¼ de piñas mas para seguir trabajando las tierras que su papá le facilito para que las explotara cultivándola .Se siente contento por el apoyo que se le brida tanto a él como a  otros agricultores para que en futuro puedan vivir cómodamente. Comprara con préstamo insumos agrícolas para mejorar sus cultivos.

loans.use: Comprar insumos agricola para mejorar los productos

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha D. sells fertilizers and other Agro Chemicals in Abotoase. Martha has received senior high education.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a domestic farmer.  Martha is responsible for the payment of school fees, rent and utility bills for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more Agro chemicals to sell. She hopes to reinvest the profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more Agro chemicals to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Ry Seam Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ry S. is a village bank president, as selected by thirteen people in Kaev Kraom village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Ry S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, to earn a living. In this farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers for her fields, to make the crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Reoung Sameth, is a teacher who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Ry S. has four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Currently, one of her children is in school, while her youngest child is too young to attend school. She lives in a community in the western region of Ghana.

To earn a living, she is a trader who deals assorted products such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She generally sells her goods through "hawking" (i.e., house-to-house selling). She explains that she has been trading for three years now. With her good humor and kind demeanor she has attracted many loyal customers who purchase goods from her stand. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently, she added food sales during lunch time to her business operations. Specifically, she prepares and serves banku with tilapia. Banku, which is a delicacy prepared from milled maize and includes hot sauce or pepper, is enjoyed by many people of Ghana.

She has been facing challenges with her business as a result of inadequate funds, which precludes her from purchasing additional inventory. As a result, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to buy more supplies of products that are frequently in high demand. With the loan proceeds she believes she will be better positioned to generate higher profits in order to, ultimately, build her own store (and thereby do away with the need to sell her products by "hawking"). She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Imelda is single and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda is starting a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Imelda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Josphat Libwege

texts.en: Josphat Libwege S. runs a sawmill and has supplied timber and logs in Kisumu town for the last seven years. His business challenges are insecurity and the high cost of transportation. He plans to use the proceeds of a KES20,000 loan to buy more timber.  His goal in life is to own a timber yard.  Josphat is married and has four children.  He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Eliava Ocokoru Hellen Group

texts.en:
Hellen O. is forty-two years old. She is married and has four children in school. She also cares for two dependents, one of whom goes to school. 

Hellen has been selling food, such as cassava flour, ground nuts, and beans, since 2005. She is using this loan to purchase food to sell. The loan will improve her business and she hopes to do better. Her future hope is to obtain a better structure for her home.

loans.use: To purchase food, such as cassava flour, ground nuts, and beans

loans.name: Mayling Group

texts.es: El grupo Mayling está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde tempranas horas se encuentran el mercado ofertando su producto. Estas son Juana Isabel P., Damaris del Carmen A. P. y Antonia de los Santos
texts.en: The Mayling group is made up of three, hard-working women, who can be found in the market selling their products from very early in the morning on.  They are: Juana Isabel P., Damaris del Carmen A. P. and Antonia de los Santos

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Blessing Plus Group

texts.en:
Mfuti R. is a leader of a Community bank named “Blessing Plus”, which is composed of 34 micro entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mfuti is 38 years old, married and a father of six children between the ages of 3 and 13. Four of the children go to school. He sells pairs of shoes. He has been in business since 1999 and has already received six loans from Hope that he repaid correctly. He has acquired solid experience and his business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. He intends, with the next loan, to purchase 20 pairs of shoes to increase his inventory. Currently, he earns a profit of $30 every week. His dream is to open a general boutique in his area.

loans.use: To purchase 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Evangelina, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad nuestra socia es soltera  y tiene 2 hijos de 21, 14 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, compra y vende animales, nuestra socia tiene cuyes, chanchos, pollos; La socia tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual hizo su casa y su espacio para criar animales menores, cuando logran el tiempo de madurez ella vende a su animalitos y en el caso de reproducción de sus animales vende los mayores luego de un tiempo y cría a los bebes, ese es el negocio de nuestra socia, ella solicita el préstamo para comprar otra nueva camada de animales variados para aumentar su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Evangelina belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank. She lives in the Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 45 years old and single, with 2 children aged 21 and 14. She divides her time between her household activities and her retail sales business, in which she buys and sells animals. She has guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. Evangelina has a small plot of land on which she built her house and set up a space to raise small animals. When the animals reach maturity, she sells them. Sometimes she breeds the animals, selling the older ones after a while and raising the babies. This is her work, and she is requesting the loan to buy a new supply of various animals to expand her business. Evangelina is grateful for the opportunity provided to her, and she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing small animals to sell

loans.name: Javier Fausto

texts.es:
Javier forma parte del banco comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo”, es conviviente y es natural  de la ciudad del cusco. Javier es un  joven trabajador y emprendedor que abrió su propio negocio de construcción de carrocerías para camiones.  Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Javier requiere el préstamo de los 1500 soles para comprar madera y fierro. Javier nos cuenta que su anhelo es abrir otro taller de construcción de carrocerías en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco.    
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the "Kantu de San Jerónimo" Village Bank. He's from the city of Cusco and has a common-law wife. He is a very hard-working and enterprising young man, who opened his own truck body building shop. He's been in business for five years now, and things have gone quite well for him, thanks to the determination he brings to his work. Javier needs a loan for 1500 soles to buy wood and iron. He tells us that he dreams of opening another body building shop in the San Jerónimo District in Cusco Province. This member is very grateful for the opportunity given him, and promises to make all of his payments in-full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Javier needs a loan for 1500 soles to buy wood and iron.

loans.name: Lito Salome

texts.es: El Sr. Lito tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente tienen una hija en edad escolar, su conyugue trabaja temporalemnet en fundos agricolas como obrera de campo. El Sr. Lito actualmente cuenta con el ingreso de 2 motos taxis el cual uno lo trabaja , y el otro lo alquila. Tambien han adquirido  recientemente un puesto comercial en el mercado de la Tinguiña, el su esposa vendera verduras. El y su familia viven en casa de su suegros. Tienen muchas metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener el negocio de la venta de verduras. Con el Dinero que solicitan invertiran en el negocio  del puesto comercial.
texts.en:
Sr. Lito is 33 years old. He and his live-in partner have a daughter of school age. His partner works seasonally as a field worker on agricultural properties. Sr. Lito now relies on income from two motorcycle taxis; he uses one for his work and rents the other one. They have also recently acquired a stall in the Tinguiña market, where his partner will sell vegetables. He and his family live in the house of his in-laws. They have many goals. One of them is to have a business selling vegetables. With the money that he is seeking, they will invest in their market stall business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a market stall

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito de territorio bastante accidentado y cuya población se sitúa principalmente en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicado a una hora y media de a ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace mas de tres años como carpintero metálico, actualmente posee un taller ubicado en una zona céntrica de Olmos, allí el confecciona todo tipo de estructuras metálicas como puertas, ventanas, mesas, entre otros. La calidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que su negocio se haga conocido y que tenga una cartera fija de clientes que siempre acuden a solicitarle sus servicios. Esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingreso y se vale de ella para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a la economía de su familia.

Pablo desea implementar su negocio con la compra de una compresora que le permita pintar los muebles que confecciona, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Pablo es un joven voluntarioso y emprendedor, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando y equipando su taller para trabajar y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, el es un joven bastante conocido y estimado en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Pablo is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the district of Olmos, which is located in rugged territory where the population lives mainly in rural areas. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and is located 1½ hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Pablo has been in business for more than three years as a metalworker. He currently has his own workshop located in central Olmos. There he makes all types of metal structures such as doors, window frames, tables, and other items. The quality of his work has brought recognition to his business and he has several established customers who always request for his services. This activity is his only source of income, which he uses to pay his personal expenses and support his family financially.

Pablo wants to continue his business by purchasing a compressor that will allow him to paint the furniture he makes. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN to help meet this goal.

Pablo is an enterprising young man who also volunteers. His greatest desire is to continue expanding and equipping his workshop so that he can work to provide his family a better quality of life. He is well-known and respected in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a compressor

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La Señorita Carolina M.,se dedica la fabricación de Bijouteri (aros, cadenas, pulceras y otros adornos, ella  comenta que comenzó esta actividad motivada por una compañera de la facultad la cual le pregunto si quería aprender el oficio y le regalo un video y algunos materiales para practicar, al principio no le dió mucha importancia añade, luego de seis meses de trabajo y dedicación comenzó la comercialización de su propia marca ANAHI BISU.

Cabe destacar la dedicación y creatividad en esta joven micro empresaria, la cual con esfuerzo se esta abriendo camino y ya cuenta con su propio local. El crédito solicitado a la Fundación Paraguaya será destinada a la compra de materiales para el nuevo salón.
texts.en:
Carolina M. works making costume jewelry, such as rings, necklaces, bracelets, etc. She reports that she started this business after being inspired by a fellow student who asked if she would like to learn the trade and gave her a video and some materials to practice with. At the beginning, she adds, she didn't think it would amount to much, but after six months of work and dedication, she began selling her own brand, ANAHI BISU. This young microentrepreneur shows a remarkable amount of dedication and creativity. Through her own efforts, she is making her way forward and now has her own jewelry stand. She will use the loan she is requesting from the Paraguaya Foundation to buy materials for her new stand.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials and tools to expand her business (beads, spangles, rings, clamps, scissors, paint, wires)

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a very vigorous lady who lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been a part of this city for the last twenty-five years. 

She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of them support her in her carpet weaving business. They all complete a carpet in one and half months and then earn approximately $420 to $480 by selling it in the market. This amount helps them to improve the family's standard of living.
 
Naseem is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase the required items (such as threads and tools), so they can complete the carpet which they have started.

loans.use: Purchase required items for carpet weaving business

loans.name: Baktybubu's Group

texts.en: Baktybubu S. is the leader of this group. She is 50 and her husband works in the Ministry of Emergency Situations. They have a fifteen-year-old son who studies at school. Baktybubu works as a nurse in the hospital; she also sells convenience goods and breeds cattle. Seven years ago she obtained a loan of 7,000 soms (approximately 150 USD) and with that money she bought different goods and resold them. In this way she now earns 3,000 soms (approximately 65 USD) per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase consumer goods in order to resell them and make some profit. In the future she wants to increase the number of her cattle. Zhumash T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52 and divorced. Her son is married; he helps Zhumash to sell clothes at the market. Fourteen years ago Zhumash sold vegetables and, with an initial investment of 3,000 soms, she started to sell clothes. In this way she earns 15,700 soms (approximately 340 USD) per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a variety of clothes in order to increase the turnover of her business. Zamirbek S. is 30 and is married. He has three children: the older son studies at school in the 1st class; the other two are too young. Two years ago Zamirbek, with an initial investment of 14,000 soms (approximately 305 USD), bought cattle to raise. After fattening them he sells some cattle to make money. In this way he earns 5,000 soms (approximately 110 USD) per month. He also cultivates fruits and vegetables. Now he wants to obtain a loan to pay for tractor services, to fertilize his land, and to sow potatoes. In autumn he plans to sell potatoes to make money and buy some school clothes for his children. Nasip U. is 58 and is married. She has a daughter and a son; the son is married and lives separately with his family. Nasip and her husband have been breeding, fattening and selling livestock for ten years. They started with an initial investment of 7,000 soms and now they make 4,000 soms (approximately 85 USD) per month. With money received from the loan, Nasip wants to purchase one farm animal to increase the number of her livestock. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods to sell

loans.name: Santos Melania

texts.es:
la señora Santos Melania T. tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, su actividad diaria es atender su pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion,  sus ventas son 
todos los dias con los pobladores de la comunidad, su pulperia esta ubicada en punto estrategico y le va bien.
vive en la comunidad del Moraicito desde hace 40 años.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y refrescos.
se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 1 año, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender otro tipo de productos.

su sueño es tener una pulperia grande para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melania T. is fifty-nine, single and has no dependent children. Her daily life involves tending the small grocery store she has in her house, where she sells to the inhabitants of her community. Her store is strategically located and things are going well for her. She's been living in the Moraicito community for forty years. She plans to use her loan to buy groceries and soft drinks. Melania has been in business for a year; earlier she earned her living selling other types of products. Her dream is to have a large grocery store so she can meet all of her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tortillas, bread, coffee, batteries, rice, sugar, candy, soft drinks, juices, oils, beans, cookies, milk, medicine tablets, light bulbs, flour, soups, and cool aid

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Doña  Isabel es una mujer trabajadora, de 56 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, su trabajo ha sido de domestica para lograr a salir adelante económicamente ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de los niños. 
Tiene dos trabajos.
Medio tiempo trabaja como cocinera, y nace la idea de vender ropa, prendas, para lograr pagar los gastos básicos. Las dificultades que ha tenido es que los clientes le retrasan los pagos, y a veces le cuesta colocar los productos.
Lo bueno es que cuenta con un trabajo fijo, ya que cuando le toca pagar pues ajusta con su salario. Con este financiamiento comprara: una docena de pantalón para caballero, camisas, trajes de niñas, docenas de sandalias para mejorar sus ventas ya que tiene poco para vender, y ha colocado casi todas las mercancías.
Y a veces no logra comprar cuando tiene poco por que no cuenta con dinero en efectivo. Lo que para ella el financiamiento es de gran relevancia por que da la oportunidad de mejorar e invertir al comercio.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is a hardworking woman who is 56 years old and the mother of three children. She works so that her household can get ahead financially since the father of her children does not provide them any support.

Isabel has two jobs. She works part-time as a cook and also sells clothing and jewelry so that she can pay for basic expenses. The difficulties she has encountered occur when customers delay their payments, which prevents her from acquiring more products.

It is a good thing that she has a steady job, so when her customers pay her, it is additional income on top of her regular salary. With this loan she will buy the following: a dozen men’s trousers, shirts, girls’ dresses, and a dozen pairs of sandals to improve her sales since she is low on these items. Almost all of these products have already been ordered.

There are times when she is not able to buy more merchandise because she does not have cash on hand, which is why this loan is of great relevance since it provides her the opportunity to improve and invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, dresses, and sandals

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Sarita.
Vilma es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Vilma junto a su pareja tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende loceria, plastiqueria, utensilios de cocina, para lo cual cuenta con 2 personas para la venta, además reparte por mayor a las tiendas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Vilma solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas.
El sueño de Vilma es tener local propio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Sarita Communal Bank. Vilma is married and has four children. Vilma and her life partner have a store in a rented location where they sell china, plastic goods, and kitchen utensils. They have two people helping with sales. Also, she deals wholesale with the stores. She gets their products in the city of Lima. Vilma is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles to buy pots. Vilma’s dream is to have her own place and that her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots

loans.name: Angela Lastenia

texts.es:
Angela Lastenia B. A., tiene 27 años.  Es soltero  y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos, Jhair (8), Damian (6), Rodrigo (4) y Tatiana (1).

Angela es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Angela se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maíz en ciclo cortó. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas en Fertiza y en el comercial Peña y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz y maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas.
Le gusta jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Angela is 27 years old, single and lives with her children in the village of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. She has four children: Jhair (8), Damian (6), Rodrigo (4) and Tatiana (1). Angela is a member of the "Valle Alto" (High Valley) community bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members total, the majority of whom make a living in agriculture. This is the second loan they have taken out with Kiva partner Cooperativa San José. Angela make a living in agriculture, planting rice and corn in short cycles. She makes her purchases every month in the towns of Ventanas and Peña and makes her sales in the same places. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice and corn. She thinks the loan is an opportunity to make headway. Her dreams are to move forward with her studies. Her crops face challenges like pests. She enjoys playing soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for rice and corn

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Laxmi N.. She is married and has four children aged 15, 18, 21 and 24. In 1990, Laxmi established a kitchen utensils business. Working eight hours a day, seven days a week, she is able to support her family. Laxmi has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Kiva partner, Patan Business and Professional Women, and used her most recent loan to purchase kitchen utensils for her shop. In the future, Laxmi plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
In Nepal, large supermarkets are rare. Instead, most items can be found in the small, densely packed pasals that line the streets of every city and village. Piled high with utensils, paper goods, and anything else one would need, these stores are your one-stop shop in Nepal. Although usually packed into a space no larger than 100 square feet, these stores carry a sizable and diverse inventory. With the help of a Kiva loan, pasal owners are able to keep inventory up and their customers happy. Competition is fierce, but with extra capital and a bit of creativity, the opportunity for profit is there.

About Patan Business and Professional Women
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her shop

loans.name: Annie Marie

texts.en:
Annie Marie T. is 25 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pork products in the local community.  Annie Marie has 2 years of experience in this business.  Annie Marie needs a loan of 1000 talas to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $122 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Annie Marie joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Annie Marie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make cooked foods

loans.name: James Mungai

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and is married to Ruth Njeri, a farmer who contributes to the family's income. They have three children. James runs and manages a butcher shop. He has been in the business for a period of about two years, with a profit of approximately 10,000 a month.

He is taking his first loan with Kadet, which he intends to use to add more stock of meat in order to meet the needs of his customers. He hopes to expand his business with the extra profit he makes.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale to meet the customers' needs.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la  Sra. Yaneth;  La socia tiene  24 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, pollos, La socia compra al por mayor y menor aves de corral y animales menores caseros, ella los cría y engorda, muchas veces se reproducen y luego los vende a las diferentes quintas restaurantes de turismo en la zona. La socia solicita el dinero para implementar su negocio y adquirir mayor número de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de aves de corral y animales menores.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the village bank "Sr. de Tantamarca" [Lord of Tantamarca] located in the district of Chicon in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Yaneth, 24, who is a single mother with one child. The member raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens and young chickens. She buys poultry and small domestic animals, both wholesale and retail, which she cares for and fattens. Often the animals reproduce and then she sells them to the various rural tourist restaurants in the area. The member is requesting the money to set up her business and purchase a larger quantity of small animals. She is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of poultry and small animals. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted by this means and likewise promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fowl and small animals

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
María T. C. se ha destacado como muy buena trabajadora en un centro de labores del departamento de León y ha sido catalogada como una dama muy responsable y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito porque anhela mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que está en malas condiciones y requiere comprar el zinc para iniciar con dicha obra. Espera que el crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera llevar a cabo su obra que tanto ha anhelado y así beneficiará a su familia.
texts.en:
María Elsa T. C. lives in Santa Rosa Del Peñón municipality, León department, one and a half blocks east of the Health Center.  She has a life partner.  She currently is employed by the Ministry of Health in Santa Rosa Del Peñón as a Hygiene and Epidemiology Technician.  She has been working for this institution for four years.

She owns her house that she wants to make improvements to.

The loan will be used to buy zinc metal sheeting to repair the roof.  This will make it possible to improve living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to repair her roof.

loans.name: Wilber Javier

texts.es: Wilber Javier tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Pues busca la forma de mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Su actividad es una pulpería, que inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar sus diferentes productos inicio por una herencia de su abuelo y quería sacar adelante este negocio que sería la fuente de ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus 2 hijos y mantener esta actividad. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilber Javier has worked with the Fundación for a long time.  He has worked in this business for over seven years.  He looks for the way to improve the family income.  He has a grocery store.  He starts at seven in the morning and works until ten at night.

Most of his customers come to the store to look for his different products.  He started with an inheritance from his grandfather.  He wanted to get this business ahead as it would be the needed source of income to support his two children and stay in the business.

The loan will be used to buy supplies for his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis de 32 años de edad es soltero, pero vive en union libre con la mamá de niño de 5 años de edad que asiste al pre-escolar, trabaja como conductor en el MINSA del Rama desde hace 10 años.

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo credito con el objetivo  de comprar un solar para poder construir su propia vivienda, y de esta manera poder brindarle estabilidad y comodidad a su familia. Cabe mencionar que con el credito anterior logro acondicionar el cuarto donde habita con su familia en casa de su mamá. 

El mayor sueño de Jose Luis es poder tener un lugar con el cual pueda estar junto a su familia con las condiciones basicas y que su hijo crezca en un ambiente alegre.
texts.en:
32-year old Jose Luis is not married but lives in a common-law relationship with the mother of his 5-year old son who attends pre-school. Jose Luis has worked as a driver for the MINSA del Rama for 10 years. 

He is seeking a seventh loan to buy a plot of land so he can build a home there and be able to provide his family with stability and a comfortable home. It should be noted that with his previous loan, Jose Luis managed to greatly improve the room in his mother’s house where he and his family were living.

His dream is to have a simple home where he can be with his family and raise his son in a nice environment.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, elabora embutidos (chorizo de carne de res, carne de chancho y carne de pollo).
Es soltero y no tiene hijos.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de carne, tripa, y condimentos) para mejorar la cantidad de producción y sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, requiere el apoyo ya que cuenta con poco capital de trabajo dándole la oportunidad de mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Ronald lives in Obrajes district, in the city of La Paz.  He makes sausages (beef, pork and chicken chorizos).  He is single and doesn't have any children

This loan will be used as working capital (to buy meat, sausage casings and seasonings) to improve the quantity of sausages he makes and his income.

This is the first time that Ronald has requested a loan from Impro.  He needs the support since he doesn't have much working capital and this will give him the opportunity to improve his production.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken, sausage casings and seasonings for his sausage-making business

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
34-year-old Guillerma C. is from the town of Sto. Niño.  Guillerma is a farmer and plants rice crops.  She sells her harvest to the market and sometimes gives some portion to her family.  Guillerma works hard to improve her business.  She hopes to save for her future and be able to continue helping her family grow this business.

Guillerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Bilal

texts.ar:
بلال في عمر 38 سنة يعمل في مجال النقل العام لديه سيارة اجرة يعمل عليها اكثر من 13 سنة متزوج وله ولدان 
يحب عائلته ويسعى دائما الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الدائم من عائلته
ومحيطه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء محرك جديد لسيارته فهي مصدر الرزق الوحيد له ولعائلته زبائنه
هم من محيطه وجيرانه ويعتمد على المواسم السياحية ليزيد من زبائنه
texts.en: Bilal, 38, is married with two children. He has been driving his own cab for 13 years. Bilal loves his family and always seeks to improve its social and economic conditions. He has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. Bilal always enjoys the support of his family and other people who know him.  Bilal wishes to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new engine for his cab, the only source of income for him and his family. Bilal's clients include his neighbours and other people who know him. He depends on tourism seasons to increase his number of clients.

loans.use: Buy a new engine for his cab

loans.name: Alejandrina Pilar

texts.es: Alejandrina Pilar
texts.en:
Alejandrina Pilar Alvarez A. is 48 years old, she is single and she lives with her children in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 2 children. 

The communal bank named "High Plains" is located in the neighborhood of Voluntad de Dios, in Ventanas. The members of this group are short-term agriculturists who plant corn and rice. 

Alejandrina is an agriculturist who plants corn and rice. She purchases her products in Ventanas, in the Pena shopping district, and she resells from her home or in the market in Ventanas every day.

She requests a loan to purchase corn, products and seeds. With the help of this loan she will be able to financially meet all of her needs, and to face the difficult challenges presented by plagues, illness, and the changing weather. Her dream is to have her own fields to work in.

She enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: To purchase products and seeds.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. Topista has a small retail shop, which she has run for one year. She has a second business selling food.
To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Topista hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a boutique and a wholesale shop.
Topista is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to dance and use a computer.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and food for resale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 37 سنة متزوج وله لدان يعمل في دهان الموبيليا له في عمله 23 سنة يحب عمله ويريد دائما التطور فيه له حب للتطور والتجدد في العمل يتطور نفسه دائما لكن يعيقه المادة احيانا يلقى الدعم دائما من عائلته ومحيطه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كومبروسور هواء + صاروخ للخشب + مواد دهان لكي يتطور من المعدات التي تزيد من مدخول عمله
texts.en: Mohamad is 37 years old and married with two children. He has been working in furniture refinishing for the past 23 years. He is very driven to develop himself and his business, but because he is struggling to obtain enough capital to do this, he was interested in asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase an air compressor, a power saw, and varnish.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor, power saw, and varnish

loans.name: Cesar Geovanny

texts.es:
Cesar de 26 años, tiene un negocio de venta y arreglo de colchones. Desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron arreglar colchones para que tenga una actividad económica diferente. 

El comenzó con la venta y arreglo de colchones para tener ingresos. Vende los colchones mensualmente ya que el los hace artesanalmente. Vende los colchones al por mayor y menor. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar esta actividad comprando con el préstamo telas, espuma, lana para la fabricación de colchones.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 26, sells and repairs mattresses for a living. Ever since he was young, his parents showed him how to fix mattresses so that he can have a unique business.

He started selling and repairing mattresses to obtain an income. He only sells mattresses on a monthly basis because he makes them by hand. He sells them wholesale and retail. He has lots of aspirations regarding his business, which is why he wants to continue it by purchasing fabric, mattress foam, and wool for mattress production.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, foam, and wool

loans.name: Francisca Mariana

texts.es:
Francisca Mariana B. tiene 56 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Francisca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es trabajar para tener dinero y construir la casa.

Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Francisca Mariana B. is 56 years old.  She lives in Unión Libre of the Bolivar province with her partner and her children.  She has 6 children.

The members of V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO live nearby in the town of el Calzado, Cantón San Miguel; these 12 farmers grow corn, potatoes, beans and raise domestic animals.

Francisca makes a living from farming, she grows corn, potatoes and beans and raises animals.  She buys her products at the San Miguel market every week and sells her production at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds for her crops and feed for her animals.  The loan will help her cover her expenses, and be able to meet the challenges such as pests, diseases and the varied climate.  Her dream is to work and have money to build a house.

She likes to clean her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her crops and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Denny Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa de 30 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabajo ella empezó por medio de una amiga a vende productos de belleza por catálogo ya que pasaba por crisis económica y quería sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella trabaja sola y su horario es variable. Se pasa haciendo llamadas para coordinar con los pedidos de sus clientes y a la vez va a visitarlo para cobrar sus productos que lo deja a créditos.

Con el préstamo ella quiere aumentar más su productividad y comprarles uniformes a sus hijos. En un futuro quiere que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Teresa is 30 years old.  She is a woman who is inspiring in her work.  When she was going through a financial crisis and needed a way to keep her family afloat, a friend helped her to start selling beauty products through catalog orders.

She works alone and her work schedule varies.  She makes calls to coordinate her cusotmers' orders and goes to see them to collect on the products that she sells on credit.

With this loan, Teresa wants to increase her productivity and purchase school uniforms for her children.  In the future, she wants her business to keep growing and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business and school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Maria Fanny

texts.es: María tiene 30 años y es casada. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y 3 hijos en el caserío Casablanca, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Allí vende una variedad de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Vende sus productos al contado y al crédito. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela fidelizada. También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella vende quincenalmente los animales que han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso. Solicita un crédito para la compra de más abarrotes para surtir su bodega y alimento para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar su segundo préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). María solicitó su primer crédito de Edpyme Alternativa y demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and she is married. She lives in a house that she owns together with her husband and their three children in the community of Casablanca. It is located 15 minutes from the city of Morrope in Peru's north. She sells groceries from a convenience store installed in her home. She sells a variety of basic needs products and grocery items. She completes her sales in cash and credit. She is very well known in the area and she has a loyal client base. She also raises foul, such as ducks, turkeys, and poultry in the rear part of her house. She sells the livestock bi-weekly when they have reached a good size and weight. She requests a loan to purchase more groceries to stock her convenience store and to buy feed for her livestock. For this reason, Maria has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she demonstrated responsibility with her payments on her first loan.

loans.use: to supply her convenience store with groceries and to purchase balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Sokoroti Ole

texts.en:
Sokoroti Ole M., from Narok, Kenya, is 45 years old, married, and supports ten people in the family. He has been farming for the last 15 years.

Sokoroti first learned of KADET LTD through other registered clients in his area. This will be his fourth loan from KADET, and he intends to spend the loan to prepare the land for planting. He plans to reinvest the profit generated into the farm and dreams of being a big farmer. Sokoroti believes he can do more if provided with the necessary resources.

loans.use: to cultivate the land for next planting season.

loans.name: Bonanza (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bonanza esta formado por 7 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, mujeres alegres y carismáticas que se dedican a diferentes actividades para mejorar  económicamente y así salir adelante con  sus familias. Nuestras socias viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza de sus calles y de su centro histórico el mismo que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Mayra vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 27 años, es  casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está en la escuela y el segundo en el prekinder. Su esposo es de profesión militar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Mayra hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, la misma que vende recorriendo  la ciudad, todos los días de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, etc. para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es construir su casa propia.

En la foto nos acompaña una niña que es hija de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Bonanza" is made up of 7 women who are friends and neighbors. They are happy and charismatic women who carry out different business activities to improve financially and to move forward with their families. The members live in different locations in the city of Cuenca. The city is characterized by the beauty of its avenues and by its historical center. It is a mix between colonial and modern and the population retain their culture and traditions.

Mayra S. lives in the downtown area of the city of Cuenca. She is 27 years old, married, and she has 3 children, aged 7, 4, and 2. Her eldest child is in school and the middle child is in preschool. Her husband is a military professional. They don't own a house so they rent where they live.

Mayra has been selling clothing for the past 4 years, traveling throughout the city every day, from Sunday to Sunday, although she does not have a fixed schedule.

She is on her fifth loan with her communal bank and this new loan will be invested in the purchase of pants, t-shirts, blouses, kids' clothing, etc., to make her business grow. 

Her goal is to build a house of her own. 

In the photograph she is accompanied by the daughter of one of the other members.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old and married with 5 children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF.  This loan will help her buy additional items like sardines, groceries, etc to sell in her Sari-sari store.

Emily has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 21 years, and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Emily aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica makes a living by producing and selling palm oil. She also has a side business selling fish and has completed a senior high school level of education. She is divorced and the sole means of support for six dependents. She has wanted to expand her business for years and is applying for this loan from Kiva to buy more palm fruit to turn into oil. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her business and to try to set money aside for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to process into oil for sale.

loans.name: Thembalethu Group

texts.en:
Bongiwe is 29 years old and single with four children between 2 and 11 years old. Three of her children attend school. To provide income for her family, she sells clothes and food to her neighbors. She also receives income through a government child support grant. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy more clothes and food for her store. She has been doing this business for one year and says that the biggest challenge that her business faces is that her clients do not pay on time. 

With the extra income, she hopes to expand her store to a bigger location.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and food to sell

loans.name: Lydie Blandine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 40 ans , mariee et mere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 a 13 ans.Apres son Bac , n'ayant pas pu faire des etudes universitaires, elle se lance dans le commerce des pagnes de qualite qu'elle achete chez les grossistes ou alors a kinshasa, elle a une forte clientele surtout les femmes qui sont dans des mutuelles, ses ventes sont de 30.000 frs a 120.000frs par jour.

avec le pret octroye, elle va renforcer son stock en achetant 10 lots de qualiwax, 10 lots de super wax, 10 lots de pagnes real, 12 lots de pagnes Guaranteed super wax.

Elle epargne beaucoup et avec ses benefices , elle veut ouvrir une boutique de pagne de tous genres et se faire grossiste et aussi aller chine et cotonou pour s'approvisionner .
texts.en: Lydie Blandine is 40 years old, married and the mother of four children, aged 4 to 13. She finished secondary school, but was unable to attend university. She began selling high-quality pagnes (colorful West African cloths) that she buys from wholesalers or in Kinshasa. She has many customers, especially women working in mutual benefit societies. She has a turnover of 30,000 to 120,000 CFA francs per day. When her loan is granted, she will use it to increase her inventory. She will buy 10 lots of "qualiwax" pagnes, 10 lots of "superwax" pagnes, 10 lots of "real" pagnes and 12 lots of "guaranteed superwax" pagnes. She saves a lot of money and, thanks to her profit, she wants to open a boutique and sell pagnes of all kinds. She wants to become a wholesaler and also travel to China and to Cotonou to buy additional inventory.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, namely 10 lots of qualiwax pagnes, 10 lots of superwax pagnes, 10 lots of real pagnes and 12 lots of guaranteed superwax pagnes.

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es:
A sus 55 años de edad Alberto Alonso se considera un microempresario luchador que desde muy joven ha trabajado para sacar sus 5 hijos adelante, ya que sus condiciones económicas no han sido las mejores, es un soñador que vive con la ilusión de brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro. Trabajó arduamente durante 25 años en una finca ubicada en el municipio de Andes en el departamento de Antioquia, pero después de tantos años sus labores en la finca se acabaron y por su propia iniciativa decidió emprender con un nuevo negocio en Sabaneta que esta también un municipio de Antioquia, allí vende aguacates y la lotería, diariamente se pone metas para ir cumpliendo con las ventas propuestas, para así tener una mejor calidad de vida.

De la misma manera, Alberto sueña con poder incrementar las utilidades y sabe que para ello debe tener mayor capital de trabajo para comprar en grandes cantidades y así obtener un descuento en la compra y ganancias en la venta, pero el actualmente no cuenta con este capital, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a ir cumpliendo paso a paso sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
At the age of 55, Alberto Alonso is a hard-working microbusinessman who has worked very hard from a young age to get his five children ahead, since his economic conditions have not been the best. He is a dreamer who lives with the hope of offering his family a better future. He worked hard for 25 years on a farm in the Andes municipality, in the department of Antioquia. After such a long time his work on the farm ran out and he decided to start a new business on his own initiative. He started his business in Sabaneta, which is also a municipality of Antioquia. There he sells avocados and lottery tickets. He sets goals daily to meet his sales, in order to have a better quality of life.

Alberto dreams of being able to increase his profits, and he knows that in order to do so he needs to have more working capital to purchase in large quantities. This will mean a discount in his purchases and higher earnings. However, at the moment he does not have this capital. For this reason he is requesting a loan which will allow him to fulfill his goals and dreams step by step.

loans.use: to have working capital to purchase stock and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un nieto de 7 años de edad, él se dedica a fabricar calzado, tiene muchos años de estar dedicado al taller de calzado y su hermano fue quien le enseño, su horario es de 7:00am a 5:00pm para atender la demanda.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de maquinas para fabricar el calzado, esta será una gran inversión, ya que con maquinar nuevas estará fortaleciendo el taller y dará un mejor servicio. 
Su objetivo es dar un buen mantenimiento al taller, fortaleciéndolo y trabajando con mucho empeño y esfuerzo, pues su deseo de superarse junto a su familia le motiva.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and 7-year-old grandson.  He manufactures shoes.  He’s been working in his shoe shop for many years; it was his brother who taught him.  His work schedule is 7am to 5pm to meet demand.

He is asking for the loan to buy machines to manufacture shoes.  This will be a great investment because new machines will mean a stronger workshop and better service.

His goal is to have a well-maintained shop; to strengthen it by working very hard and with much dedication for he’s motivated by his wish to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy shoe making machinery.

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en:
Sinan (in the photo) is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. They live in a village fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They just have a yO. daughter. 

Sinan is applying for her second loan in the amount of US$ 500 in order to build a concrete  foundation for her house.

loans.use: To build a concrete foundation for her house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Teresa has a food shop where she sells home-made sausages like chorizo and longaniza. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.

Teresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Hog raising is Rodel's primary source of income. By raising hogs, he usually gains a profit of PHP 2,000 for each hog disposed. Income generated from the business goes for daily meals and allowances for his children. Other parts of the income are used as revolving capital to keep maintaining the business. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy medicines and vitamins for his hogs. With the help of the vitamins and medicines, he can ensure that they will acquire proper growth and good nutrition. 

In the future, he would like to strengthen his hog raising business for the education of his children. He also would like to establish a larger pig pen for his hogs.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 49 years old and married to Kenneth, a farmer. Together they are blessed with two children. Her primary business is farming. She has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 9,000.

She is applying for her 1st loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig farming and continue with farming which will help her improve the living standard of her family

loans.use: To buy farm manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 43 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.

Maria es propietaria D. una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad desD. hace diez años. Ella vio la necesidad que existía en su comunidad D. adquirir estos productos, por que solo había dos tiendas y la demanda era mucha. Ella antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios D. su casa.

Ella viaja cada ocho días a comprar la mercadería. Ella camina media hora hasta el lugar donD. aborda un autobús, el viaje dura una hora hasta llegar a la ciudad donD. compra los productos para su tienda.

La señora Maria esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más productos y surtir su tienda con arroz, maíz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite D. cocina, etc. En su comunidad hay bastante demanda debido a que queda lejos D. la ciudad. Por este motivo ella también sale a vender D. casa en casa a ofrecer sus productos. Con el préstamo ella podrá tener surtida su tienda lo que le generará mayores ingresos, ya que la tienda es rentable.

Con los ingresos obtenidos, la señora Maria podrá darles una educación a sus hijos, ya que desea brindarles la oportunidad que ella no tubo.
texts.en:
María is 43, and lives with her husband and their four children.  For ten years, María has been the owner of a store selling basic household necessities. 

She saw that there was a need for these products in her community, because there were only two stores, and the demand was great. Previously she only worked doing household chores. 

She travels once a week to buy merchandise. She walks for half an hour to the place where she catches a bus. The trip lasts an hour until she arrives in the city, where she buys products for her store. 

María is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy more products and to stock her store with corn, sugar, beans, cooking oil, etc. There is quite a lot of demand in her community due to the fact that it is a long way from the city. For this reason, she also goes from door to door to sell her products. 

With the loan she will be able to keep her store stocked, which will generate more income, since the store is profitable. With the income she earns, María will be able to proviD. an education to her children, as she wants to offer them the opportunity she never had.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Aurora Celia

texts.es:
Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene 8  hijos independientes.  Solo estudió la primaria (incompleta).
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de una arroba de papa, camote, occa (tubérculo) y un bolsa de gelatina, la señora vende estos productos por algunos mercados de la zona.
 La señora desea seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the Bellavista communal bank, which is in the Puno district, Puno province and department.  She is 63 years old, separated, and has eight independent children.  She only attended elementary school, and she did not complete it.

She is a new member who recently joined to work with the Moviento Manuela Ramos.  She will request a loan for 500 soles to buy an “arroba” (24-36 pounds) of potatoes, sweet potatoes, “occa” (a tuber), and a bag of gelatin.  She sells these products at some of the markets in the area.

She wishes to continue with her business and improve her income.

What she likes about the communal bank are the easy terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy an “arroba” (24-36 pounds) of potatoes, sweet potatoes, “occa” (a tuber), and a bag of gelatin.

loans.name: Fifa Etoile Group

texts.fr: FIFA ETOILE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Agnès (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Crépin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Agnès n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis six ans, Agnès vend du maïs, du charbon de bois et des fruits dans son quartier. Agnès achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Agnès et les autres membres du groupe FIFA ETOILE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
FIFA ETOILE is a group of three persons who all live in the same district. The representative of the group, Agnès (who is raising her hand in the photo), is is 33 and married to a small-scale retailer by the name of Crépin. The couple has two children, both enrolled in school and under their care. Agnès lives together with her husband and her children. The couple share in supporting their family. 

Agnès did not attend school. For six years, Agnès has been selling maize, charcoal, and fruit in her neighborhood. She buys her merchandise in Bénin. It is the second time that Agnès and the other members of the group called FIFA ETOILE are requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to grow their working capital and better respond to the needs of their clientele.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sacks of charcoal, and maize.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en: Michel is a 46-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and a sibling. He has been working as a van driver transporting students. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 20 years. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to perform the needed maintenance on his van in order to secure its features, especially since he is transporting students of different ages and must be careful with his moves. In the future, he plans to start a new business which consists in organizing trips all over the country.

loans.use: To perform the needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Mukhran

texts.en:
Mukhran, 32, lives with his retired parents in the village of Gomi, in West Georgia, where he conducts the family's farming activities. They own three milk cows from which his mother produces and sells an average of 40 kg of cheese per month. On the family-owned 2-hectare plot of land, Mukhran grows maize, about 60% of which is sold, while the remainder is used to feed the cows. Mukhran also owns an old tractor with which he does seasonal agricultural work, earning about 200 Laris per month in tilling seasons. The family's total average monthly income is 510 Laris, including his parents’ pensions

Mukhran is now requesting a loan to purchase new wheels for his tractor. As soon as he replaces the old wheels, he will be able to reengage in his work. He plans to save earned income to purchase furniture for the house, as the family currently has very little.

loans.use: to purchase wheels for his tractor.

loans.name: Jeejan's Group

texts.en:
Jeejan is a 54-year-old responsible and kind woman. She operates a thread selling business. She gets thread from the used warm clothing and sells to different thread sellers in the market for profit.  She is very experienced in her work and has been doing it for many years. She does this work to help her husband financially as he is a factory worker on meager income.
 
Jeejan is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. All of her sons are involved in different work while her daughter stays at home and manages the household work.
 
Jeejan is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her thread selling business. She intends to use this loan to purchase used warm clothing in bulk to be able to get thread in large quantity for selling.  She is hopeful that her business will generate more revenue after this loan investment. 

In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jeejan.

loans.use: buy warm clothes to extract thread to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Three of her children are employed at the garment factory. Vannak, requests a loan of 625 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to grow vegetables to sell at the market, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, administra un taller de mecánica automotriz, vive con su esposa y su hijo de trece años de edad, la casa es propia, desde hace 15 está dedicado al taller, del cual ha logrado cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo y algunos repuestos para mantener el taller en buenas condiciones, mejorando la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Francisco es mejorar la atención a los clientes en el taller, también en su familia poder brindarles lo necesario.
texts.en:
Francisco runs an auto mechanic shop.  He lives with his wife and his 13 year old son in a home that he owns.  He has had the business for 15 years and has been able to meet his family's needs.  He is requesting a loan to purchase work tools and some replacement parts to keep the shop in good shape, thus providing better service to his customers. 

Francisco's goal is to provide better customer service at the shop and to provide his family with what they need.

loans.use: to purchase tools and replacement parts for his shop.

loans.name: Astria

texts.es: Astria de 47 años, esta casada con Seferino de 47 años de edad y tienen 08 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicado en el distrito de Kimbiri. Astria es campesina y cuenta con un terreno cultivado con plantas de café y cacao. Viene trabajando 21 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos.
