Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao y café. Su dificultad es; no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de cacao y café ya que cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno no cultivado. Este será su crédito numero 08 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar plantas de cacao y café para incrementar en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Astria, 47, is married to Seferino, 47, and they have eight children.  They live in their own house in the district of Kimbiri.  Astria is a farmer and has land where she grows coffee and cocoa.  For 21 years she has worked on her own land, and at harvest time she has the support of her children and hired workers so she can collect the crop more quickly.  

What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting the fruits because she feels all the months of hard work have their compensation in the quality of the crop.  She feels the most difficult part is transporting the products from the land to the wholesale center in the city of San Francisco, where they pay the best prices for her cocoa and coffee beans.  Another difficulty is not having sufficient income to pay the workers in advance for their support at harvest time.  So she depends on loans through the MFP institution.  Her top priority now is to plant more cocoa and coffee on her 2 hectares of uncultivated land.  This is her eighth loan through MFP.  She feels the loan is very helpful in getting ahead in her work.  She is a very beloved member of her communal bank.  With the 1,000 PEN loan she plans to buy cocoa and coffee plans to increase her cropland.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and coffee plants.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is married and has four children. Perla is 4 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Perla sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 14,000 to pay for additional sacks of rice.

Perla has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Perla hopes to have enough savings for additional capital for her business.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of rice.

loans.name: Fabiola Maribel

texts.en:
Fabiola is a very friendly and responsible person. She has 3 daughters for whom she works very hard every day. However, her daughters are the most important part in Fabiola\'s life, which is why she wants to offer them a good education and a better quality of life. She started her business 2 years ago and it has allowed her to cover all her beautiful daughters\' needs. Fabiola sells shoes through catalogues and her sales have gone up in the last few months.

She needs a $425 USD loan to purchase merchandise; she is hoping for sales to double up during this Christmas season, and to return the loan within 5 months. She and her family are in wait for your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Fabiola es una persona amigable y muy responsable, tiene 3 hijas por las que todos los días tiene que trabajar muy duro. Sin embargo, para Fabiola sus hijas son la parte más importante D. su vida por lo que desea ofrecerles una buena educación y una mejor calidad D. vida. Inició su negocio hace 2 años y éste le ha permitido cubrir con las necesidades D. sus hermosas hijas. Fabiola trabaja en la venta D. zapatos por pedido y sus ventas se han incrementado en los últimos meses.

Ella necesita un préstamo D. $425 USD para comprar mercancía, porque espera que esta próxima temporada naviD.ña sus ventas se incrementen al doble, y en un término D. 5 meses Fabiola espera regresar el préstamo. Ella y su familia esperan tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: 45 year old Mrs. Nkechi F. E. learned the trade of selling paint for 2 years before she started her own business in the year 1999. She is married with eight children and living in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She will use the loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and has six children, the youngest 12. He has had to work since he was very young to support his family and was unable to attend school. Now he would like his own children to have the education and opportunities he didn't. He started working helping his father with his fruit stand, then got a job in a workshop, but the pay was very low so to support his family he began selling corn-on-the-cob and other snacks. While he is fortunate to have good sales, he would like to increase the products he offers, so he is asking for a loan of $200 to buy supplies. You can help improve the quality of life of this family. They need your support so please do not hesitate. Francisco and his family appreciate your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene seis hijos, de los cuales el menor es de 12 años de edad. Francisco desde muy pequeño se dedica a las ventas por la necesidad económica de su familia, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y desea que sus hijos si puedan concluir sus estudios para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Empezó ayudándole a su padre con la venta frutas, después trabajó en un taller pero el salario era muy bajo e insuficiente para el sustento de su familia, por lo que abandonó su empleo y compró un triciclo que acondicionó para la venta de elotes y frituras.

Afortunadamente Francisco recibe un buen ingreso de sus ventas, pero desea incrementar la cantidad de productos de vende, para lo que necesita de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía e insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos. Ahora puedes mejorar la vida de Francisco y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu apoyo y agradecen tu generosidad, no lo dudes más y decídete a ayudarlos.

loans.use: To buy supplies of food for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoe selling business

loans.name: Humay

texts.en: Humay is an internally displaced person who fled from the Zangilan district of Azerbaijan in 1993. He is 52 and married with two children. He started his business in 1996 with some private capital in the Lokbatan market. He first borrowed $1,000 from Normicro and increased his business turnover. This loan helped him to improve his business and family living conditions dramatically. He paid off all borrowed goods and earned some additional income to further enlarge his business. Now he is applying for $1,100 to invest in his business to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Lole

texts.en: Lole is a 35-year-old businesswoman with five kids. She’s been operating her business for about four years, but she just joined SPBD’s loan program last year. Her $300USD loan was all used to buy inventory for the shop consisting of mostly junk foods, freezer foods and daily need items. Her shop is open seven days per week and she earns 230 Tala ($92 US) net profit per day. She said that  her business helps meet the family's daily needs as well as helping with her children's school tuition.. She has to work very hard in her business since it is the only source of income she is getting now. She wishes to receive another loan to extend the room she sells her stock and add additional stock .  The loan program is the only financial support she has.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth E. is 32 years old, and is married with 4 children. She lives in Ehakpen, Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells tin tomatoes and drinks. She has been in business for 2 years now. She is seeking the loan to buy drinks for sale and more tin tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and tin tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
The lady Josefina lives on Nicolas Palma Street in the San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and must support her children. She has a newsstand in España plaza in the Sopacachi zone where she sells candies, crackers, etc. She has been doing this activity for 15 years and this is her only means of subsistence. The loan that she requests is to install a telephone booth, since the location is very commercial and thus to be able to improve her income. Her previous credit history is good, and one can agree to a new loan, as she has already had a loan through Kiva and the repayment went very well.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Josefina vive en la calle Nicolás Palma de la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es mujer separada y mantiene a sus hijos, tiene un Kiosco en la plaza España de la zona de sopocachi donde vende dulces, galletas, etc. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años y es su único medio de subsistencia. El crédito que solicita es para instalar un punto de teléfono (una cabina telefónica) ya que el lugar es muy comercial y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya era parte de Kiva y pago muy bien.

loans.use: to install a telephone booth in order to improve her income.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: L. Stephen is a fisherman who has been fishing ever since he was young. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. Stephen uses his small timber boat for fishing, and it has proved to be a challenge, considering the amount of fish he usually catches (on average, 30 to 40 a day). Stephen has been a client of the loan organization for over two and a half years, and is now asking for a loan to be able to buy a much bigger boat and more fishing nets.

loans.use: Purchase of a large boat and nets for fishing

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 34 years old and is widow with 2 children, ages 15 and 8 years old. Christina owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Salelologa A Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
While SaleL., the capital village of Savaii Island, is largely semi-urbanized, its outlying areas are still agricultural. The SaleL. A Centre is located in a largely agricultural area and the people in the community still subsist on farming and vegetable gardening. For this group, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Betty A. (42, married, 6 children) works in the sewing business. With her loan, she will purchase a sewing machine, material and thread to produce puletasis (dresses), T-shirts and uniforms.

Legalo T. (28, married, 2 children) sells pancakes (round lumps of fried bread) twice a week. Her mother taught her to cook and her business is successful due to good taste, good service and lower prices. With her loan, she will purchase a bag of flour, a fryer, oil, sugar, baking soda and a mixing spoon.

Mina P L. (56, married, 7 children) also sells pancakes and ice cakes (ice cream) three times a week. She will use her loan to purchase a bag of flour, sugar, bucket of oil, a stove, a big bowl and a frying pan.

Miriama O. (63, married, 5 children) sells both food and clothing. Her daughter does the sewing. Her loan will allow her to purchase both cooking ingredients and sewing materials. She expects to earn a cash flow of 260 Tala (~104 USD) per week.

Sarai Aliitasi M. (67, married, 8 children) sells cigarettes twice a week. Her loan will allow her to purchase 250 cigarettes and 50 plastic bags.

Valelei S. (64, married, 10 children) sells BBQ chicken, sauce and lamb chops. Her loan will be used to purchase oil, soy sauce, plastic plates and other materials for her business.

loans.use: Purchase a fryer, oil, sugar, baking soda, etc….

loans.name: Lucrécia Paulo

texts.pt:
Lucrecia Paulo N. was born in Inhambane. She is single, 46 years old, has 4 sons, and finished the 6th grade. She grew up with her parents and siblings, went to school, and in her free time helped with household chores. She also had the privilege of learning to be a seamstress from her aunt, which enabled her to make clothing articles to order as way of helping her family. In the 1980s Lucrecia married and moved to the neighborhood of Benfica in Maputo. Years later she and her husband separated, and she and two of her sons moved to the 25 de Junho neighborhood.

In 1992, Lucrecia took on work as a seamstress in a boutique. In 2001 she moved to Khongolote to a lot loaned by her brother, where for the last seven years she has run a shop selling a range of products. The shop opens at 8:00 a.m. and closes at 9:30 p.m. Products are purchased in Maputo, and Lucrecia rents a car to transport the goods.

Lucrecia learned about Hluvuku through a client at her shop. With her loan of 16,000 MT she intends to purchase rice, sugar, wheat flour, corn flour, oil, drinks, and soft drinks. She currently employs one worker who helps in her absence and on busy days. The most productive periods are the summer months, the weekends, and the ends of the months. Her daily revenue is 1,500 MT, and the products that generate the most profit are drinks and soft drinks. Lucrecia keeps a record book of products coming in and going out, as well as existing stock. The monthly profit margin is 6,000 MT, which she uses to support her family, build her house, and increase business.

Lucrecia is very happy with her loan because it helped her increase her business and improve the appearance of her shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucrécia Paulo N., solteira maior de 46 anos de idade, nasceu na Cidade de Inhambane tem 4 filhos todos rapazes, estudou até 6ªclasse.

Viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos, estudava e nos tempos livres ajudava nos trabalhos domésticos e também teve previlégio de aprender corte e custura com a tia e isto permitiu que ela fizesse artigos por encomendas para venda como forma de ajuda á família.

Na década 80 casa-se e passa a viver na cidade de Maputo no bairro Benfica e anos mais tarde separa-se do marido e dois filhos passam a residir no bairro 25 de Junho, começa a trabalhar como custureira numa Boutique na Cidade isto no ano 1992 e trabalhou durante 3 anos.

Em 2001 transfere-se e reside em Khongolote no terreno cedido pelo irmão onde tem o estabelecimento comercial onde vende uma gama diversificada de produtos e faz este trabalho a sensivelmente 7 anos.

Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através dum cliente de seu estabelecimento e abre-o as 8:00horas e encerra as 21:30mn e compra os produtos em Maputo e aluga carro para transportá-los.

Com o presente crédito de 16.000MT pretende comprar Arroz, açúcar, farrinha de trigo e milho, óleo, bebidas e refrigerantes.

Emprega actualmente 1 trabalhadora que lhe auxilia na sua ausência e quando há muita clientela.

A época mais produtiva é a de Verão e aos fins de semana e final do més pois a procura é maior a receita diária é 1.500MT, os produtos que dão maior lucro são bebidas, refrigerantes.Tem livro de registo de entradas e saídas de produtos bem como do stock existente.

A margem de lucro mensal é de 6.000MT e com os rendimentos sustenta a família, construir sua residência e aumentar volume de negócio.

A cliente está bastante feliz com empréstimo pois ajudou a aumentar volume do negócio e melhorar as condições da mercearia como forma de dar um aspecto diferente aos clientes.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele P., 46, is married with 9 children.  She has many years of experience in the bananas, taro, taamu and yams business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Mele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Also, she will use the loan for buying timbers, iron roofs and cement for home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S., 40, and his wife, Mrs. San Moe, 56, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 1989 and have two children who are in school.

Mr. Heng has been a carpenter in a factory for 17 years, while Mrs. San has been a garment factory worker for nine years. Currently the couple is in the process of building their house, and Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to aid in that construction and make a drain pipe for the house.

loans.use: To help build his house and make a drain pipe.

loans.name: Luz Soledad

texts.es:
Luz Soledad, 40 years old, is the single mother of 3 children, two already independent. The third, a student, is the reason for her to keep moving ahead in her business, to provide for his needs and to have a quiet life.

She has sold chicken from a stand in the market for 6 years. Soledad, as she is known, begins very early and takes care of her daily duties until everything has been sold. Because she started this work alone, her success in getting ahead to where she is now is thanks to her brothers who always support her, above all in her time of greatest need. Soledad works hard to cover the daily expenses of her home as well as her son's education, whom she loves very much.

She needs a loan for expanding and running her business, in order to give a better service to her clients. Your help will make this working mother's goals possible.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Luz Soledad, de 40 años es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes, quedando el último estudiando y es la razón de seguir adelante en su trabajo, para darle lo que necesita y tener una vida tranquila. Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado desde hace ya mucho tiempo (6 años). Soledad como todos la conocen, se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus actividades diarias, hasta cuando se le acabe todo el producto que tiene por vender. Empezó en este trabajo, a razón de quedarse sola, sus ganas de salir adelante y llegar hasta donde está, es gracias a sus hermanos quienes siempre la apoyan, sobre todo en el momento de mayor necesidad Soledad trabaja duro para solventar los gastos diarios de su casa, así como también para lo estudios de su hijo a quien ama mucho. Requiere de un préstamo para la ampliación e implementación de su negocio y desde luego dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda, harás posible el objetivo de esta madre trabajadora.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of her chicken sales stall.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo B. is a 41-year-old man. He is married with four children who are currently in school. He trades in agro-chemicals and sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to the local farmers. Goaso, a town where Kwadwo lives with his family, is a farming community and because of that, many local farmers patronize his shop and buy his products because of the current farming season where most farmers are actively preparing their farmlands.

With the loan, Kwadwo wants to purchase more supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines to serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to pay for his kids' education. He would be very appreciative of your assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides and spraying machines

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. owns a successful business selling lubricants like engine oil, power steering fluid and brake hydraulic fluid. She is requesting a loan amount of $450 to buy more Hydraulic lubricant for sale. She hopes to buy the lubricant in large quantities to sell to her customers which will enable her to make more profits and meet the demands of her customers. Helen is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. She thanks Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their support.

loans.use: To buy more lubricant to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Ma Vanny's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma V. is the group leader of eleven people who all live in Oknha Pang village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 42-year-old widow without any children and she is a nurse in the local village.  In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy medicine to sell and cure her patients.  Thus, Mrs. Ma V. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.  

Of the group, Mrs. Men S. C. did not come to take her loan, but her husband came, so he is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell and cure her patients.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Nueva Ilusion, todas somos mujeres muy luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarnos, nuestra meta es poder hacer crecer nuestros negocios para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder optar a una mejor calidad de vida para nosotras, nuestros esposos e hijos, para nosotras la familia es lo mas importante y tenemos que sacar nuestras familias adelante, nuestras actividades son:
Gloria L.: soy la coordinadora del grupo y tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio que es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, mi negocio tiene bastante demanda ya que las tortillas son un alimento indispensable en nuestras comidas.
Eloisa Z.: ella tiene una venta de golosinas, ya dias que tiene su negocio, ella necesita el credito para acondicionar mejor su negocio, compra de utencilios para hacer las comidas.
Cyntia R.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de Baleadas, este tipo de comida es muy vendido en nuestro pais, ya que las baleadas se comen en el desayuno y la cena.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the "Nueva Ilusion" group. We all are hard-working, responsible women with a big desire to do better in life. Our goal is to be able to make our business grow and have better profits and like that be able to choose a better quality of life for us, our husbands and our children. Family is the most important thing for us and we want to support them. Our activities are: Gloria L.: I am the coordinator of the group and I had the business of production and sales of tortillas for 5 years. My business has quite a lot of demand since tortillas are an indispensable food in our meals. Eloisa Z.: She sells candies. She needs the loan to condition better her business and buy the utensils to make the candies. Cyntia R.: She makes and sells Baleadas (flour tortillas filled with mashed fried beans), this type of meal is very popular in our country, since baleadas are eaten during breakfast and dinner.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for the production of corn and wheat tortillas and buy the ingredients to make candies.

loans.name: Mr. Peng Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan.  The seventeen members live in Damrei Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. 

Mr. Peng T. is a 56-year-old widower with three children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. Mr. Peng T. is a village bank president and group leader. He owns a rice mill. He also owns a 1 hectare farm on which he cultivate rice for a living. He does not have enough money to buy rice seeds this season. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase thE.. The loan will also allow him to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase his crop yield.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Zebijon

texts.en:
Zebijon is a hard-working woman and since 2005 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Kanibadam. She characterizes herself as happy and humble. She started her business with savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of 2 children whom she would like to offer an education as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working at hard labor. To realize this dream, Zebijon is now requesting 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 6 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buying more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia C. desde hace cuatro años se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos en su propia casa de habitación y en ocasiones vendidos ambulantemente en lugares donde ella piensa que puede realizar las ventas.

Se ha dedicado actualmente a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ha hecho uso de los crédito brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando la aprobación del crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y así continuar mejorando en su negocio.
texts.en:
For four years Mrs. Lucrecia C. has worked at her business selling electrical appliances from her own home and sometimes works as a street vendor in places where she thinks she can make sales. She currently has been working very hard and has made use of the loans granted by Ceprodel. Now she has come once more to Ceprodel hoping for loan approval to buy electrical appliances to continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras nace hace cerca de dos años, después del fin de otro comité. Varias señoras se unieron y decidieron formar un nuevo comité en el barrio y les fue muy bien hasta ahora. No tienen atrasos y tienen un ahorro de más de dos millones. Ellas realizan actividades para ayudar a alivianar el pago de las cuotas. Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de artículos en el barrio en el cual residen.  Trabajan así como en el centro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo como en otros B. de la misma ciudad. 

En promedio reciben cada una 666.667 gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales


Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
1	Ysidora Galván	Venta de Carbón
2	Rossana V.	Masajista
3	María Galván (NO SE ENCUENTRA EN LA FOTOGRAFIA)		Despensa
4	María B.	Venta de ropas
5	Gladys R.	Despensa
6	Inocencia M.	Venta de comidas y bebidas 
7	Ruth T.	Venta de ropas
8	Antonia V.	Despensa
9	Beatriz B.	Venta de lencería
10	Carmen V.	Modista
11	Carolina M.	Venta de lencería y ropas
12	Gricelda A.	Venta de jugos naturales
13	María D.	Venta de comidas
14	Sixta S.	Venta de bebidas
15	Andrea M.	Venta de lencería
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras Group was created two years ago, after an earlier group was disbanded. Several of the earlier group's members got together and decided to form a new group for their neighbourhood, and everything has gone very well for these women since then. They have never been late with their payments and even have collective savings of 2 million gs. Each of the women runs a business and all of them help make the payments. The group's members dedicate themselves to a variety of activities, selling products in their neighbourhood, in the center of San Lorenzo city. On average, they will each receive 666,667 gs. which they will use to buy the products they sell in their respective shops and stalls. Ysidora Galván sells charcoal; Rossana V. is a masseuse; Antonia V., Gladys R., and María Galván (who is not in the photograph) run grocery stores; María B., Ruth T., Andrea M., Carolina M., and Beatriz B. sell clothing and lingerie; Carmen V. is a tailor; María D. and Inocencia M. sell meals; and Gricelda A. and Sixta S. sell drinks and natural juices.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lingerie, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, wine, beer, cloth, sugar, beans, rice, oils, and cosmetics

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance D. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a trader. Constance uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Constance sells used clothing in Abura, which she has done since 2005. Constance will use this loan as additional capital to enable her to increase her sales of used clothing to meet the increase in demand from her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Constance plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in used clothing.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou G. est mariée, 47 ans avec 7 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle tient un commerce en détail de divers produits alimentaires comme légume,pate d'arachide, huile de palme sur étal au marché. Elle a pour objectif de renforcer son capital et d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kadiatou G. is married, 47 years of age, and is raising 7 children. She has a little shop selling various foodstuffs such as vegetables, peanut butter, palm oil in a little stand in the market. Her goal is to bolster her working capital and improve living conditions, as well as the health of her family, and pay school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, peanut butter, and palm oil for retail sale

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa region of Lebanon with her husband and their six children. Fida has been working as a chocolatier since 2006. Fida has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and accessories for her work. This is the first time that Fida has requested a loan.

Fida considers herself special because she does her work well and knows how to satisfy her clients’ needs. She decided on starting her businesses because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: Fida will use the loan to purchase chocolate-designing merchandise and accessories.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian sells provisions and medicines in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 29 years old and married with one child.

Vivian hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more provisions and medicines to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

loans.name: Mulakat

texts.en: Mulakat is 38 years old and married with four children. She is sitting close to her husband in the picture. She has a shop where she sells foodstuffs and she also has a machine for grinding tomatoes, pepper and beans.  She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rose Nankya Group

texts.en: Rose is the leader of a group of 4 members. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children, aged 13 and 16. Both her children go to school. She resides in a rented three-roomed house, where she is staying with five people. Rose doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, in the outskirts of Kampala. Rose sells charcoal at Ndeeba market, in one of Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get the charcoal from villages. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Rose has been with MCDT for over six years and now requesting her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal.  Rose is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and offloading a full lorry of charcoal.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Elias R.

texts.en:
Elias R. L. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old, and married with six adult-aged children. To make a living, Elias owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Elias has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Elias joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elias is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his seventh from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business and to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
La señora MARIA FRANCISCA A. D. R.    tiene 60 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3º D. secundaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales no depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Maria  se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza como: talcos, colonias, perfumes, cremas, labiales, etc los cuales los distribuye en diferentes puestos del mercado D. Laredo y también venD. a sus familiares y amistades.
 Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas productos D. belleza para aumentar su stock.
 Con este crédito D. 900 nuevos soles lo invertirá en compra D. mas productos D. belleza y también ropa para niños y adultos, los cuales tambien distribuira en los puestos del mercado D. Laredo y también los vendera a sus amistades y famliares.
Maria tiene como sueño tener un puesto propio en un centro comercial en el Distrito D. Trujillo, donD. pueda vender sus productos D. belleza y ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca A. D. R. is 60. She lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. This entrepreneur completed her third year of high school. She has three children who are not economically dependent upon her. Maria sells beauty products like powders, colognes, perfumes, creams and lipsticks, etc. She distributes them to different stands in the Laredo market. She also sells to family and friends. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought more beauty products to increase her stock. With this loan for 900 PEN she will buy more beauty products and clothing for children and adults. She will distribute them to the stands in the Laredo market as well as selling to friends and families. Maria’s dream is to have her own stand where she can sell her beauty products and clothes in a commercial center in the Trujillo district.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more beauty products and clothing for children and adults, which she will distribute in the Laredo market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Phoeurk

texts.en: Mrs. Phoeurk K., born in 1989 and now living in Slaeng Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she needs a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field to make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Keo Mean, owns a small ship that transports goods and passengers. This couple has a child who is yet too young to study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the rice field to make it more productive.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo “Divino Niño Jesús” están representadas por la señora Mery Ines y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, ropa, comidan y a actividades como el servicio de peluquería, carpintería y panadería. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desde su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios y al incremento de su mercadería para ofrecer al M. un producto de mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas de las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinde a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mery Ines represents the Divino Niño Jesús group, which is comprised of 12 members. They are in their second cycle with the Institution. They demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead in order to keep growing with the economic support the Institution offers them. The majority of the members sell products like cosmetics, clothes, and food. They also are involved in activities like hairdressing services, carpentry, and a bakery. The effort they have been making since their first cycle is recently starting to bear fruit. The newly needed loan is for business growth and an increase in merchandise to be able to offer a better quality and more competitive product to the market. The members’ expectations are to have a productive business that gives their families a better quality of life and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Dania es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Dania es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Dania tiene un kiosco dentro de la ciudad universitaria en donde brinda servicio de fotocopiado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, además vende golosinas.
Dania necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y papel.
Los sueños de Dania son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de golosinas y papel.

loans.name: Williams

texts.en: Williams A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. Williams is a woodworker who does carpentry, joinery and other construction work at Kwamikrom. He has done this since 2001. Williams is single-handedly responsible for all the financial expenses of his family. Williams will use the loan to purchase more seasoned wood to work with. With the new profits from his expanded business, Williams plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more of the seasoned wood

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. S. is 40 years old and a resident of the Pursat province, Cambodia. To earn a living, S. sells firewood that he harvests, from the forest. He has been running his business since 2000, and is typically earning an average of $3 per day. S. is married with three children who are dependent on him and they are also going to school. His wife stays at home to care for the children and also sells a few groceries for a profit. S. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase a water buffalo to connect with a cart to serve as his wood harvesting transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo for wood transportation.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal del departamento de León, la señora Ofelia del Carmen L. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa la que es comercializada por ella misma vendiendo todo tipo de ropa en su establecimiento que aunque no presta las condiciones necesarias para la actividad, ella se esfuerza para realizar sus ventas acá.

Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la mercadería como lo es la ropa para viajar a la capital y comprarla y de esta manera comercializarla en su establecimiento para seguir buscando la manera de mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
At the Terminal Market in the department of León, Sra. Ofelia del Carmen L. sells different types of clothing from her establishment. However, her location does not provide the necessary conditions for her business, but she still strives to make sales.

She is requesting a loan so that she can go to the capital to buy merchandise and bring it back to her establishment to sell. This will enable her to improve the financial condition of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Pepe Jun

texts.en:
Hog raising is the hobby of Mr. Pepe Jun V. who is 27 years of age, single, and a resident of Polao, Tangub City. He is also a skilled electronics technician specializing in appliances and other electronic equipment with an average net income of not less than P3,200 a month. He has been engaged in this kind of job for eight years already.

Pepe Jun joined Paglaum MPC because he wanted to be part of the organization that is considered as one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and one that reaches out to rural communities. For the 3rd time, he is given the privilege of obtaining P25,000 to finance his hog-raising activity, especially in buying feed. The remaining amount will be used for the purchase of additional accessories for his electronics repair shop.

Pepe Jun’s future income will be used for his basic needs and for loan repayments. He is hoping that his piggery will prosper someday.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and additional accessories for his electronics repair business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia P. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cecelia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-three years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month. In 2005, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Popal Wazhma Group

texts.en:
Wazhma is the group leader of Popal Wazhma Group. After working hard she made up a group of four members, each one of them busy in a different task.

Wazhma is married and has three children. She is busy in tailoring and wants to buy more cloth for her business.

The second member is Samira who wants to take a loan for her son who has a fresh-fruit cart. With this loan he wants to buy more fresh fruit.

The third member is Aziza who wants to take a loan for her husband. He has a shop selling video CDs and with this loan he wants to complete his stock.

The last member of this group is Karima who is busy in her embroidery business. With this loan she wants to buy a new machine for embroidering.

So therefore, they made a group. They want to continue their businesses and have requested a group loan. Each member needs 10,000 Afghani to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS. Wazhma is sure that they can repay the loan on time and that she can control the whole group. They would like to thank every body that helps with this process of providing loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Carolina Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote del departamento de León, la señora Carolina A. se ha dedicado con gran esfuerzo a laborar a diario con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a sus dos hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y también debe velar por el bienestar de su mamá.

Ella necesita invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y pago de colegio para uno de sus hijos porque este va a iniciar sus estudios en este nuevo año. Por este motivo es que ella está solicitando un crédito para dar lugar a la inversión en los estudios de su hijo para que este llegue a ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Carolina A. lives in Nagarote, León department. She works hard every day to earn sustenance for her home and provide for the well-being of her two children. She is a single mother who must also care for her own mother. She needs to get school supplies and pay tuition for one of her sons because he is going to start a new school term. She is requesting funding to pay for his schooling so that he will become a great professional some day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her son's schooling.

loans.name: Edwuin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Edwuin Antonio S. C. es originario del municipio de condega del departamento de Estelí, él es trabajador de ceprodel y tiene un año de estar laborando como oficial de crédito urbano del departamento de Estelí se le otorgo el crédito para la realización de un curso de titulación en su carrera de ingeniería agropecuaria ya que el no posee el suficiente recurso para pagar el postgrado y él necesita con urgencia recibir el diplomado ya que se le presenta la oportunidad.
Edwuin saco su carrera con la ayuda de su mama. Ella es comerciante ya que se dedica a vender comiderias

Edwuin es casado y no tiene hijos sus padres no viven con el pero el siempre los ayuda ya que gracias a ellos él tiene su carrera y dice que siempre estará con ellos apoyándolos. Este es el  primer crédito que se le otorga a Edwuin y plantea que le servirá de mucho ya que  es un gasto muy importante él cual le ayudará a culminar su carrera  y nos expresa que está agradecido con ceprodel por la ayuda que se le esta brindando por lo que desea  seguir trabajando para la institución en todas sus labores y recompensar de esa forma el apoyo que se le esta dando.
texts.en:
Sr. Edwuin Antonio S. C. is a native of the City of Condega in the Department of Estelí. He is an employee of CEPRODEL and has been working for the past year as an urban loan officer in the Department of Estelí. Edwuin has been granted a loan so that he can complete his degree in agricultural engineering. Since he does not have sufficient resources to pay for his courses and has the urgent need to receive his diploma, this opportunity presented itself to him. Edwuin quit his job working for his mother. She was a businesswoman who managed an eatery.

Edwuin is married and does not have children. Even though his parents do not live with him, they have always been a great help and he is thankful for that. Edwuin has his career and says that he will always be there to help his parents. This is the first loan that he has received and plans to use the proceeds to cover this major expense that will help get his degree. He says that he is grateful to CEPRODEL for providing assistance. Edwuin hopes to continue working for the Institution in its mission and repay the support that has been given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the courses needed to complete his degree

loans.name: Mildred Maria

texts.es:
Mildred María P. es propietaria del negocio “Peluquería Unisex Mildred María” ubicado en el  barrio Abajo de Barranquilla, sector de gran tradición carnavalera pues allí surgió la comparsa más antigua de un disfraz insigne del Carnaval “La Marimonda”. Ella tiene un hijo de 21 años que estudia en la Universidad y es su máxima motivación que la lleva a dedicarse con esmero y profesionalismo en su trabajo como peluquera, esta actividad la inició tiempo después de haber estado empleada en una peluquería, donde adquirió gran parte de su experiencia que plasmó en un negocio propio y que hoy ha perfeccionando con estudios y actualización permanente.  
Para Mildred la peluquería es un buen negocio porque genera ingresos inmediatos y es el lugar donde puede expresar su vocación de servicio y ofrecer belleza, glamour e imagen a sus clientes en todas las edades; en su negocio  tiene una vitrina donde exhibe productos cosméticos que sus clientes requieren, como accesorios, champú, ganchos, tratamientos para cabellos. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está solicitando $1.393.000 para comprar un computador que necesita tanto su hijo como su negocio, pues puede ayudarla a controlar sus cuentas. Con su anterior crédito compró una vitrina, modernizó su  plancha de cabellos y el resto lo invirtió en productos cosméticos que llenaron su nueva vitrina.
Su sueño más adelante es comprar su casa propia y convertir su peluquería en un centro de atención estética, por eso siempre está pendiente de los cursos que tiene el Sena y dispuesta a hacer los esfuerzos para actualizar sus conocimientos, porque ante los retos y las dificultades nunca se ha dado por vencida.
texts.en:
Mildred María P. is the owner of “Peluquería Unisex Mildred María” (Mildred María’s Unisex Salon), which is located in the neighborhood of Abajo de Barranquilla. This area is known for its great Carnival tradition and for being the birthplace of the oldest Carnival troupe that is known for its costumes of “La Marimonda” (a mythical monkey-like creature). Mildred has a 21 year old son who is a university student. He is the motivation that spurs her to work with great care and professionalism in her salon. She started this business after having been employed at another beauty parlor, where she gained most of the experience that she utilizes at her own establishment. Mildred continues to refine her skills through self-study and by modernizing her techniques.

A beauty salon is a good business for Mildred because it generates immediate revenue and gives her a place to demonstrate her commitment to service by offering beauty, glamour, and image advice to customers of all ages. In her business, Mildred also has display cases stocked with beauty products that her customers need such as accessories, shampoos, hair clips, and hair treatments. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She is requesting 1,393,000 COP in order to buy a computer for her son. Mildred will also use it to keep track of her business accounts. With her previous loan, she bought a display case, modern curling irons, and beauty products to fill her new display case.

To get ahead, Mildred dreams of buying a house and converting her salon into an aesthetics center. She is always looking for courses offered through SENA (the National Learning Service) so that she can update her knowledge. Mildred has never given up when faced with challenges and difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa y para la atención cuenta con la ayuda de su sobrino en la atención, Elizabeth trabaja en un centro de salud.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para repotenciar las maquinas.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y ampliar su negocio con mas servicios.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank "Nobleza." She is single, 40 years old, and has a son. Elizabeth has an internet parlor in her home, and to attend to her customers she counts on the help of her nephew. Elizabeth works in a health center. Elizabeth needs a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to upgrade her computers. Elizabeth dreams of buying land where she can build a home, and expanding her business with more services.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to upgrade her computers

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
Braulio es natural D. la ciudad D. Yucay, tiene 64 años, tiene siete hijos D. las cuales seis son independientes pero también tiene una hija adoptiva, ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus menores hijos. 

Braulia es enfermera jubilada  trabajó 25 años para la posta D. salud D. la ciudad D. Quillabamba y actualmente se dedica a  la venta D. verduras como por zanahorias, cebolla china, etc. Ella lleva sus productos a vender los días martes, jueves y sábados a la ciudad del Cusco.  

Braulia requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas como por ejemplo, zapallo, papas, cebollas, platanos, naranjas, etc.  

Braulia pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna D. los Ángeles”, ella es una D. las fundadoras del banco comunal. El anhelo D. la socia es que su hija Mercedes que estudio la carrera profesional D. turismo en al Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco se gradué en el mes D. Junio.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Braulio is a native of the city of Yucay. She is 64 years old, and she has seven children. Six of them are independent. She also has an adopted daughter. She is a responsible mother who is looking every minute for opportunities to get ahead. She uses her daily effort to give her minor children a better future. Braulia is a retired nurse. She worked for 25 years for the Health Post in the city of Quillabamba. She currently sells vegetables like carrots and green onions, etc. She takes her products to the city of Cusco to sell on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. Braulia needs the loan to buy vegetables and fruit like zucchini, potatoes, onions, bananas, and oranges, etc. Braulia belongs to the Reyna D. los Ángeles Communal Bank. She is one of the founders of the communal bank. Her wish is for her daughter, Mercedes, who studied the professional career of tourism in the San Antonio Abad National University of Cusco, to graduate in June. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and fruit like zucchini, potatoes, onions, bananas, and oranges, etc.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya, 36 years old and divorced, lives with her two children and her father in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her father, who is retired, is very supportive and looks after her two-year-old son in their home. Her oldest son, Altangerel, is 15 years old and attends a local secondary school.

Altantuya has been working hard to provide a better life for her family. She operates a beauty products business at a local trading center called Mandal. She started her business in 2008 with working capital of 500,000 tugrug (~ 365 USD), and over the years has used her earnings to expand her business to include selling clothes in addition to beauty products at her counter. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,450,000 tugrugs (~ 1060 USD).

She is a very hardworking person, and her business and family are so important to her. Altantuya says, “I started saving money to pay university tuition fees for my oldest son. I am also working hard to create my own clothing trading shop in the future.” She is now requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 732 USD) loan to purchase beauty products and a large amount of clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo S. C., tiene la edad de 30 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres y un hermano. El crédito lo quiere para preparar el terreno para sembrar los tubérculos, específicamente tiquisque, la idea es además de darle mantenimiento al cultivo, comprar insumos y realizar trabajos dentro del cultivo. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al terreno sembrado de tiquisque, el cual cuenta con un buen desarrollo, para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Eduardo  trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Eduardo S. C. is 30 years old, is single, and lives with his parents and one brother. He is applying for a loan to prepare land for planting tubers, specifically yautia. The plan is furthermore, to maintain the field, buy materials, and complete work on the fields. He wants to give proper maintenance to the land planted with yautia, so that he can count on good development and thus obtain the greatest income possible at harvest time. This is the first time that he will receive a loan from FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with their services. Don Eduardo has worked in agriculture for a number of years. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and better economic stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant yautia

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun V. is 52 years old and lives in Damnak Reachea village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Kimly Ros, is construction worker. Mrs. Noeun V. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for family transportation. This couple has three children: one is a car mechanic, one is a government worker, and the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher P. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old. Christopher is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Christopher owns & operates motorcycle transport services business. Christopher has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christopher joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christopher is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Christopher from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac H. T. is a 19-year-old pepper producer who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. Isaac is a dedicated producer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of Cayenne peppers. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the morning, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and taking care of younger siblings. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvest and planting – working the land as needed. The land they work is their own.

 In addition to his agricultural activity, Isaac spends some days working as a labourer in the nearby orange producing factory in order to supplement the family income, but this work is sporadic. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and buys food. The rural zone where Isaac and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. Isaac is working hard for the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labour. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Isaac and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbours help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole. This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labour and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Isaac with the help of his family members in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles, located in the Northern Region of Costa Rica. Isaac will need roughly one year before his peppers will reach maturity and be ready for harvest. 

The main factor that has stood in the way of increasing his production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity for Isaac, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, there is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Isaac wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighbourhood.

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine (pictured with her 2-year-old child) is a hard-working farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya. She has been practising mixed farming for the last 10 years and produces tea, vegetables and milk which she sells locally.

Josephine is 38 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 2 and 18. Three of her children are currently attending school. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough capital to engage in other businesses.

She recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.30,000 and has requested this new loan of KES.60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. With this loan, the family's income will increase through the sale of milk and thus ease the burden of paying school fees.

In 5 years' time, she would like to purchase a pick-up truck to transport milk and other farm products to the market. She would like Juhudi to diversify their loan products in future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño hace un año y los prestamos son D. mucha ayuda para su negocio.
Yolanda es casada y tiene 3 hijas que estudian, Yolanda viaja a dos ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. abarrotes los demás días. Solicita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y fideo.
Yolanda sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales titulados y tener una tienda en local estable.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been a member of the Retono community bank for a year and loans have greatly helped her business. She is married and has 3 children, all in school. She goes to markets in the region to buy basic foodstuffs and spends the rest of her days at the Magdalena market, selling what she bought. Yolanda is applying for a 2000-soles loan that she will use to buy rice, sugar and pasta. Yolanda's greatest hopes are that her children find steady work and that she have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Grimaneza

texts.es:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. tiene 27 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Rolando. 

Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita esta préstamo para el trabajo de la agricultura. Con el apoyo del credito mejorara su situación economico de gastos de insumos. 

Le gusta jugar con su hijo en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Rosa Grimaneza Q. T. is 27 years old. She is married and lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has 1 son whose name is Rolando. Rosa is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús rural bank. There are 15 members in total and most of them work in agriculture. Rosa works in agriculture growing corn and cacao. She buys and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is asking for this loan for the agricultural work. With the support of this loan, she will improve her financial situation with the materials costs. She likes to play with her son in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Esther Maritza

texts.es:
Esther de 33 años, ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”) y vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Comenzó hace 3 año con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio, mercadería y que sus cuatro hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and has a paper goods store, (known as a "bazar" in Ecuador). She lives in "Fortín de Guayaquil" (suburban zone made up of land and slopes). Three years ago she began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances so that she could support her family. When she saved enough money to start her store, she set up an area in the front part of her home, where she works from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM every day. She will use the money from this loan to buy notebooks, pens, and display cases for her business. She wants to expand her business in the future and would like her four children to attain professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is a 48-year-old single mother of two who lives in Heredia, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica with her children. 

Ana runs a small store which is attached to her house. She offers products such as toilet paper, cleaning products, car products as well as photocopying services.  Her clients consist mainly of local community members. Ana has been running her business over the past 4 years. 

 Ana plans to use this loan to invest in the diversification of the products she has to offer her customers. In an effort to meet the needs of a more varied clientele, she will be purchasing jewellery items (necklaces, bracelets) as well as school supplies (books, pencils, notepads). 

Ana wakes up every day at 5:30 AM, she prepares breakfast for her children, and carries out various domestic chores.  She opens her store at 8 AM and tends to the needs of her customers throughout the day. At midday, Ana takes her lunch and at 4 PM her children return from school. At this point, Ana juggles the tasks of mother and store owner until closing time at 8 PM. 

Ana´s goal is to offer more variety to her clients in terms of products. She wants her business to grow, increase revenue to a level where the family could be self-sufficient, depending only on the store's income. She hopes to one day pass on a successful business to her children.
 
A constraining factor in Ana´s life has been  the death of her son 2 years ago. She has been dependent on the support of her family to get through emotionally difficult times.

loans.use: For the purchase of store inventory such as jewellery and school supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old. Nenita is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is a market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells women’s clothing in one the biggest central marketplace of her home town. Lamara has raised two sons who are grown now and live separately. She started her trade 12 years ago. Currently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas invested in business. 

Lamara is seeking a loan of 5,600 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and thus increase her income as a result. She is hoping to re-stock her inventory with fall/winter clothing items. Lamara is planning to re-invest generated profit in reconstruction of one of the vending locations that she owns and keep her business running efficiently in the future.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
El clienta Mayra Del Socorro P. Martínez. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Del Centro De Salud 75 Varas Al Oeste, Es Soltera  trabaja actual mente en MINSA santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como Enfermera Asistente tiene 16 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de ladrillo y sementó para su vivienda el cual tiene propuesto construir una nueva pieza.  
Esto le permitirá que la clienta pueda obtener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
The client Mayra del Socorro P. M.lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon in the León area about 75 yards from the Centro de Salud (Health Center).  She is single and currently works in MINSA (a wheat flour factory) as an assistant nurse and has worked in this institution for sixteen years.  
The client has her own home which she would like to improve.  The loan will be used to buy bricks and cement for her home so that she can add onto it.  This will allow her to have a better life with her her family.

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement for her home.

loans.name: Zahida Yaneth

texts.es: Zahida Yaneth G. D. de 25 años de edad, es una joven madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Zahida posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa.
